"Say, Stacy", said Amanda, handing Stacy the phone. "I know I'm not your first choice of company. Why don't call a couple of your friends over - tell them to come by after supper, in about an hour or so?"

"OK, thanks, Amanda", said Stacy, thinking that maybe Amanda wasn't such a bad sort after all. She called her two friends, Jessica and Ana, and asked them to come by.

"Jessica's going to come by in about an hour", she said. "But Ana won't be able to get here for two hours. Is that OK?"

"Why, that will be perfect", said Amanda. "And now, let's think about getting you your supper."

Amanda went out to the kitchen. Stacy shook her head. She'd been enjoying having Amanda scratch her. Idly, she strolled over to the mirror that hung in the hall, and then gasped as she saw her ears.

"My ears!" she shrieked. "Wuh's happened to my ears?"

"What's that dear?" said Amanda. "I couldn't quite make it out."

"Muh earthe!" Said Stacy. She was finding it hard to speak. To her horror, her tongue began to loll out of her mouth.

"Muh tung!" she said. "Wuh's happnin tuh muh tung?"

"Never mind that, dear" said Amanda. "Come and get your dinner."

Stacy found herself compelled to walk out to the kitchen. She saw Amanda setting a bowl of what looked like dog food on the floor.

"Wuh's dat?"

"Your dinner, dear. Eat up."

"Ah yoo crathy? Um naw eatin dat!"

"Nonsense, dear. Doesn't it smell good?"

To Stacy's horror, it did smell good! Helplessly, she fell to her hands and knees in front of the dish. With all her strength, she willed herself not to eat the food, but her treacherous tongue began shoveling the stuff into her mouth. It tasted so good! As she ate, she felt her mouth move forward, as though eager to get closer to the food. She quickly devoured it all, licking the bowl clean. She put a hand to her face and yelped as she realized that she now had a dog's muzzle!

She tried to speak, but no matter how she tried, only canine sounds emerged. Amanda called her over.

"Come here, Stacy." Stacy found her legs carrying her over to where the older woman stood. Why was she obeying her so helplessly? Why wouldn't her body do what she wanted it to do? She looked at Amanda inquiringly.

"Yes, dear", Amanda said. "I'm afraid it is me doing this to you. I don't supose it's much comfort to you, but I'm not doing it to you for fun, or even because I want to. Now take off your clothes. There's no point it them getting them ruined while you change."

Stacy felt her arms move as if of their own accord, removing her clothing. Soon she stood naked before the other woman. Stacy noticed that things seemed to look - different somehow. She went and looked in the mirror - her head had completely changed into that of a German Shepherd! She barked fearfully at that image.

"Hush, girl!" said Amanda. "Come here."

Again, Stacy found herself obeying.

"Sit, girl! I don't want you falling and hurting yourself when your legs change."

Stacy sat on her haunches like a dog. She felt a weird pushing at the base of her spine. She looked back - she'd grown a tail!

"What a magnficent tail!" said Amanda. "Oh, Stacy, what a beautiful dog you're going to be!" Stacy's tail wagged, as though of its own volition. Her legs began to feel funny.

"Roll over on your side, dear, it will be more comfortable."

Stacy did as she was told and watched in shock as her feet shrank into paws, and her legs and pelvis began to re-orient themselves into canine contours. When this was complete, fur grew, covering her body from the waist down. She sat up again. Now, only her arms, hands and upper torso remained human. Part of her mind reflected on how bizarre she must look. The change began to move up her body. Her breasts vanished, replaced by canine nipples. Her arms became forelegs, and finally her hands re-shaped themselves into paws. Amanda looked at Stacy.

"I was right" she said, snapping collar attached to a leash around Stacy's neck. "You've become a beautiful dog. Come on, girl."

Amanda led Stacy out into the back yard, where stood three doghouses that Stacy had never seen before. Amanda detached the leash from Stacy's collar and attached a chain that was fastened to the doghouse in its place. She filled a water bowl from the garden hose and set it before the dog.

"You be good, Stacy", said Amanda. "I have to go get ready for your friends."

With that, Amanda went back into the house. Stacy fought furiously. Her friends! Was Amanda going to do this to her friends, too? Why else were there three doghouses? She had to do something! Stacy strained and strained, but the chain was too strong for her to break. She tried to dislodge the collar with her forepaws, but it wouldn't budge. She could at least make noise! She began to bark fiercely. However, Amanda stuck her head out the back door and said:

"Hush, girl! Be quiet and stay quiet!"

Stacy's mouth snapped shut with a click. She found she could whine and growl softly, but despite her best efforts, she could do no more. Dejectedly, she slunk into the doghouse and lay down.

Inside the house, Amanda rinsed the dish Stacy had eaten from and checked to see that she had all of her powders and formulae in order. It paid to be prepared, after all. A short while later, Amanda heard the doorbell ring. She answered the door, and saw that it was...


Who is at the door? Is it...
11513.title: Stacy's ears grow pointy and into German Sh...

115131.content:
Amanda answered the door, smiling. Outside was a tall girl about Amanda's age, with frizzy brown hair.

"Hi", she said. "I'm Jessica Alvarez, Amanda's friend."

"Do come in, dear", said Amanda. " I'm Amanda, Stacy told me you were coming. As Jessica hung up her coat, Amanda sprinkled a fine powder over her head. Jessica didn't seem to notice.

"Have a seat, Jessica. Stacy stepped out for a moment, but I'm sure she'll be back soon. Can I get you anything? Are you thirsty?"

Jessica had been fine, but the word "thirsty" seemed to echo in her head. Suddenly, she was parched.

"Yes, please, I'd like a glass of water."

"Certainly, dear."

Amanda went into the kitchen and came back with a glass of something that looked and tasted like water, but wasn't. Jessica accepted it with thanks, and drank it down greedily.

"Wow, that really hit the spot. Thanks again!"

"You're quite welcome, dear. Why don't you turn on the television while we're waiting for Stacy? The remote's right over by you."

"Sure", said Jessica. She reached for the remote, but found that she couldn't make her fingers work.

"Is something wrong, Jessica?" asked Amanda.

"I don't know", said the girl. "It's like there's something wrong with my fingers!"

Jessica gasped as her fingers became shorter and stubbier, her nails darkened and curved into claws, and pads began to form on her palms. Fur began to grow on what were now her paws.

"Oh, my God, what's happening to me?"

"It's interesting", said Amanda, "how the change happens differently each time."

"'Each time'?" said Jessica. "You've seen this before?"

"Oh, yes", said Amanda. "Just a short while ago when I changed Stacy."

""You changed Stacy'?" said Jessica, so astonished that she didn't notice the change spreading up her arms. "You're doing this?"

"Yes, dear", came the reply. "If it's any consolation, it's not my choice, and it's nothing personal."

"'Nothing personal'?" screamed Jessica. Her arms had now completely changed into a dog's forelimbs. "You're crazy! I'm getting out of here!"

With that she ran over to the door. However, she quickly found that her paws were useless to open the securely-locked door. She turned to Amanda.

"Let me me out of here, now!"

"No", said Amanda. " Now stop that noise and come over here, now."

To her surprise, Jessica found her legs carrying her back over to where Amanda now stood. Amanda spoke again.

"Now hold still while I undress you." Jessica found herself incapable of moving.

"'Undress' me? Why?"

"It's easier to observe the change that way", said Amanda, as she quickly but gently removed Jessica's clothing.

Jessica began to cry as a coat of brown fur began to grow on her torso, even as it re-shaped itself into that of a dog.

"Why are you doing this to me?"

"Just bad luck on your part, dear. I used my powers to find a suitable initial candidate, then I used them again to influence her parents to hire me, then I influenced her to summon girls that would be suitable. Not really her fault, or her parents'. They weren't exactly free agents in all of this. Really, I'm not even 'free'. Blame the Fates, if you like. In the end, those three make us all dance for them."

Amanda led Jessica over to the full-length mirror hanging in the hall. Jessica moaned as she saw her nose darken and then lengthen, moving outward from her face. Her lower jaw followed suit, her teeth sharpened, and her tongue thinned out and lengthened. Soon she had a perfectly-formed canine muzzle. She felt a tingling at the base of her spine, and soon a tail thrust itself out of her hindquarters. Next, she found herself rising up onto the balls of her feet as her toes began re-shaping themselves into paws. Amanda steadied her as her legs began to re-form into those of a dog, lowering the girl gently to the ground once her limps had assumed a completely quadrupedal configuration. The change was now complete, except for her ears. Amanda was nonplussed. The sight of an otherwise fine-looking German Shepherd with human ears was bizarre, even to her! However, the ears soon changed, and the transformation was complete. Amanda slipped a leash onto the girl, and led her towards the back door.

Out in the back yard, Stacy's mind was awash in fear and confusion. Was she going to be stuck like this forever? What was Amanda doing to her friends? It didn't help that her new canine senses were overwhelming her with a brace of new sensations. The new smells alone were making her crazy! Worse still, there was a part of her that was becoming more and more comfortable as a dog! What if she lost her human intelligence? What if she forgot she'd ever been human? She perked up as she saw the back door open. Her tail began wagging at the sight of Amanda. Stacy was horrified! She was reacting like a dog at the sight of its owner! She whined unhappily as she saw that Amanda was leading another German Shepherd like herself. She caught the new dog's scent, and to her horror, she realized that the new dog was Jessica, transformed just as she was! Amanda led Jessica over and chained her up to the doghouse next to Jessica's.

"Now, you girls be good and be quiet. I have to go get ready to meet our final guest. Don't worry, it'll be time for the final step soon."

With that, Amanda went back into the house. Stacy wondered frantically what she had meant by the "final step". She looked over at Jessica and whined as apologetically as she could. How she wished they could speak together - maybe even plan. Jessica looked at her, her tail wagging feebly. Stacy placed one of her forepaws over one of Stacy's. She was pleased to she that her friend didn't pull away. She hoped that meant that Jessica didn't blame her for the fix they were in.

Back in the house, Amanda prepared to receive her next guest. She hoped that this unpleasant business would soon be over. She prayed to the Fates that everything would go smoothly, and hoped that they were listening for once. Shortly, the doorbell rang. Forcing a smile onto her face, Amanda answered it.


Who is at the door? Is it...
115131.title: ...Jessica?

choices: Ana resists, and gets the back gate open!
Ana obeys, and returns to Amanda's side!
1151311.content:
Amanda opened the door to a short, dark-haired girl.

"Hi, I'm Ana Nomura, Stacy's friend. Is she here?"

"Hello, Ana, I'm Amanda, I'm staying with Stacy while her parents are away. Do come in, Stacy and Jessica stepped out for a moment, but they'll be back soon."

Ana came in, and again, as she hung up her coat, Amanda sprinkled some fine powder over her head. After seeing Ana seated on the couch, Amanda spoke to the girl.

"Can I get you anything, dear?"

"Yes, please, a Diet Coke, if you have any."

"Coming right up."

Amanda put some ice cubes in a glass, and, after putting in some more of the powder, filled it with soda and brought it over to Ana. Handing the glass to the girl she sat down on a chair opposite her.

"So, tell me, Ana, have you known Stacy and Jessica long?"

Ana sipped the soda thoughtfully. "I've known them since my family moved to this town in fifth grade. They've known each other since kindergarten. How about you? Where are you fro if you don't mind my asking?"

"Oh, I've lived alot of places. A long, long time ago, I lived in Greece, but I haven't been back there in years."

"Do you ever think about going back?"

"Sometimes", aaid Amanda, smiling sadly. "Maybe I will, someday."

Ana began looking down at her feet.

"Something wrong, Ana?"

"Well - Do you mind if I take my boots off? They feel kind of - loose- somehow. Kind of funny."

"Certainly, dear. Make yourself comfortable."

With some effort. Ana removed her hiking boots. She gasped. Through her woolen socks, she could see that her feet were oddly distended. Removing her socks, she saw that her toes had changed shape, and her toenails had darkened and become rounder and sharper. The contours of her feet were changing. It was as though they were becoming like the paws of a dog! Even as she watched, brown fur began to grow on her feet.

"What's happening to me?"

"The same thing that's already happened to your two friends" said Amanda.

"What? What are you talking about? Are you doing this?"

Amanda couldn't help but be impressed. Ana was shocked and frightened, as anyone would be, but she wasn't panicking.

"Yes, this is my doing, Ana. I'm turning you into a dog."

"What? Why?"

Amanda sighed. "Because my husband ordered it. I'm sure it's no consolation, but I'm not doing this by choice."

"'Because your husband ordered it'? What kind of reason is that? Make it stop! Change it back!"

"Even I cannot stop it now, Ana."

Ana stood up angrily, and then nearly fell over. Standing upright was suddenly very difficult. Amanda held out a hand to steady her. Ana shook off the proferred and managed to find her balance. She turned away and began a slow, careful walk towards the door.

"I'm getting out of here! I'll find a way to stop this"

She moved towards the door at a painfully slow rate. It didn't help that her legs were slowly but steadily changing the whole time. After she had taken a few steps, Amanda spoke.

"Enough, Ana. Stay!" To her horror, Ana found herself unable to move. "Now, come!" Ana found herself beginning to turn back towards Amanda.

"NO!" With everyounce of her will, she fought the urge to obey. After a minute, Ana began to turn towards the door again. Now, it was Amanda's turn to be astonished! However, during this battle of wills, Ana's legs had become completely canine. She nearly fell over when a tail thrust itself out of her hindquarters, dislodging her jeans. With a growl, she stepped out of her pants, and somehow contrived not to fall over. After a few more laborious steps, then change reached her pelvis, and she fell over onto her hands as her rear assumed a quadrupedal configuration. Ana cried out in pain. Amanda spoke again.

"Ana, sit, NOW!"

Without hesitation, Ana's legs plopped her down into a sitting position. she couldn't control them at all! With a renewed effort, she began pulling herself towards the door with her arms. She could feel the change beginning to move up her torso. She knew she very little time left. Amanda watched in shock as Ana reached the door at last. She had to move fast, the change was almost up to her shoulders! As Ana reached for the doorknob, Amanda spoke again, putting more power into her voice.

"Ana, STOP!"

Ana growled again - she was so close, but her arm wouldn't move! Making one last effort, she managed to make her hand move. Even as she fumbled at the knob, the change moved up her arm. The knob was just beginning to turn, when her hands began to change into paws, and she lost her grip. Ana hissed in frustration. What spirit, Amanda thought. She'll have to be the center. She spoke aloud.

"It's over, Ana. Come here."

Only her head still human, Ana found her canine limbs obediently carrying her over to her new mistress. Even as her head began to change, she spoke.

"Damn you", she said. Amanda watched as Ana's ears became pointed and a canine muzzle pushed forward from her face. She sighed as she removed the rest of Ana's clothes and leashed the girl.

"Oh, Ana, that was done a long time ago."

Out in the backyard, Stacy had lost her internal battle against the canine part of her. She still had her human intelligence, but her human memories - though intact - were like something that had belonged to someone else, in a different life. Her horror at what had happened to her, her fear at what would happen to her friends, all had subsided. Jessica was not so far along, but she too was fighting less and less against what she had become.

The two dogs perked up as they heard the back door opening. They saw Amanda coming out, leading another dog. If there was any resistance at all left in Stacy, it finally died beneath the overwhelming joy she felt at the sight of her mistress. Jessica seemed to pick up some of her friend's excitement. She scented the new dog - it was Ana! Amanda brought Ana over to the third doghouse and chained her up to it.

"You girls be quiet and be good. I have some final preparations to make, and then I'll be back for you."

She went back into the house. Ana tested the chain and snarled as she realized it wouldn't break. she looked at her two friends. she sensed that their spirits were just about broken. She herself could feel her canine nature growing in strength. Using every ounce of mental energy she could muster, she focused on remaining human inside. After some time, Amanda came back out of the house. Ana knew that it was now or never. If she didn't escape now, she'd become a good little dog just as the other two now seemed to be. Methodically, Amanda unchained first Stacy and then Jessica, putitng leashes on them both. When she unchained Ana, Ana jumped at her, causing her to drop the leashes, and then ran for it. To her disappointment, Stacy and Jessica stood happily by while Amanda picked up their leashes. Ana reached the back gate, and began fumbling at the latch with her forepaws. Amanda spoke, with a voice unlike any Ana had ever heard before.

"ANA, HEEL!"



So, what happens next?
1151311.title: ...Ana?

11513112.content:
The sound of Amanda's voice caused Ana to freeze. Even with all of her will focused on one intent, she could not move. Amanda spoke again, and this time her voice echoed inside Ana's head in a way that would brook no disobedience.

Ana turned slowly, and started in shock as she looked at Amanda. Amanda had changed in an indefinable way. It was the same woman, wearing the same clothes, but she now looked somehow ageless - simultaneously scarcely older than Ana herself, and yet somehow impossibly ancient. This was not a normal human being. Whatever she was, she could not be disobeyed. Ana trotted over to where Amanda stood, and meekly let her leash her up again. Amanda spoke:

"As you may have guessed", she said gently, "My name isn't Amanda, and I'm not just another babysitter. My real name is Persephone. Are you familiar with it?"

Ana nodded. Though she was of Japanese descent, she had read up on Greek mythology for school. Persephone, she knew, was the daughter of Ceres. In the old stories, she had been kidnapped by Hades and forced to become his wife. Before the events of this night, it would have been hard to believe that the gods of myth were real. Now, all things considered, it was not so difficult. Amanda - no, Persephone - spoke again:

"Yes, we old gods still exist, though few still believe in us. We still walk the Earth from time-to-time, though not so openly as we did in times past."

While she was speaking, Persephone led the three back into the house. Ana couldn't help but notice that the house looked subtly different. Persephone seemed to read her mind - maybe she actually did!

"Yes, dear, well-spotted. The house does look different. Because I must take you three away from here, never to return, I have removed all traces of your existences, both from all the places that you, Jessica and Stacy have lived, and from the minds of those that have known you. This is what this house would look like if Stacy had never been born. However, for your mothers' sakes, and for the sake of my own mother, who knows only too well what it was like to have her daughter taken away, I have made special 'arrangements'. Fortunately, your mothers are all still young enough and healthy enough. So, I've had a word with Hera and with Aphrodite. Eros will visit your parents wherever they are tonight. Your mothers will find your fathers particularly 'attentive', and your fathers will find your mothers particularly 'receptive'. And in nine months' time, they will have new daughters to replace the ones they will never know that they lost."

Persephone stopped, and for a moment, Ana thought that the goddess was about to cry. Then she shook her head, and led the three over to the cellar door.

Persephone opened the cellar door, and to Ana's surprise, instead of the wooden steps she had seen on previous visits, there were stone steps, wider than should have been possible. Ana looked around as Persephone led them down the steps, They led down to a vast open plain under an overcast sky. Ana could see a river in the distance. When they reached the bottom, Ana looked around and saw that the steps had disappeared, and the plain now extended indefinitely behind them.


Persephone removed the leashes from the girls' collars and arranged th egirls before her, with Ana in the middle and Stacy to her left and Jessica to her right.

"It's the middle head that controls the body", she said, " and you, Ana, being the most spirited, should be the one in control."

Ana puzzled over her words and began to suspect what Persephone meant. The tiny part of her that still was human wanted to shrink back, but she knew there was no hope of defiance now. Persephone looked into the distance, almost dreamily, then spoke again.

"It's so quiet here, now. We see few new souls here, and there's not much for the guardian of the gates of Hades to do. In short, Cerberus is bored. And my husband loves Cerberus, as much as any mortal loves his or her dog, and decreed that something must be done to liven up the creature's life. In other words, a mate must be found for the hound of Hades. This, however, was problematical. Cerberus is unique, as far as we know, and so a mate must needs be created for him. We first sought to work with mortal dogs, but a magical being must have intelligence and imagination, and dogs, though not without these qualities, did not posses them in sufficient quantities. Our 'raw materials' needed to be human, for only humans possessed the required ability to think and imagine. Specifically, they had to be human females: young, intelligent, healthy, and virginal. We consulted the oracles, and they directed us to Stacy. Why? I doubt even Zeus himself could say. However, once we found Stacy, we influenced her parents to go on vacation and to have the idea of hiring a babysitter - me, in other words. From there, it was easy enough to subconsciously influence Stacy to summon two of her friends who were suitable, and the rest, as they say, is history. Anyway, enough exposition. The time has come. I warn you, this won't hurt, but it will probably feel extremely peculiar."

With that, Persephone began to chant in a language that had been ancient in Homer's day. A wind whipped up, and the studs on the dogs' collars began to glow. Ana closed her eyes and began to feel an intense tingling all over her body. She felt energy flowing through her body like water through a firehose, and had the sensation that her two friends were somehow being pushed into the sides of her body.

When the light fade and the winds died down, there was now only one dog standing on the plain before Hades' queen. It stil looked vaguely like a German Shepherd, albeit a three-headed German Shepherd the size of a grizzly bear. Persephone set a shallow golden bowl before each of the dog's heads.

"I am sorry this had to be done to you, my dears. It's small consolation, perhaps, but know that you wil live forever now, and with any luck be the mother of a new race of creatures."


Persephone filled the three bowls with Lethe water.

"Forget now, my dears, the lives that once you led. Remember only that you go now with your mistress to meet your intended."

The creature's three heads obediently lapped up the water.

"You must have a name. I know - a combinination of your old names! From now on, your name is 'Anastassica'!"

Anastassica looked on affectionately as her mistress gathered up the three bowls, then followed at her heels as she walked the distance to the shores of the River Styx. Charon greeted Persephone:

"Good day, Mistress. I see that your mission was successful."

"Indeed, Charon. I hope that my husband will be pleased."

Anastassica ignored the rest of their conversation as she clambered onto Charon's ferry. As he began to guide them across the river, she stood forward and sniffed at the air. Her tail began to wag as she caught the scent of her prospective mate. she could hardly wait to meet him!
11513112.title: Ana obeys, and returns to Amanda's side!

115132.content:
Amanda opened the door to see two people.
'Well, hi there, you must be Jessica'
'No I'm Ana, Jessica is being delayed and the bus was early, and this is my twin brother Jake.'
'Hello,' said Jake
'Stacy told me that we could come around tonight.'
'It's strange she only told me that you were coming, Ana.' said Amanda.
'That happens a lot. If she mentions one of us most of the time she means both of us, don't worry I know Stacy just as well as she does,' replied Jake
'Oh, okay then make yourselves at home, I've got something to do outside, also you sound British.'
'We are, we emigrated here five years ago.' Jake sat in an armchair and started reading a book he brought.
'Why do you always bring a book with you?' Ana asked.
'It's always time for a good book and Stacy is far too sporty to have any good books,' replied Jake.

Outside Amanda was setting up a fourth dog house
I can probably do it to guys, it should work. Amanda thought to herself.

Jake and Ana were looking out of the window looking at the tied up Stacy
'So cute,' said Jake squeeing.
'Yes she is cute but where is Stacy?' asked Ana.
Amanda entered the room, 'So you like her then, they brought it earlier today.'
'Sorry, but have you seen Stacy?' asked Ana.
'She went to the toilet, she should be down soon.' as soon as she said that one of the twins started to transform

Amanda chuckled. She reached in her bag and pulled out a bottle.

"I'm going to go unpack now, but I brought you a little drink I made. I hope you like it." Amanda said as she got up and left the room.

Stacy hesitated for a moment, but trusted Amanda enough to drink it in one gulp. Wow. That was delicious. It was so delicious, it made Stacy remarkably happy!

115222.content: Without thinking twice Stacey get down on all fours feeling it was more natural. She walks out to the kitchen to find Amanda. "Like your drink?" Amanda asks. "Yes!" Stacey replied. Amanda bends down and pats Stacey on the head. "Good, come with me with me I have one more thing for you" Amanda tells her. They walk back in the living room and Amanda pulls out a pink collar out of her bag. "Here let me put it on you" Amanda says to her. Stacey happily lets her do so and walks over to the mirror to look at herself. "I love it!" Stacey says excitedly. "Can you help me out of my clothes though? They feel restrictive all of a sudden." Stacey says to Amanda as she kicks her socks off and starts wiggling her shirt off. "Certainly" Amanda says with a grin. She helps Stacey out of her pants, bra, and panties. "Thank you that feels much better" Stacey tells Amanda. "Your welcome. Come on lets get you something to eat" Amanda says.

11531.content:
"I just love Bloodhounds. Their almost exclusively sad look and long ears are just too cute! Plus, their awesome sense of smell is just too cool."

Amanda smiled. Stacy didn't notice her snap her fingers. The spell was cast.

"Well, I'm going to go unpack my things. Stay here, I'll talk to you a little later." Amanda smiled.

Stacy smiled too. This week might not be as bad as I thought.

Or so she thinks...

She smelled a box of Dog Treats Amanda had opened in the kitchen
115311.content:
As Stacy sat on the couch, she felt a wrinkle in her nose. Suddenly, she had a weird thought in her mind.

Stacy sniffed the air, and it was if 1000 smells entered her nose. Stacy sniffed a little more. She had caught the scent. Stacy failed to notice that the more she sniffed the air, the darker and wetter her nose became.

What did Stacy smell?
115311.title: Ain't Nothing but a Hound Dog...

1153112.content:
Stacy continued to sniff, until she got to the kitchen, where she saw Amanda holding an open box of Milkbones. Stacy started to lick her lips.

"Hey there Stacy! Do you want a treat?"

"Yes!" Stacy responded, her tongue staying out of her mouth for a moment, licking her lips once more, as she stared at the milkbones.

Amanda slowly pulled out a single treat out of the box, and Stacy got more excited.

"Can you a trick for me? I'll give you a treat if you give me a trick!"

"Sure, Sure!" Stacy said

"OK, Stacy, I want you to..."
1153112.title: She smelled a box of Dog Treats Amanda had open...

choices: Stacy still speaks english, but starts seeing Amanda as her owner.
11531121.content:
"Sit! Stacy, Sit!" Amanda said as she held the treat above Stacy's head.

Stacy stared at the treat, her tongue now firmly out of her mouth, panting. She was in a trance.

"Stacy... sit!" Amanda tried again.

11532112111.content:
Stacy couldn't resist the smell of the food any longer. As if of their own volition, her legs carried her into the kitchen, She got down on her knees and buried her face in the food bowl. As she ate, the shape of her head began to change. He jaws projected outward into a canine muzzle, and her hair was replaced by brown and white fur. When she finished eating, she lapped up some water as well.When she was done, her head changed completely into that of a basset hound. Stacy had difficulty standing up - her forelegs couldn't support the weight of her still human body. Somehow she managed it, and walked over to look at herself in the mirror, howling in dismay when she saw her transformed head.

Even as she looked at her reflection, her legs began to change, becoming shorter, and assuming a canine configuration. Amanda rushed over to help lower her carefully to the floor - her now short legs couldn't hold up her still-human torso. Stacy's shoes and socks had come off, and Amanda easily removed Stacy's jeans and panties.

Stacy squirmed helplessly on the floor for a few minutes, but then her torso began to dwindle, sprouting fur and assuming new proportions. Soon enough, Stacy's transformation was complete! She tried to speak to Amanda, but found that she could only produce canine sounds. Amanda seemed to divine her intentions, and said:

"Don't try to speak, Stacy, I can hear your thoughts, just think when you want to communicate with me. Now, let me explain a few things. I've left you your human mind and personality. When we're alone you can do what you like as long as you don't make trouble for me. When w'ere outside, or if anyone else is around,the spell will compel you to behave like a normal dog. Understand this: If you do make trouble for me, I may just decide to suppress your human side entirely, and leave you a dog in mind as well as body for the rest of the week. As it is, you may find your 'canine nature' raising its head occasionally. If you were left like this for much more than a month, you'd start to lose your human nature gradually and end up totally a dog. But you should be fine for a week.Oh, and one other thing - I've transformed you into a dog that's been spayed, so you needn't worry about any unwelcome male attention. Not to worry, when I turn you back, you'll be 'intact' again. So, any questions or comments?"

Stacy thought for a moment. She was scared, and she didn't at all like the idea of spending the week as a dog, but she wasn't going to grovel to Amanda, or beg anything from her. One thought was occurring to her, however.

Actually, she thought at Amanda, I have to...um..."go".

"Alright, let's get you out to the backyard. Come." Amanda said.

Stacy was about to protest, but then thought long about the position she was in. A witch had just turned her into a dog. And she just said she could make her a dog in mind as well. Did she really want to risk that? Stacy was a rebel to the core, but even she knew that she couldn't mess with an actual witch. Maybe if she played along for a bit, Amanda might give her some actual privileges? Stacy plotted out her plan to play the slow game, to win Amanda over and then eventually use it to get her human dignity back.

Stacy's thoughts were interrupted by Amanda suddenly shouting "Wait! I almost forgot! Stacy, sit!"

A startled Stacy stopped and sat on the ground. She looked up at Amanda towering over her. Amanda held a blue dog collar in her hands.

"We don't want to go outside without your collar on. What would happen if you got out and got lost?" Amanda said as she bent down and attached the collar to Stacy.

It took everything in Stacy's power to not lash out at this. But she still didn't want to get into any more trouble than she was already in. Stacy looked across the room, and saw her reflection in the window. She was Basset Hound through and through, and the with the collar and tags attached to her, no one would think anything different.

"Alright, Stacy. Let's go outside." Amanda said, as she opened the back door. Stacy shuffled out on her tiny legs, the tags on her collar jingling.

Stacy was blown away from how much bigger the backyard seemed. It was because she was smaller, yes, but also because so many sounds and smells she had no clue existed all came crashing into her brain. Instinctively, she put her nose to the ground and started to sniff around. She did have a very powerful nose now, and she might as well put it to good use.

Then Stacy remembered why she was out here. She looked back to Amanda, who was watching and smiling. Stacy bucked up, found a nice spot, squatted down, and did what she needed to do.

11532112111122121222.content:
Amanda sat bolt upright in the bed. Standing next to the bed was a woman who looked no older than Stacy, or than Amanda did, herself, now that her spell had had time to take effect. Outwardly, she looked like an 18 year-old blonde girl in a tee shirt and jeans. Amanda knew that this was an illusion. In truth, this was Irene, an elder witch, and one who had taught Amanda everything she knew about magic. Amanda moved to get up out of the bed, but Irene waved her back.

"Mother Irene", she said, respectfully, "What can I do for you?" Irene wasn't her mother, of course, but so a witch was expected to address her mentor.


"Amanda", said Irene. "I need a big favor from you."

"Anything", said Amanda. A witch dared not refuse her mentor. "How may I serve you?"

"I'm afraid the Lady Antonia discovered who it was that snooped through her private collection of grimoires and maybe 'borrowed' one."

"Aw, crap", said Amanda.

"Crap, indeed", said Irene. "Anyway, I have to go on an extended tour of the Outer Realms until such time as she calms down a bit, and I need you to mind something for me."

Irene produced an ancient-looking book from out of thin air.

"M-mother", said Amanda,"You brought the grimoire here? But she'll trace it wherever it goes!"

"I don't think so", said Irene. "I know a disguise spell that even she can't penetrate."

Irene twisted the grimoire in her hand, and it re-shaped itself so that it looked like a girl's diary.

"Oh", said Amanda. "But even though Antonia doesn't know me, if she follows your trail and finds a witch here, she'll be suspicious. She'll never believe that I don't know anything."

"She'll believe it if you actually don't know anything."

Irene gestured, and Amanda felt all of her magic drain out of her.

"There", said Irene. "Now you're the mortal 18 year-old that you appear to be. In a moment, you'll fall asleep. While you sleep, your memories will alter, as will the memories of Stacy's family and friends, and all appropriate records. Stacy Porter will just have to remain Lori Nguyen's dog for a while. You will be Amanda Porter, well-behaved daughter of George and Mary Porter, who felt perfectly safe leaving you at home alone, as well as Lori Nguyen's best friend since childhood Even if Antonia finds this place, she won't find a trace of magic in you or the diary. I'll be back to restore you as soon as the heat is off."

"But - but -", said Amanda.

"Hush, Amanda. sleep", said Irene. Amanda found herself helpless to do anything for sleep.

When she awoke an hour later, she was ravenously hungry. After having a nice sandwich, she got out her schoolbooks. she had school tomorrow, she'd better get her homework done.

The next day, Amanda, thinking of herself as Amanda Porter, got up and went to school. In homeroom, she sat next to Lori, her - or so they both believed - best friend since childhood.

"Hey, Amanda", said Lori, "How was it being home alone last night?"

"Kinda scary", said Amanda. "Kinda lonely, too."

"Say, why don't I come over and spend the night with you?", said Lori. "I'll bring Stacy as 'protection' against any burglars."

They both laughed at the thought of the lovable hound Stacy scaring anyone.

"Well", said Amanda,"My mom said it would be OK if you came by."

"Cool" said Lori. "I'll clear it with my mom and dad, and as long as they're OK with it, Stacy and I will be by around six. We'' have to leave a little early in the morning before school, so I can walk Stacy and get her home, if that's OK."

"Sure", said Amanda.

That night, Lori's old wreck pulled up in front of the Porter household, with Lori and Stacy in it. Lori had a shoulder bag and was carrying a casserole dish.

"My mom insisted on sending over some dinner." Lori explained.

"Awesome", said Amanda.

When they were in the house, Lori said. "Let me nuke this back to life, I know where everything is. You just sit and play with Stacy."

Lori left the room. Stacy went over to Amanda, and, not knowing that Amanda was no longer magical or that Amanda's memories had been changed, l, thought at her, Hey,Amanda, don't get too comfortable in my life, now, will you?

115321121111221212222122112.content: The person who visited the house while Amanda, Lori and Stacy slept was...
115321121111221212222122112.title: Someone else

1153211211112212122221221121.content:
The Lady Antonia had easily traced Irene and the grimoire that had been taken from her to the Porter house. She remained hidden while she scanned her surroundings. She sensed no other witches around. She altered her appearance and clothing so that she looked like a policewoman in her early 30's. If she were spotted, ewer mortals would question the presence of such a person roaming the neighborhood if she were spotted.

It was child's play for Antonia to open the front door and open the house. Upstairs, only Stacy stirred. She awoke, and...
1153211211112212122221221121.title: Antonia

choices: "Maybe I should take a closer look at these girls."
"Well, who cares? I got what I came here for!"
11532112111122121222212211212.content:
Antonia scanned the house again, this time from within. On a coffee table, she detected a disguised magical item. She picked it up. It looked like a girl's diary, but she that wasn't what it really was. Of course, Irene had made some feeble attempt to disguise it. But why leave it here? Perhaps Irene panicked, and left it in hopes of shaking Antonia off her trail. Well, she would learn better than that!

She scanned the rest of the house magically. There were two mortal girls, and... a dog. A dog with a residue of magic about it! The dog was actually a transformed human!

Hmmph, she thought...
11532112111122121222212211212.title: ..Then rolled over and went back to sleep.

choices: It turned back into the grimoire!
115321121111221212222122112122.content:
Antonia didn't really care about what happened to mundanes. Doubtless they were part of one of Irene's stupid tricks. Well, she had what she came for.

Or did she? Maybe she'd underestimated Irene. It wouldn't be funny if Irene got away with the grimoire because Antonia had underestimated her! She cast a spell to remove the "disguise" spell on the diary, and...
115321121111221212222122112122.title: "Well, who cares? I got what I came here fo...

1153211211112212122221221121222.content:
The diary exploded into a cloud of dust, right in Antonia's face! Before she could stop herself, she inhaled a lungful of it. Instantly, she was wracked with a powerful coughing fit, one that wouldn't stop, she coughed and coughed, her body contorting as she fell onto to the floor. Her whole world became the ceaseless pain of coughing, as her lungs, her throat, her whole body ached. She couldn't think or speak, let alone cast a spell. She couldn't even curse herself for a fool, she who had fallen for the witch's equivalent of a kindergarten prank.

Antonia's coughing had immediately awakened Amanda, Lori and Stacy, who came rushing downstairs.

"A policewoman!?!", said Lori. "What's she doing here""

"Dying, by the sound of her", said Amanda,"We'd better call 911!"

"That won't be necessary", said another voice from behind them.

Amanda and Lori whirled, behind them was...
1153211211112212122221221121222.title: It exploded in her face!

choices: Where Irene took, Amanda, Stacy and Lori
What Antonia did when she recovered.
11532112111122121222212211212221.content:
Irene immediately cast a spell freezing Lori and Stacy in place, and then poured Amanda's magic back into her, restoring her memories.

"Wow, Mother Irene", said Amanda, "I never get your limits."

"You didn't really think I'd just leave that grimoire there for her, did you? You should know me better than that. I hide the real grimoire before I ever came here", said Irene.

"Well, she obviously thought you did", said Amanda.

"Always the powerful ones are the arrogant and stupid ones", said Irene. "We'd better get out of here,. She'll only be like that for a couple of hours, and when she comes out of it, she'll be in a murderous rage that will make Yosemite Sam look like the Dalai Lama. By that time, we'd better be long gone. We'll take the two girls, too. I wouldn't put it past her to fry their nervous systems if she decides they were in on it with us, and I wouldn't want that on what's left of my conscience."

With that, she cast a spell, and then the house was empty, except for Antonia lying on the floor, twitching and coughing.
11532112111122121222212211212221.title: Irene

choices: Straight to where she hid the grimoire
115321121111221212222122112122211.content: Where did Irene take Amanda, Stacy and Lori?
115321121111221212222122112122211.title: Where Irene took Amanda, Stacy and Lori

choices: To a number of places, hoping to leave a confusing trail
1153211211112212122221221121222112.content: Where did Irene take Amanda, Stacy and Lori?
1153211211112212122221221121222112.title: Somewhere else

11532112111122121222212211212221122.content:
The foursome materialized in front of a log cabin in the middle of a forest.

"Where are we?", asked Amanda. "I don't know this place."

"It's a Hidden Realm", said Irene. "One that I've never shared with anyone. Carry the dog inside, will you?"

Amanda picked up the still-frozen Stacy and carried her into the cabin. Irene followed, levitating the still-frozen Lori after her. The interior was furnished in a rustic but comfortable style. The two women set down their burdens and then sat down in two chairs in front of a roaring that had started as if by itself at their approach.

"So, tell me, what were you doing at that house in the first place?" asked Irene.

Amanda told Irene the full story of why she had been babysitting Stacy. Then Irene told Amanda why she had stolen the grimoire from Antonia.

"You were working for them?", asked Amanda. "I never thought I'd see the day..."

"Neither did I", said Irene. "But life takes us some strange places."

"What shall we do?" asked Amanda. "Are we safe here?"

"If we're not safe here, we're not safe anywhere", said Irene. "As for what we're going to do, I have a plan. Irene spent some time telling Amanda her plan.

Afterwards, Amanda sat back, looking shocked."Wow, if you think that's the best thing to do..."

"I do", said Irene.

"What do you want me to do?", asked Amanda.

"I'm going to unfreeze Lori and Stacy", said Irene. "At that point, you will undo everything you've done to them."

Irene gestured, and Lori and Stacy unfroze.

"W-where are we?" asked Lori. "Wh-who -?" She stopped and watched in shock as Stacy reverted to her human form. Stacy stood up, hugging herself, as if in disbelief at finding herself human again. Amanda gestured again, and Stacy was suddenly fully-dressed.

"Stacy - you - you were a dog!", said Lori. "She - she made me forget you!"

"Yes, I know", said Stacy, turning to her friend.

"I'm sorry to interrupt you, ladies",said Irene. "But I think it's time you had an explanation."
11532112111122121222212211212221122.title: To a special hiding place

1153211211112212122221221121222112211.content:
Irene motioned Stacy and Lori to seats. When they were sitting comfortably. she began.

"As you both are now aware, there are such things as witches. Amanda and I are both witches, as was the woman you saw at Stacy's house, who was dressed as a policewoman. I say 'dressed as' because, I can assure you, she was not an actual cop. The world you both live in is called the 'Earth Realm'. At any given point in time, there are some witches resident in the Earth Realm. This is not publicly known, since by ancient witch law, it is forbidden for any witch to make the real existence of magic generally known here. A witch can do magic there, but she has to cover her tracks, and make sure that no one witnesses her making magic, or at least that any witnesses are unable to tell anyone about the existence of magic. This is one of the strictest witch laws, and even the lowest, most immoral witch would hesitate to break it."

"Why is that?", asked Stacy.

"Essentially because it's forbidden by the gods. What their reasoning is, they only know. I've never met a god, and I'm not particularly eager to meet one. Even the benevolent attention of the gods can result in some permanent alterations in one's lifestyle."

Irene paused and took a sip of water form a cup that she had made appear.

"Anyway, there are plenty of Other Realms - other dimensions,I suppose you'd call them - and in most of them, witches can live and practice openly. Frankly, the Earth Realm is a good place to hang out if you're a lazy witch -" Here she glared at Amanda, " -who wants an easy life where she can live comfortably and not have many other witches around to compete with."

Amanda looked as though she was going to say something, and then thought better of it. Irene continued.

"As for me, well, I'll be honest. I'm something of a low-level grifter/thief. My only real talent is a gift for getting around security systems, magical and mundane. I really shouldn't be talking about lazy witches, I've never really lived up to my potential, either. Anyway, I lived a quiet life, making a reasonable dishonest living, never really hurting anyone, never really doing anyone much good, either. Eventually, I took on Amanda as my apprentice We pull the odd scam together, and then do stuff on our own, never anything big enough to draw the attention of the Council of Elders. They're the closest thing we witches have to a 'government'. Basically, they're a bunch of powerful witches who enforce witch law and keep the rest of us in line. At any rate, I was having a little rest between jobs when I was suddenly summoned by one of Athena's Owls."

A look off shock passed across Amanda's face. Irene continued.

"The Owls are agents of the Council - sort of a witch's version of the FBI and the CIA all rolled up into one. I went when I was called, but I was panicking, desperately reviewing my recent activities to see what I might have done that had attracted their attention. the agent that summoned me quickly assuaged my fear. They weren't after me for anything I had done. Instead, they wanted my help with something that they preferred not to have one off their agents involved with. An Aleph-level grimoire had one missing, and they suspected a rather influential witch of having stolen it."

"Antonia!", said Amanda. "So that's why you broke into her estate!"

"Yes", said Irene. "An Aleph-level grimoire is something only an advanced level witch could even use. However, in the a hands of a qualified witch, it's the magical equivalent of a hydrogen bomb, only one that could be used repeatedly. Used in conjunction with the right kind of magical targeting system, it could be used to launch a first strike against - well, who knows? - the Council itself seems like an obvious target."

"But what would she want with something like that?". said Amanda.

"Who knows?", said Irene. "Wipe out the Council and set herself up as empress or something, maybe. Anyway, the grimoire was taken from a secure location, and the owls were morally certain that Antonia took it, but they had no hard evidence, and it would have been politically 'difficult' to move against a witch as influential as she is without hard proof. So, they brought me in. I could go in and try and find evidence against Antonia, and if she caught me, there was nothing that connected me to the Owls."

"Wouldn't that be hard on you if she caught you?", asked Lori.

"Sure", said Irene, "But they had me, carrot and stick. The carrot was that if I cooperated, I'd get all sorts of valuable goodies, and immunity against all of my previous misdeeds. The stick was that I refused to go, I'd be prosecuted for said misdeeds, and have the book thrown at me. So, things being what they were, I took the job. I got into Antonia's place alright - for such a bigshot, the security was abysmal - and I hit the jackpot, I found the grimoire! She really must've thought that no one would dare intrude on her, or maybe she thought that if she built up her security too much, people would think she was up to something, I dunno. anyway, I started to hightail it out of there with her right on my heels. She was insane with anger, she zapped two of her own servants trying to get at me! I managed to get away with her hot on my heels. I bounced from Realm to Realm, and managed to shake her momentarily. She must have suspected who I was working for, because I could see that she had people guarding the approaches to the Owl's HQ. So, I hid the grimoire carefully, and then went looking for Amanda. I found her at your house, Stacy, and set up a little trap for Antonia. I knew I couldn't overpower her, but I was able to slow her down long enough that I could hide us here. I brought Amanda along because I knew Antonia would soon find out that she was my apprentice, and would do the gods know what to her to use her against me. I brought you two along because I didn't want to leave you to her tender mercies. She'd almost never believe that you weren't in on it with me, and even if she didn't, she might have zapped you out of pure meanness."

"Where are we, exactly, Mother Irene?", asked Amanda.

"A Hidden Realm that I stumbled across ages ago, and set up as a sort of ultimate hide-away if I ever needed one. The gods the,selves couldn't find this place."

"A Hidden Realm", explained Amanda to Stacy and Lori, "Is what you might call a 'pocket universe'. It's almost impossible to find your way into unless you know exactly where it is, and I'm sure Mother Irene has added some special security upgrades of her own."

"What were you doing at Stacy's house, anyway, Amanda?" asked Irene.

"Technically, I was babysitting Stacy. The real story is that a few years ago, I helped her father out with some gambling debts. In return, well...Stacy, there's a certain unique magical energy released when a girl 'gives it up' for the first time. This energy is even more intense when it's released under a full moon, and the next full moon is Saturday.. The babysitting gig was a cover for me to arrange to be present to collect that energy when you 'made your debut'. Around about Friday, I would have retrieved you from Lori's, returned you to normal and made a big show of remorse for what I'd done to you. By way of making it up to you, I'd have encouraged you to invite your favorite boy over, and arranged to nudge him in your direction if need be. I would have seemingly made myself scarce, but really I'd have been there invisibly. A little aphrodisiac spell and you and loverboy would have been going at it. A win/win situation - you would've gotten your rocks off, and I'd have collected the magical energy, for which there is a big market in some Realms."

"You know, if you'd have just asked me, we might've worked something out", said Stacy.

"Ew", said Lori.

"I didn't want to rely on your cooperation" said Amanda, "and If i'd just flat-out coerced you to do it with some guy, that could've damaged the magic. There had to be at least some willingness on your part."

"This is all very interesting", said Irene, "but getting back to the present situation, we need to think about what we're going to do. we could probably stay safely in this Hidden realm for the rest of our lives, but I assumed none of us wants to do that. On the other hand, if we leave here, there's a fairly high chance that Antonia will be ready to jump on us the minute we show our faces. I, however, have a plan. Will you hear me out?"

The others assented, and Irene began to describe her plan.
1153211211112212122221221121222112211.title: Explanation A

115321121111221212222122112122211221111.content:
"Alright", continued Irene, "Here's how I see the situation. We're nice and safe in here, but outside this Hidden Realm, Antonia will be monitoring every possible Realm that she can. We'd have to get out of here, get to the grimoire and get it to the Owls before she incinerates us. Two weak witches and two mundanes, we don't stand a chance."

"What's this 'we' stuff?", asked Stacy. "We didn't steal the grimoire from her!"


"Look, I'm sorry you got sucked into this mess", said Irene. "But, like it or not, you are. Antonia will fry you both, just to be on the safe side, which is what she'll do to us all if she catches us. However, what if, instead of two weak witches, and two mundanes, she had to deal with four strong witches?

"And where will these four strong witches come from?", asked Amanda.

"Two of them will be the two of us", said Irene. Turning to Stacy and Lori, she said. The way you become stronger as a witch is the same way you become stronger as anything else - you study and practice, and the fact is, Amanda and I, we've both coasted. The only area where I could be said to excel is at sneaking into and out of places. If you and I really applied ourselves, we could both become a lot stronger. In video game terms, I'm at about Level 40, and Amanda's at about level 20. Good enough for the low-level stuff we've done all our lives, not not enough to take on someone like Amanda, who's gotta be closer to level 80."

"OK, but where are the other two witches?", asked Amanda.

"Sitting right there", said Irene, pointing at Stacy and Lori.

"WHAT?", asked Amanda, Stacy and Lori. together.

"HOW?", asked Amanda by herself.

"Let me explain to Stacy and Lori how someone becomes a witch", said Irene. "You see, witches are 'made', not 'born'. When a witch finds a mundane woman that she considers suitable, she can take her on a an apprentice witch. What that means is that the witch plants a seed of her own magic in the apprentice. As it grows, the mentor teaches the apprentice about the ways of magic. While she's still in the apprentice stage, the mentor can remove the apprentice's magic as she wishes. The apprentice is bound to honor and obey her mentor,. However, once the apprentice has reached a certain level, she can seal her magic to herself, Once, she's done that, no one can take her magic away from her, not even her mentor. Of course, a stronger witch can suppress or contain her magic, but no one can take it away from her. At that point, she's considered to have served her apprenticeship. She no longer owes her mentor total obedience, although she does owe her lifelong respect, and any lawful assistance her mentor requires, if she can provide it. You will have noticed that Amanda calls me 'mother Irene'. that's part of the respect that she owes me as her mentor ."

Irene turned and looked at Amanda.

"As you my have figured out, Amanda hasn't completed her apprenticeship yet, although she really ought to have done so."

"What's all this got to do with us?", asked Lori.

"Well, here's the thing", said Irene. "A witch can only have one apprentice at a time. Otherwise, I could apprentice one of you, and Amanda could apprentice the other. But, we haven't got that option. So, what I propose we bend the rules a little. It's not usually done, but there's no actual rule against an apprentice taking an apprentice of her own. I suggest that Amanda apprentice one of you, and her apprentice will apprentice the other one. In reality, I'll be overseeing all of your training, as well as developing my own skills as well."

"Wait a minute", said Stacy. "Does that mean that if I became Amanda's apprentice, I'd have to call her 'Mother Amanda'?"

"Yes", said Irene. "Even after you complete your apprenticeship. It' one of the stricter rules of witch law."

"If it makes you feel any better, Stacy", said Amanda. "I really wasn't wild about having to call her 'Mother Irene' at first. I got used to it, eventually."

"Besides", said Lori, "If we do it that way, I'd have to call you 'Mother Stacy'."

"How long would this take?", asked Stacy. "If we're in here training, who knows what Antonia will be getting up to out in the world?"

"Not to mentions what our parents will think happened to us", added Lori.

"Well, that's the unusual thing about this particular Hidden Realm", said Irene. "Time flows differently here. We could spend a thousand years in here, and only a second would pass out in the Earth Realm."

"Really?", said Amanda. "I've never heard of anything like that."

"Neither have I", said Irene. "This place could be unique for all I know."

"Wait a minute, a thousand years?", said Stacy.

"Oh, it shouldn't come to that", said Irene. "But even if it did, it wouldn't matter. If you become a witch, you''l find that your relationship to time changes a bit. You don't have to age unless you want to, and we can live indefinitely, assuming we survive Antonia. I was born in what you would call New Testament times, and I've known one witch who claimed to have been old when Atlantis sank. We can be killed, but we don't die of old age."

Irene looked at them all, and said, "I won't force it on any of you, not even you, Amanda, but what do you say?"
115321121111221212222122112122211221111.title: Plan A

choices: Heads! Stacy is Amanda's apprentice, Lori is Stacy's
Tails! Lori is Amanda's apprentice, Stacy is Lori's
1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.content:
Stacy and Lori asked permission to discuss Irene's plan privately, which was granted. They went outside and walked a short way way from the cabin. After discussing it at length, they decided to go along with it. They went back inside and conveyed their agreement to Irene.

"Great", said Irene, so which of you's going to be Amanda's apprentice, and which of you is going to be apprenticed to the other?"

"Dunno", said Stacy. "I suppose we oughta flip for it."

"I'm game", said Lori. "I've got that old dollar coin my grandfather gave me, we'll flip that."

Pulling the coin out of her pocket, she flipped it and said "Call it!"

Stacy yelled "Heads!", and then watched as it came down...
1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.title: They respond  together

1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.content:
"OK", said Stacy. "I guess I go first. How do we do this?"

There was a brief ritual in which Stacy swore to serve and obey Amanda faithfully as her apprentice, and Amanda swore to guide and teach Stacy truly as her mentor. Irene served as a witness. Then Irene pointed them towards a bedroom.

Once inside the bedroom, Amanda muttered a brief spell, and Stacy found herself dressed in a comfortable, well-fitted nightgown.

"Get into the bed, and make yourself comfortable", said Amanda. "This is the easy part for you."

Stacy complied, and when she was comfortable, Amanda closed her eyes placed a hand on Stacy's forehead. Stacy felt a warm, pleasant energy flowing into her.. It was like soaking in a warm bath after a long day. Her eyes snapped shut, and she was soon fast asleep.

Amanda came out of the bedroom, and said, "It's done."

"She'll sleep for a day", said Irene to Lori, while the magical energy permeates her, body and soul. Then she'll need a week of very basic training until she can apprentice you."

Irene spent the next day showing Lori everything that was in the cabin and the neighboring vicinity. Amanda stayed near Stacy, and when she sensed that Stacy was about to wake up, she re-entered the bedroom. when Stacy opened her eyes, she looked up at Amanda, and said, "Good morning , Mother Amanda, how do we start?"

"With breakfast", Amanda replied. The two left the room and joined the others at the breakfast table.

"Say", said Stacy to Irene. "If Amanda is 'Mother Amanda' to me, how should I address you, 'Grandmother Irene'?"

"That's right", said Irene.

"So", said Lori, "Stacy will be 'Mother Stacy' to me, and Amanda will be 'Grandmother Amanda". Will you be 'Great-Grandmother Irene'?"

"No", said Irene, "Any witch in your 'mentor-chain' above your mentor's mentor will still just be 'Grandmother Whoever'. I mean, my mentor Claudia, and her mentor Anatu are still alive. If you ever meet her, you'd theoretically have to call her 'Great-Great-Great-Grandmother Anatu', and that would be too much of a mouthful. An older witch who is not in your 'mentor-chain' would be addressed as 'Lady Whoever', and a younger witch or one of your same age can be called by their first name."

"Are there any male witches?", asked Stacy.

"There are male magic users", said Irene, "but they have a different craft and disciplines than we do. We don't intermix with them much. Don't worry, there's plenty of mundane males out there, and they tend to be a lot safer."

For the next week, Amanda gave Stacy her basic training, with occasional input from Irene. Lori was left mainly at loose ends for that week, which she spent exploring the area around the cabin.

Finally, her time came. Lori swore to serve and obey Stacy faithfully as her apprentice, and Stacy swore to guide and teach Lori truly as her mentor. Amanda served as a witness. Stacy put Lori to bed, and planted a see do magic in her. Lori feel asleep, and when she awoke, Stacy was smiling down at her. "Good morning, Mother Stacy!", Lori said.

They took a day to rest, and then their training began.
1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.title: Heads! Stacy is Amanda's apprentice, Lori i...

1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.content:
When it was all over, Stacy was never quite sure how long they did spend training. Irene had been right about one thing – a magical being’s relationship to time was different from that of a mundane. They all worked hard, but no one worked harder than Irene. Every day, she spent time on her own growth, then spent time training with Amanda, then offered occasional supervision while Amanda trained Stacy, and offered pretty much constant supervision as Stacy “trained” Lori. (Mostly it was Irene that trained Lori, while at the same time teaching Stacy how to be a teacher.)

Stacy found herself becoming competitive with Lori as they each did their best to develop their magical powers and knowledge of witch law, lore and history. At the same time, Amanda was motivated to develop as well – she didn’t want Stacy (her apprentice) completing her apprenticeship before she herself completed hers!

In the end, Amanda completed her apprenticeship first. They took the day off, and watched the brief ceremony in which Amanda sealed her magic to herself, and Irene declared to all and sundry that Amanda had completed her apprenticeship, and was a full and free mistress of witchcraft. They had a big party for her, and then when back to training the next day.

Stacy completed her own apprenticeship some time later, and Lori completed hers a mere week later. Stacy felt a pride like she’d never felt before. She’d never really worked at anything so hard before, and she felt a real sense of achievement. Witchcraft interested her more than anything she’d ever studied before, and the sense of having become something much more than she’d bene before was very fulfilling.

Each of them seemed to have individual strengths. Irene had always been good at stealth and evading security systems, and Amanda had a gift for transformations. Stacy seemed to have a gift for healing potions and powders, and Lori had a real skill at magical combat. Once their individual skills were developed, they began working on teamwork, as well. In time, they became a well-polished magical fighting unit.

Stacy, Lori, Irene and Amanda had gotten to know one another quite well during the training. It was just the four of them in Irene’s Hidden Realm, after all, and they spent a great deal of time together. Additionally, some aspects of their magical training were quite intimate. Not physically intimate, but psychically intimate. Some of the things they had to learn to do involved touching one another’s minds, and in time they had no secrets from one another. The training changed all four of them, in ways that were permanent. In a way, they were closer than sisters.

Finally, one evening, Irene called them all together.

“Ladies, I think we’ve reached the limit of what we can become training with each other here. I’m very proud of all of you. Heck, I’m even proud of myself. We’ve all advanced so much and become very powerful witches. Tomorrow, we go to face our final test. We have to deal with Antonia. So, get plenty of sleep tonight, because tomorrow we fight.”

The next morning after breakfast, they all gathered together outside the cabin. Remember, no time will have passed in the Earth Realm, so I’m hopeful we’ll have a big surprise to hand Antonia. However, stay alert, and make sure that we don’t get caught by any surprises. Everyone ready?”

The others nodded, and Irene spoke the spell which returned them all to the Earth Realms. Stacy looked around, and saw…
1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.title: Training Overview

1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.content:
Irene paused a moment before she spoke the spell that would send them to Stacy's house. She reached in to her pocket, and pulled out what looked like four small red berries. She pressed one to each of their foreheads. They phased into each of their heads, passing out of sight.

"What were those?", asked Stacy.

"Sort of magical alarm clocks", said Irene. "Don't worry, they're harmless. They're programmed to activate when needed. Otherwise, they will remain inert. Hush now."

She spoke the spell, and the quartet found themselves back in Stacy's house. As Irene had said, no time had passed in the Earth Realm, and Antonia was still lying on the floor, coughing her lungs out.

"Now", said Irene. She, Amanda, Stacy and Lori spoke a spell which encased Antonia in a metal sphere, rendered it invisible and immaterial, and sent it flying off into space at ever-increasing speed. It was only then that Stacy stopped to look around at her house. It was familiar and strange at the same time. For her, it had been centuries since she'd been here, but it wasn't different at all.

"What will happen to her, Grandmother Irene?", asked Lori.

"She won't stop coughing until she's somewhere around the orbit of Mars. I imagine that until then, it'll be all that she can do to keep herself alive. Once she does stop coughing, it'll tax even her powers just getting herself back to Earth intact, so she'll be exhausted when we see her again."

"And what will we be doing in the meantime?", asked Stacy.

"Well, we should retrieve the grimoire from where I hid it and get it back to the Owls. Antonia will have some minions waiting for us to do just that. However, I do have a plan for what we should do. It involves us..."
1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.title: ..They were back at Stacy's house

1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.content: How do they each respond?
1153211211112212122221221121222112211112.title: They respond separately

choices: Went after Irene in a towering rage

Your mom visits me from time to time and mentioned that you would be a good candidate. I liked the idea so she had me spend some time with you. Now I'll finally have a playmate again!"

Stacy sighed, seeing there was no way out of this now. "Alright, what's the first change?"

"Let's see... The first change should be a tail and the ears. That should happen about half an hour of taking the formula," she glanced at a cat-themed wall clock, "which should be right about."

Stacy looked at the clock to see that it had, indeed, been thirty minutes since she came downstairs. She heard a rip and spun her head around to see a long, slender orange tail stretching out behind her and moving back and forth. She felt her ears moving slightly and reached up to feel them moving up to the top of her head, each one becoming covered in fur and forming a point. She looked over to a mirror that was hanging on the wall and saw two orange cat ears sitting on top of her head. She looked over to Amanda to see a pair of white ears already situated at the top of her head with a matching tail twitching behind her.

Stacy was speechless. All she could do was just stand there in shock at what just happened. She was brought back to her senses when she heard her stomach growling. "So what are we going to eat if you spent all this time setting this up?"

"Cat food, of course! It's my favorite brand, Meow Mix! Don't worry. The second change is appetite and it happens pretty much right after the first one. The rest usually take place while you're asleep." Amanda walked over to one of the food bowls, got down on all fours, and started eating. "Come on over and try some. I'm sure you'll find it delicious!"

Stacy found herself moving towards the food almost without noticing. Soon, she was standing right in front of the bowl. She crouched down and picked up one piece, hesitantly putting it in her mouth. After just one taste, her hunger overcame her and she started scarfing down as much as she could. She wanted to stop, but it was so good and she was so hungry!

When they had finished their meal, they got ready to go to sleep. That is, until Amanda got up and went into the kitchen for a moment. As she was lost in the beauty of the sky, she thought she heard a sound. She turned, looking for the source, but could not see anything. "Maybe it was a leaf rustling," she thought to herself.

A few seconds later, she heard it again. It was a rustle and a soft 'mew'. There were no cats in the neighbourhood, so she thought she must've imagined it. "Oh, because I was talking to Amanda about cats," she thought.

A small wind came up, The clouds changed shape. She kept gazing at the sky - and, much to her astonishment, the clouds re-arranged themselves till they looked like a cat in repose. Again, she thought she heard a soft 'mew'.

Stacy was nervous. She turned to go indoors, to find Amanda standing at the door, holding a tray with two plates on it. The plates were full of food and a delicious aroma filled the air.

"It's so beautiful, I thought we'd have a picnic dinner outside," Amanda said, smiling at Stacy.

Stacy stared back.

13512.content:
Once she calmed down a bit, it occurred to Stacy that she had made a mistake.

I'm going to have to live with Amanda for a week, she thought. I should try and make nice with her.


She went back downstairs, where Amanda was sitting watching TV. She was sipping from a glass filled with a brown liquid. On the coffee table in front of her, was a two-liter plastic bottle labeled "MOXIE". She'd heard of it - one of her classmates was originally from and swore by the stuff, but Stacy had thought it was nasty.

"Say, Amanda", she said, "I'm sorry about being so snotty before, I didn't mean to be so rude to you."

"That's quite alright, Stacy", said Amanda. "There's no need for us to be enemies, and I won't 'cramp your style' any more than you have to. If you want to call some of your friends over, I won't object. Just no boys, please. I know you're a big girl, but even 'big girls' make mistakes. Believe me, that's the voice of experience speaking. Anyway, if you'll excuse me, I should go get dinner ready. "

With that, she turned off the TV, and walked out into the kitchen. Stacy watched her go, and then looked down at the bottle on the table. she suddenly felt an overwhelming urge to take a swig from it. She'd always hated the stuff, but now there was nothing she wanted more than to have a mouthful of the stuff. Checking to make sure that Amanda wasn't in sight, she picked the bottle up and took a swig of it, then hastily put the bottle down. Ugh! It was as nasty as she remembered it being. Why had she wanted it so badly?

She went to the phone and called three of her friends, inviting them over. Then she headed back up to her room. In the kitchen, Amanda smiled. She knew full well that Stacy had taken a drink of her soda. She'd have been disappointed if she hadn't, since she had placed a spell on the bottle. so that anyone who saw it would feel compelled to drink from it. Stacy, of course, had not noticed that she'd never actually seen Amanda drink from the bottle.

The apology was a nice try, Stacy, thought Amanda, but you're not getting off so easily.

As Stacy went up the stairs to her room, her fee began to feel really uncomfortable and sore, to the point where she could barely walk. When she got to her room and pulled off her shoes. she noticed that her feet under her socks looked oddly distorted. When she pulled off her socks, she gasped in shock - her feet looked like, like, hands. sort of. but hands with wrinkly brownish skin, and think brown hair on them.

What's happening to me? They almost look like a chimp's feet! She remembered what Amanda had said. Could she have had something to do with this? What had she done to her?

Downstairs, the doorbell rang. Amanda answered it. It was...
13512.title: Stacy slowly transforms into a chimp

It was...the last person Amanda wanted to see.

"Clotilde!", said Amanda. "Oh, crap! that is...I mean...long time no see."


Clotilde was an elder witch, far more powerful than Amanda, and one whom Amanda had crossed many years before. People who crossed her tended to disappear without explanation, so Amanda had lain low for centuries, hoping that with the passage of time and a good deal of luck, Clotilde would calm down enough to let bygones be bygones. It appeared that Amanda's luck had run out.

"Shut it", said Clotilde. "You should have known that you couldn't hide from me forever. Here and now, your reckoning comes due. It's off to the garden for you!"


Amanda vanished from Stacy's house and reappeared, stark naked, in a pleasant, well-tended garden. Scattered here and there on plinths were granite statues of various kinds of people, most of whom looked distressed. Amanda realized that she was standing on a plinth herself, but before she could move, her feet turned to stone. The petrification spread up her body, and within seconds, Amanda was a granite stature, there to serve as an eternal warning to anyone who would dare to cross Clotilde.

135122323.content:
Stacy could not overcome her indecision over what to do, and dithered so long that it ended up not mattering. Even now, her friends were approaching her house. It was a peculiar coincidence that Stacy's three friends were all also named "Stacy" and had family names that started with "M", just as she did. They had become friends as much because they always ended up next to each other in school. In addition to herself, Stacy Madison, there were:

-Stacy Matsui: small, but tough, the undisputed "boss" of the group

-Stacy McDonough: a fiery, argumentative redhead, and something of a wisecracker

-Stacy Makarov: a stereotypical tall, blonde, Slavic beauty, quiet, but quite strong.

Because they all had the same first name and last initial, they tended to call each other by their last names.

The three of them pulled up in front of the Madison house in Matsui's car. They piled out and walked up to the front door, which was open.

"What's that all about?", asked McDonough. "You think something's wrong?"

"Nah", said Matsui, "Madison probably left it open again. Think how many times we've had to listen to her mother yell at her about that."

Matsui opened the door, and went into the house. The first thing she noticed was the bottle of soda on the coffee table. Before she knew what was happening, she'd raced over, and taken a swig from the bottle. McDonough pulled the bottle from her hands and took a drink herself, followed by Makarov.

"Damn, that was strange", said Matsui. "I literally could not stop myself."

"Yeah", said McDonough. "That stuff was nasty."

"I wonder where Madison is", said Matsui. "Hey, Madison, are you here?"

"Guys, is that you?", came Stacy Madison's voice from upstairs. "Come up to my room!"

The three friends went up to Madison's room. Madison was lying on her bed, covered by a sheet.

"So, Amanda didn't do anything to you?", she asked.

"Who's Amanda?", asked Matsui."There's on one downstairs. What's wrong with you?"

"Something is happening to me, and I think she did it."

"What do you mean?"

Madison pulled the sheet up and exposed her legs and feet, which were fully transformed.

The other three gasped in shock. Matsui recovered first.

"What the hell happened to you?", she demanded.

Madison told them the story of her encounter with Amanda.

"So, what, you think she's a witch and put a chimp curse on you?", asked McDonough.

"Well, what else could it be?", asked Madison.

"I don't know", said McDonough. "Maybe she drugged you with chimp DNA, or something."

"DNA doesn't work that way, McDonough", said Matsui. "Madison, could she have drugged you?"

"Only if there was something in the soda I stole", said Madison.

"WHAT?", said Matsui.

"Yeah, there was a bottle of Moxie she left out. I had this overwhelming urge to take a drink from it."

"But WE all drank from that!", said Matsui.

"MY FEET!", screamed Makarov. She was wearing open-toed sandals, and the other three could see that she now had chimp feet, as well. Matsui and McDonough suddenly realized that their own feet felt cramped in their shoes. They pulled off their footwear, and saw that their feet had changed, as well.
