"Oh, God, it's happening to us, too!", said McDonough, "What are we going to do?"

"Shut up a minute", said Matsui, "I've got to - got to...arrrr!" She began tearing off her clothes. As if a switch had been flipped, McDonough and Makarov did likewise.

Matsui pulled her cellphone out off her jeans pocket, then threw it away in frustration when she realized that she no longer knew how to use it.

"OK", she said. "We're going to search this house, find this Amanda, and somehow make her undo this. Come on!"

The other three members of her troop followed her obediently. Stacy Madison now was walking on all fours. already her hands were beginning to change, and dark hair was growing on her arms.

The foursome didn't find Amanda, as she was now where they would never find here. They searched the house and...
135122323.title: Stay where she was

1351223231.content:
The four Stacys searched the house from top to bottom, but found neither Amanda or anything that gave a clue to where she was. By the time the reunited in the kitchen, Madison's arms had fully transformed and the transformation was spreading up her torso. The other three girls' legs were fully transformed and their arms were starting to change.

"So, we found nothing?", asked Matsui. "Where could she have gone?"

"No idea", said Madison.

"None of this makes sense", said Makarov. "Why turn Madison into a chimp and then take off?"

"Maybe something went wrong for her?", mused Matsui.

"Well, that's what she gets for monkeying around, then", said McDonough.

"Shut up", said the other three.

"What should we do?", asked Madison.

"Maybe we should take that soda to a chem lab and have it analyzed", said McDonough.

"If it is magic, what good would a chem lab do?", asked Matsui. "Besides, we'll have changed completely before we could get it to a lab, even if we knew where one was and if they would listen to us. No, we need to find this Amanda and make her change us back. If only we knew where she was..."

Stacy Madison jumped up on the counter and took down a bunch of bananas from the top of the fridge. She began to peel and eat one, making contented grunts as she ate it.

Matsui looked at her, half in alarm that she was exhibiting such chimp-like behavior, and half in annoyance that she wasn't sharing. She grabbed the remaining bananas, took one for herself and distributed the others to McDonough and Makarov.

The four friends ate contentedly, until Matsui shook her head and said, "Geez, we gotta do something fast." Madison's whole torso had changed, and the other three's torsos were starting to transform.

"Maybe Amanda's out in the back yard", said McDonough. "We haven't checked there."

"Good idea", said Matsui. "Let's go look."

"We can't go outside naked", said Makarov.

"Don't you think we've got worse things to worry about?", said Matsui. "Come on!"

The foursome went to the back door and looked outside.

"I don't see her", said Makarov.

"Come on", said Matsui. "Let's look around."

They moved into the yard and looked around, but found nothing.

"Madison", asked Matsui, "Do you have any idea where Amanda might have gone?"

"I - ah - ah - I dooo...", said Madison, a distressed look crossing her face. "Hoooo! Hoo-hoo hoo-hoo-hoo HOO!"

She shrugged apologetically, pointed at her throat, and shook her head. She was finding it harder and harder to think, the rennants of her humanity were fading away.

Matsui sighed, and patted Madison's shoulder amiably. At that moment, a neighbor's dog barked, startling them. Instinctively, the Stacys ran and climbed into the branches of an oak tree at the back of the yard. When they had caught their breath, they turned and looked at Stacy Madison, whose head had begun to change. Her hair darkened, her forehead sloped back, and her jaw jutted outward. Within a few minutes, there was no sign that she'd ever been human.

"OK, you guys", said Matsui. "Madison's gone full chimp. I'm srry, but I don't see any way out of this."

"Then what's gonna happen to us?", asked Makarov.

"Well, if we're lucky, someone will spot us and call Animal Control, and they'll trank us and take us in. They'll go nuts trying to figure out where we came from, and then eventually they'll ship us off to some zoo or wildlife preserve, I guess."

"Yeah, cheer up, Mak", said McDonough. "Maybe there'll be some nice boy chimps there! We'll finally see some action!!"

"But our families won't know what happened to us", said Makarov.

"That's a point", said Matsui. "They'll find our clothes in Madison's room, but no sign of us. It'll be a real little puzzle. They'll never guess what really happened to us."

The four friends remained in the tree as their transformations completed. Soon, they had no memory of their previous lives, or that they had ever been anything other than chimps.

Soon, there was another visitor to the Madison house. It was...
1351223231.title: ...found nothing

13512232311.content:
A short while later, Officer Mary Jackson drove past Stacy Madison's house,and saw that the front door was open. Mary knew the Madisons, and had, in fact, been the officer who had responded to the noise complaint when Stacy had thrown the party that got her into so much trouble. She also knew that Stacy's parents were away.

Looks like Stacy left the front open again, she thought. I'd best have a word with her.

She parked her patrol car in front of the Madison house, and walked up and looked in the door. Before she could announce her presence, she saw the bottle of soda and rushed in and took a swig of it.

Wow, that was weird! I couldn't stop myself! Good thing no one saw that. I'd better announce myself

"Hello? Is anyone here?" She received no response. She decided to check out Stacy's room first, it was possible she was up there with headphones on or something. When she got there, she saw four piles on clothes on the floor. Looking through, she found ID's for the four Stacys. So, where were they? Mary sat down on Stacy's bed to think. Presumably they weren't running around naked. Maybe they were out back sunbathing?

Wow, my feet are killing me!, she thought. Well, no one's around, so... Mary pulled off her shoes and socks and then gasped in shock.

What the Hell is happening to my feet? Was it that soda? Was there something in it? I'd better call this in.

Mary swiftly realized that she no longer remember how to call anything in! She was distracted by a sudden urge to strip herself naked. What's gotten into me? I've got to figure this out! I've never believed in magic, but what else could this be? Nana used to say she believed in it, used to tell me all those stories about voodoo and stuff growing up in Lousiana. I always figured she was messing with me, but maybe she wasn't. I better keep looking around She stood up, and found it awkward walking on her new feet. As she tried to walk, the urge to strip grew stronger and stronger, until she finally gave in. God, I'm going to hear about this from the Chief! Say, maybe this is what happened to the four Stacys! That would explain the clothes on the floor.

Mary searched the house and found nothing. By the time she was done, her legs had transformed completely. She decided to look outside. She loped out into the yard. The four Stacys were still in the oak tree. They noticed a strange female coming out of the house and hooted threateningly.

Mary noticed them and said, "Stacy, is that you?" The Stacys no longer understood human language, and so chattered threateningly. Mary felt exposed on the ground, and clambered up a maple tree on the other side of the yard. She fought down the urge to chatter back at them. She sat in the tree, trying to think about what to do, but as her transformation continued, soon all she was thinking about was what to do about the four unfriendly female chimps in the tree across the yard.

Soon, another visitor came to the Madison house. It was...
13512232311.title: A policewoman

135122323112.content:
Agnes Bartleby was a basically good person with one major flaw: She was incorrigibly nosy. That afternoon, she was coming back from the supermarket with a bag off groceries when she drove past the Madison house, and saw that the front door was open and there was a police car parked out front. Her nosiness got the better of her, and she parked her car a respectful distance behind Mary's cruiser.

'll just take a quick peek in, she thought. If anyone spots me, I'll just say that I'm a friend of the family. This was basically true - she and Stacy's mother had gone to high school together and still chatted when they saw each other. Agnes looked into the house and saw the bottle of soda. As the others had before her, she was compelled to go in and take a sip of it. Hearing a noise form the back yard, she was spooked and ran out of the house, and back to her car. It was only when she was in her car that she realized that she'd taken the soda with her. Well, she wasn't going back in, so she slipped it in with her groceries.

By the time she got home, her feet were killing her, and she was feeling an irrational urge to strip herself naked. She grabbed the groceries and ran into the house. Her sixteen year-old daughter Stephanie and her two friends, Juana Perez and Rachel Klein were sitting in the kitchen.

Agnes handed Stephanie the groceries, saying, "StephcanyougirlsputtheseawayIdon'tfeelsogoodkthanksbye", before rushing up to her room. Her husband, Dave, was out for the day plaiyng golf, sso he was not there to witness what happened next.

Stephanie sighed, and began unpacking the groceries. When she pulled out the soda bottle, she, Juana and Rachel all took swigs from it. "Geez, help yourselves, girls", she said. The other two apologized, and helped put the groceries away. Then the trio went up to Stephanie's room to hang out.

A little while later, Stephanie's fourteen year-old brother, Tim came home, with his two friends, Bill Porter and Jimmy Harper. Bill had a huge crush on Stephanie, and was hoping to get a glimpse of her. The three of them raided the fridge for snacks, where they found the bottle of soda, and each drank from it before going up to Tim's room to hang out.

Finally, the youngest Bartleby child, ten year-old Rebecca, came home with her best (and, sad to say, only) friend, Ginny Hopkins. They, too, drank from the soda bottle before going into the living room to play video games.

Next:
135122323112.title: A nosy neighbor

choices: ...but she was able to resist it.
...and she was unable to resist it.
1351223231123.content:
A short while later, Wendy White drove past the Bartleby home. As it happened, she was a young witch doing an independent study, visiting the Earth incognito to observe a world where life was based on science rather than magic. So it was that when she passed the Bartleby house she got a strong magical vibe from it.

Wow, what the heck is that? There's some powerful magic in that house! I'd better check it out.

She parked in front of the house and went up to the front door. She scanned the house magically, she detected no humans inside. That would make things easier. She cast a lock-pick spell and opened the front door.

Wendy jumped back as several chimps ran out. Bemused, she walked into the living room. Two more chimps were - well - "mating" on the couch. She hurried past them out into the kitchen. She was drawn to the fridge, and opened it. She saw the bottle of soda immediately, which was now about half full. She felt an overwhelming urge to drink from it...
1351223231123.title: Something else

choices: ...but was unable to remember the incantation.
13512232311232.content:
Wendy tried to resist, but the magic in the spell was stronger than hers. She found herself lifting the bottle to her mouth and drinking from it. Instantly, she sensed the spell in the soda trying to change her. She knew she couldn't stop it, only slow it down. She grabbed the bottle, and ran back out to her car. She drove home and parked in her driveway.

Once she was home, she pulled off her shoes and socks. She was unsurprised to see that her feet had changed into chimp's feet. She felt an overwhelming urge to strip naked. She fought it long enough to race into the house, inadvertently leaving the soda bottle in her unlocked car. Once inside, she stripped off her clothes, She went to run into her bedroom, but, unsteady on her new feet, she tripped and klonked her head against the wall. She wasn't badly hurt, but the pain distracted her her fighting off her transformation. As if to make up for lost time, her legs, arms and torso swiftly changed, leaving only her neck and head still human.

She loped into her bedroom and looked at the mirror on the wall. It looked like an ordinary mirror, but when she spoke the proper incantation in front of it, she would be able to use it to communicate with her colleagues back home in the magical realm.. She concentrated...
13512232311232.title: ...and she was unable to resist it.

135122323112322.content:
..but found that she could not for the life of her remember the words to the incantation.

It must be part of the spell, she thought. Whoever cast it doesn't want the victim calling for help, or warning anyone else. This is bad.

She tried to think quickly. It was inevitable now that she wasn't going to be able to get out of this. She was going to end up as a chimp, at least for a while. She was scheduled to be here on Earth for ten years - barely the wink of an eye to a being that could expect to live a thousand years - and she had been here two. She was supposed to check in every three months. As luck would have it, she'd just checked in two days ago, so - barring something unusual - she couldn't expect help from home for nearly three months. She'd just have to hope that she could survive as a chimp until then.

It occurred to her that she'd left the bottle of soda out in her car. She'd better bring it in while she still could, she didn't want anyone else getting transformed. She had to hurry - the change was reaching her head, and it was getting hard to think.

She went out to her car, and...
135122323112322.title: ...but was unable to remember the incantation.

choices: She brought it into her house
She forgot what she wanted it for
1351223231123221.content: She loped out of the house and over to her car. she got the bottle out and held it in her head. Then....
1351223231123221.title: ...got the bottle of soda

choices: Decided to take the bottle home and show it to their mother
13512232311232212.content:
As Wendy held the bottle in her hand, her head began to change. She looked at the bottle, but forgot what she'd wanted it for. She felt no urge to drink from it, so she set it down on the hood of her car.

She looked around and noticed an apple tree in her neighbors' front yard. Food!, she thought, And I'm hungry! She went over and climbed the tree and began happily munching apples.

The next people to walk by were the thirteen year-old Dayton triplets, Hyacinth, Annette and Juliet. As they walked by Wendy's car, they all were compelled to drink from the bottle.

"That was a little strange", said Juliet.

"I'll say", said Annette.

"Do you think there was something weird in that stuff?", asked Hyacinth.

"Like what?", said Juliet.

"I dunno", said Hyacinth, "Some kind of drug or something. Why else would we just pick it up and drink it like that?"

"That sounds a little crazy, 'Cinth", said Annette.

"Maybe", said Hyacinth, "But I think we should bring this stuff home and tell Mom."

"She'll tear us all new ones for drinking some stuff we found on a car", said Juliet."

"Maybe", said Hyacinth, "But if we drank some weird kind of drug, she'd better know about it."

They squabbled about it a little more, and...
13512232311232212.title: She forgot what she wanted it for

choices: And they made it home before they fully transformed
But they transformed completely before they made it home
But someone took the bottle away from them before they made it home
135122323112322121.content:
Finally, Hyacinth, "Look, I'm bringing it home to show Mom, and that's that!"

"Fine. Be that way", said Juliet. The three girls headed home...
135122323112322121.title: Decided to take the bottle home and show it to ...

1351223231123221211.content:
The triplets headed home. As they walked along, their feet began to feel sore and cramped inside their sneakers. Pulling them off (along with their socks), they stared in shock at their transformed feet.

"OK, 'Cinth", said Juliet. "You may have been right about that soda."

"Do you think?", said Hyacinth.

They rushed home, even as their legs started to transform. Fear of public embarrassment enabled them to fight off the urge to throw off their clothes until they got home. They loped up the front walk and let themselves in. Once they were safely inside, they stripped naked and stared at one another in horror. Their legs and arms had transformed completely, and their torsos were starting to change as well.

"We we're turning into monkeys!", said Annette.

"Actually, it's chimps, I think", said Hyacinth.

"Don't be so pedantic", said Annette.

"MOOOO-OOM!", added Juliet.
1351223231123221211.title: And they made it home before they fully transfo...

13512232311232212111.content:
The girls' mother, Daphne, came running into the room, and then gawped in astonishment when she saw her daughters.

"Oh, my God, girls, what happened to you?"

Hyacinth held the bottle of soda out to her mother, but before she could explain, Daphne snatched the bottle from her and took a swig from it.

"Mom,no!", said Hyacinth.

"Huh", said Daphne. "What is this stuff?"

The girls explained what had happened to their mother. Daphne, who was a physician, listened to their story, and said, "There's obviously some kind of drug in this stuff, but I've no idea what it could be. I'll call your father, and let him knw, and then I'll call 911."

She took out her cellphone to call her husband - he was a physician, also, the two had met in medical school - but found that she no longer remembered how to use it. Obviously, whatever was in the soda was affecting her, too.

"I'll have to drive you to the emergency room", she said. She tried to leave a note for her husband, but found that she couldn't even remember how to write. She was getting really scared, but tried not to lt it show to the girls.

"Come on, girls put some clothes on, and we'll go." The Power of Mom was enough that despite the spell, the girls put on tee shirts and sweat pants. While they were getting dressed, Daphne took off her own shoes and socks, and saw her own feet were starting to change. Daphne was a strict skeptic, butt she was beginning to feel that something supernatural was going on.

Daphne took the bottle and led the girls out to the car. Their torsos had completely changed, and their neck were beginning to transform. Daphne started the car and began to drive to the hospital. the girls had succumbed and had stripped off their clothes, again.

"Girls, what are you doing?", said Daphne.

"Sorry, Mom", said Hyacinth, "We can't heh...heh....hoo-hoo hoo-HOO!" Her sisters began hooting along with her.

Daphne was beginning to find it harder to drive. She, too, was starting to feel an urge to take off her clothes. Finally, she pulled over at the side of the road. Her daughters, now fully-transformed, took this moment to climb out off the open windows of the car and climb a nearby tree.

"Girls, come back", she said frantically. Giving in to the urge, she stripped off her clothes, and then climbed up the tree after them. By the time anyone else came along, she had fully transformed.

As it happened, the next people who came along were five members of the local college track team - Ben Johnson, Mike Corbett, Joe Lee, Jack Michaels, and Andy Borelli - who were jogging together. Mike noticed the bottle in Daphne's car, and soon all five had drunk from it.

Andy was the last, and he set the bottle down on the hood of Daphne's car. "Wow, the was weird", he said.

"Say, you guys", are those chimps up in that tree?", asked Ben.

"Sure looks like it", said Mike. "They must've escaped from a zoo or something."

"Ah, well, none of our business", said Jack. "Let's keep going, boys."

The five men kept jogging, but soon noticed that their feet felt sore. Someone who saw them starting to transform called the police, but by the time they arrived, the men had fully changed and had disappeared into someone's back yard.

The next people to pass Daphne's car were...
13512232311232212111.title: Their mother was home

135122323112322121111.content:
Officers Jeff Porter and Al Philips had responded to a call from a local homeowner regarding the alleged appearance of five young men running around half naked. By the time they'd arrived, the five young track men had fully transformed, and were now several houses away. Today had been a weird day for them. There had been several strange calls regarding people spotting chimps around town. Their colleague Mary Jackson's patrol car had been found empty in front of the Madison place, and her uniform and weapon had been found in an upstairs room. The investigating officers found five chimps in the back yard there themselves, and had summoned the animal control people, but the chimps had made themselves scarce by that time.

On their way back to the station house, Jeff and Al had spotted Daphne Dayton's abandoned car and had gotten out to investigate. Al had found the now nearly-empty soda bottle, and both men had drunk from it. They made it back to the police station, even as their transformations really kicked in. At the station house, desk sergeant Joe Korzeniowksi, and patrolmen Dave Alleyne and Hank Wilson drank from it, as did two college girls who had come in to report a stolen bicycle, Janet Tanizaki and Phyllis Miyabe. The last person to drink from the bottle was dispatcher Rosemary O'Halloran.

The bottle of soda was now empty...
135122323112322121111.title: Two policemen

choices: ...that it's none of his business and leaves.
1351223231123221211111.content:
Rosemary set the bottle down and then stared in shock as it vanished from sight. The only person currently in the reception area
who hadn't drunk from the bottle was officer Alicia Wu, who had just arrived at the station house. She looked on in surprise as her colleagues and the two civilians began tearing off their clothes.

Even as she raced to assist them, another person materialized in the room. He was tall with brown hair, and looked to be about 27 years old, although he was a good deal older than that. He was dressed like a British nobleman from the 1830's, except for a large, blue backpack that he was wearing. His name was Burgess,and he was a sorcerer who had come to Earth in order to find a birthday present for his sister, Gwenhwyfar. The sudden burst of magical activity had drawn him to Stacy Madison's hometown.

Looking around the room, Burgess quickly cast a spell that would deter anyone else from entering the room. He quickly assessed the situation. Someone had cast a spell to transform some mundanes into chimpanzees. What was the name of that one witch who liked turning her victims into chimps? Mandy? Amanda? Miranda? Something like that, anyhow. Why she was transforming all these people, he had no idea. She didn't seem to be around here, anywhere. Well, after all, it was none of his business. He had to find a present for Gwen.

Gwen liked to collect dolls, or - to be precise - mundanes who had been transformed into dolls. Transformed humans were favored children's toys in the magical realms. Some people said that at age two hundred, Gwen was too old to still be collecting dolls, but Burgess was in no position to criticize. He had a collection of soldiers form various worlds and places, himself.

It occurred to him that a policewoman doll would be a good present for Gwen. He cast a spell, and Alicia found herself being forced to stand rigidly at attention. Burgess cast another spell, and her body began to transform, shrinking and hardening, turning into a hard substance like plastic. She could not move or speak or even breathe, It was just as well that she didn't need to breathe, anymore. The shrinking stopped when she was six inches tall. Burgess picked up the newly-made policewoman action figure up and spoke to her.

"Don't be afraid, dear, my sister always takes excellent care of her collection. She never gives away her toys or sells them. In fact, she even has it written in her will that when she dies, her dolls are to be set free and sent to a nice place to live. So, don't worry, you'll be stuck like this for eight, nine hundred years, tops."

Alicia wanted to scream in anger and fear, but found that she no longer could. Burgess materialized a brightly-wrapped gift bx around her and stuck her in his backpack. It occurred to him that he hadn't added any new soldiers to his collection in quite a while. He had seen in Alicia's mind that she had a sister in the US Army. He decided to collect Staff Sergeant Bridget Wu next.

He looked at the now fully-transformed chimps around him. He decides...
1351223231123221211111.title: ...and it magically disappeared

choices: Make them all gather in one place
13512232311232212111112.title: ...to do something for them

135122323112322121111121.content: He decided to change them all back...
135122323112322121111121.title: Change everyone back

135122323112322121111122.content:
It'd be too much effort to change them all back, he thought. But I can make all the transformed humans gather in one place. that'll make it easier for the other mundanes to deal with them.

He summoned the transformees to...
135122323112322121111122.title: Make them all gather in one place

1351223231123221211111222.content: Burgess teleported himself to the local baseball field and then cast a spell, summoning all thirty-two of the human/chimps to the infield. When they had all arrived, followed by a crowd of excited mundanes, he sensed that one of the chimps was actually a transformed sorceress who had somehow fallen victim ot the spell. (He had not known that Wendy was there.) . Should he help her?
1351223231123221211111222.title: The local baseball diamond

choices: Leave the other chimps as they were
Turn the chimps back into humans
13512232311232212111112222.content:
Burgess thought about whether to help the transformed sorceress, but decided not to bother. Whoever she was, someone would probably come looking for her eventually, and a little time as a chimp might teach her to be a little more careful. The spell he had cast would compel the chimps to remain on the baseball field until the mundane authorities could come and do whatever they liked with them.

As an afterthought, he cast a spell erasing any photos or video footage that might exist of the transformations. Technically, people on backward worlds like this weren't supposed to know that magic existed. The rule wasn't always enforced perfectly, but ask for hassle?

Burgess teleported himself to the Army base where Bridget Wu was serving. He turned her into a doll and took her for his collection. Then he returned to his home in the magical realms.

Meanwhile, the town he had left behind was in an uproar. The apparent disappearance of so many people ( including several police officers) and the appearance of so many chimps caused a sensation like nothing else in the town's history. Naturally, the family, friends and colleagues of the missing people were distraught, and the intense search that ensued soon went from statewide to nationwide to worldwide, but no trace of the missing people was found.

The near-simultaneous appearance of thirty-two chimps whose provenance could not be determined only added to the strangeness of the situation. Government experts took the chimps into custody, and conspiracy theories abounded. Some people even guessed something very close to the truth - some people even said they had seen some of the missing people turning into chimps - but few people took them seriously.

Government scientists examined the chimps thoroughly. They were normal, healthy chimps. They weren't carrying any unusual diseases, nor did they have anything implanted in them. Several of the females were found to be newly pregnant, but given the promiscuous nature of chimps, this wasn't considered to be especially strange. The main odd thing about them was that no one could work out where they came from. No zoo or wildlife park was missing any chimps, and there were no traces of any chimp-smuggling rings.

Once they had gotten all the information they could from examining the chimps, arrangements were made to find homes for them at appropriate facilities around the country. Of course, the investigation as to where they had come from continued, as did the search for the missing people and the investigation into what link there might be between the missing people and the chimps.

The better part of three months passed. When Gwendolyn Blackthorn (Wendy White's real name) failed to report in, her sponsors sent a representative to look for her. After some searching, the representative in question, Helga Brightstar, found Wendy at a wildlife sanctuary in Florida. Helga teleported Wendy back to a hotel room that she had reserved, and then transformed her back to her human form. She looked like her old self, only the curve of her nearly three-months baby bump indicating what she had been through. Helga magicked up a maternity dress for her, gave her a glass of water, and then said, "Alright, Gwendolyn Blackthorn, what happened here?"

Wendy told her what she knew. Helga sighed, and said. "OK. I can't really blame you, I guess. It sounds like some high-level sorceress was messing around here for some reason. I'll take you home now - your study here will have to be cancelled for now -and then I'll talk to the university's board of governors about what, if anything, we'll do about this.

Helga took Wendy home, and then described the situation as she understood to her superiors. They decided to...
13512232311232212111112222.title: No

choices: "We think we have a good idea what happened"
"We're not quite sure, but we intend to find out."
135122323112322121111122223.content:
Helga reported the situation to her superiors, and they in turn referred it to the Children of Hecate, who were something along the lines of a police force in the magical realms. They sent an agent out to talk to Gwen Blackthorn (a.k.a. Wendy White).

After Helga had debriefed her, Gwen had returned home to decide what to do next. She hadn't intended to have a child just yet, but she had decided to keep her baby. Her mother was always after her to produce a grandchild, now she would get her wish. There was no such thing as "half-breeds" among the magical folk. The magical inheritance was passed down through the mother. The child of a magical father and a mundane mother would be a mundane, and the child of a mundane father and a magical mother would be magical as well.

There would be no stigma because her child's father was a mundane (Gwen didn't even know who the father was!). Gwen's own father had been a mundane man that her mother had used as a sex toy and later discarded. The only people who worried about things like that were the magical nobility, but none of them would be likely to marry the child of a low-born sorceress like her anyway.

The agent who visited Gwen was a youngish woman - only about 250 years old, not much older than Gwen herself.

"Hello, Mother Blackthorn", she said. "I'm Sister Helena Darkblood, I just had a few questions about what happened to you."

"Mother Blackthorn"?, thought Gwen. Goddess, that makes me feel four hundred years old. Still, I suppose I better get used to it.

"Sure, Sister", said Gwen. "Anything you need."

Helena asked Gwen about what had happened to her. Gwen had the feeling that she was just confirming things that Helena already knew.

When she was done, Helena thanked Gwen for her cooperation.

"No problem", said Gwen. "Say, Sister, if you can tell me, do the Children have any idea what went on there?"

Helena smiled, and said, "Well, Mother..."
135122323112322121111122223.title: Something else.

choices: Turn the transformed humans back to normal
1351223231123221211111222233.content:
Helena went to Stacy Madison's hometown and, using her magical powers, quickly determined what had happened, helped a lot by the fact that none of the parties in question had done all that much to cover their tracks:

1)Amanda Nightflower had, for whatever reasons of her own, taken a job babysitting a mundane named Stacy Madison. She had placed a spell on a bottle of some mundane beverage, compelling anyone who saw it to drink from it, after which they would be turned into a chimpanzee, while at the same time being compelled to strip themselves naked. Amanda was known as a low-level troublemaker who specialized in transforming people into chimpanzees. What she had done was not technically illegal. The law was that unclaimed mundanes like the people of Earth were considered to be a common natural resources. Mages were allowed to use them in reasonable amounts, as long as they did not disrupt the mundanes' society. However, something unexpected had happened to Amanda....

2)Her Grace, Clotilde Scyscream, Countess of Mergerestrith, found Amanda at Stacy Madison's home and abducted her. Doubtless Amanda was now one of the countless marble statues that decorated Clotilde's estate, the fate of just about everyone who crossed Clotilde.. Helena frowned at this. Technically, if Clotilde had a grievance against Amanda (which Helena was quite prepared to believe), she should have summoned one of Helena's colleagues and had Amanda hauled before a judge, rather than simply taken the law into her own hands. In theory, even a noble like Clotilde wasn't above the law. In practice, of course, Influential types like her could get away with things that commoners could not. Well, it wasn't Helena's decision about what to do about that, if anything. She'd merely present the fact to her superiors, and let them decide. At any rate, Clotilde had then left, without taking any interest in what Amanda had been doing there.

3)Several additional mundanes had come across the enchanted beverage and been transformed by it, as had Gwendolyn Blackthorn, a young sorceress visiting Earth to study the native culture.

4)Lord Burgess Stormdancer, Baron of Greymatter, had been visiting, apparently looking for some mundanes to acquire for his own purposes. At any rate, he had visited Stacy's home town - probably drawn there by the magical activity - and transformed one of the locals into a doll and then giftwrapped her. He had then caused the transformed people to gather at one location, presumably so they would be easier for the locals to deal with them. Nice of him, she thought, It would have been even nicer if he'd let us know what had happened there. At any rate, he had then gone to a nearby military installation and collected another mundane, before returning home. Well, nothing he had done was wrong, per se. He'd only taken two mundanes, and had done it without leaving any evidence of what had happened to them.

Helena reported back to her superiors, who decided to...
1351223231123221211111222233.title: "We're not quite sure, but we intend to...

choices: Collect some things she'd left there
13512232311232212111112222331.content:
Helena's bosses decided to let things lie. What was done was done, and turning the transformed chimps back into humans would just cause further disruption of mundane society. Helena was sent to Earth and cast a spell of protection over the chimps, ensuring that they would live long, happy chimp lives, and that the females - most of whom were pregnant already - would always have happy, healthy offspring. She even replaced the "Wendy White" chimp with a wild chimp from Africa, so that no one would notice it missing.

The incident went down in local mundane history as an unsolved mystery. In time, a memorial was put up to the missing people. The Children of Hecate decided not to concern themselves with what Clotilde had done to Amanda. They didn't really want a hassle with a high-ranking noble, and no one really liked Amanda all that much anyway.

As for Gwendolyn Blackthorn (a.k.a "Wendy White"), she did eventually go back to Earth to...
13512232311232212111112222331.title: Just let things lie

135122323112322121111122223311.content:
Gwendolyn Blackthorn returned to Earth to the home she had owned there as "Wendy White". She cast a spell to make people see her as Wendy's "Aunt Mary", come to collect "Wendy's" things. Gwen entered the house, gathering a few of her "mundane" possessions.to keep as souvenirs. She had a backpack that was bigger on the inside just a Burgess had. She then gathered the magical items that we hidden around the house where no mortal would find them.

While she'd lived on Earth as Wendy, she'd made several mundane friends, five of whom she decided to keep a s souvenirs as well. Given what had happened recently, she had to be discreet about it. She didn't want Helena or one of her colleagues coming after her. Gwen planted a thought in their minds to go on a camping trip in the mountains together, at a certain spot Gwen had found., So, it was the a week later, they were all gathered in the woods together.

They were:

-Margaret Heller, a friendly woman in her late 30's, she had been Wendy's boss in the office Wendy had worked in as a cover for her studies.. With her, was her adolescent daughter, Cindy, slim and coltish, she was no longer really a girl, but but not yet quite a woman. Cindy dreamed of a being a ballerina,

- Georgia McDonald, a co-worker of Wendy's. She was all woman, but the phrase "tall, dark and handsome" still suited her well, and she looked good in a tuxedo.

-Miki Nogura, a short, cute, intelligent meganekko. She was an English lit student who was working her way through college as a waitress in Wendy's favorite diner. The two had become friends over discussions of literature.

-Anne Horvath, another colleague of Wendy's, a cheerful wisecracker. She had brought her eight year-old twins, David and Donna.

-Anong Chailangka, a woman of Thai descent who worked at the local library. Quiet most of the time, once she got started on a favorite subject, she would talk your ear off. She had been Wendy's best friend.

Gwen teleported to their campsite, and showed herself to them as Wendy.

"Wendy!", said Margaret. "B-but...you disappeared! Where have you been? Were the others with you?"

Gwen gestured, and the mundanes immediately went into trances, standing stock-still at attention.

She'd decided to use the five adults as servants, so she dressed them to suit their new roles: Margaret would be her chief maid and housekeeper, Georgia would be her butler, Miki would be her cook, Anne would be her nanny, and Anong would be her body-servant.

Once they were properly outfitted (Georgia looked so dashing as a butler!), Gwen transformed them into automata - sort of robots powered by magic rather than science. While they looked, sounded and felt human, they were as durable as if they were made of diamond. They could last indefinitely, would never age, and would never require rest or food. She programmed them with all the information they would need for their duties, and to be happy and fulfilled in their new roles. (She wasn't one of those "mundane rights" nuts who thought that mundanes should have the same rights as mages, but she didn't believe in being cruel to them, either. If you were going to enslave a mundane, you should at least alter their minds so they liked it.)

She'd never had servants before, but with a kid on the way they would come in handy. At her command, they marched over and stored themselves in her backpack.

She looked at the three children, and thought about what to do with them. She looked at Cindy. The girl was achingly beautiful, as girls often were at that age. Well, Gwen would make sure that she never aged out if it. She dressed Cindy in a pink ballet outfit, and then turned her into an automaton. Now she would be young and beautiful forever. Gwen shrank Cindy down to five inches tall. and materialized a base under her feet.

"Dance", said Gwen. Music played and Cindy pirouetted and twirled gracefully.

"Stop", said Gwen. The music stopped and Cindy froze in place. Gwen had programmed Cindy so that when she danced, she was filled with joy at the thought of dancing for her mistress. When she was at rest, she was filled the knowledge that she was loved and admired.

Gwen decided she would be keeping Cindy for herself, so she would give David and Donna to her daughter-to-be. (She had use dher magic to determine her child's sex.) She turned David and Donna into automata, making David into a teddy bear, and Donna into a doll. She stored them in her bag, and then called down an avalanche, covering over their campsite and sweeping their camper into a nearby river. She made it look as much as possible like an accident. She cast a spell over the area so that any investigators who came would never question that it was an accident. Then she went home to begin constructing a nursery.

And so...
135122323112322121111122223311.title: Collect some things she'd left there

1351223231123221211111222233111.content:
Gwen got her nursery built, with the help of her new untiring servants. A few months later, she gave birth to a healthy daughter, that she named Ariel. Young Ariel had black hair, and features that favored her father (who, as it happened, was the college trackman Andy Borelli, although she would never knew him). Her transformed friends and their children remained in the Blackthorn family for thousands of years.

Amanda remained a statue in Clotilde's garden for the rest of Clotilde's life, which was another five hundred thirty-seven years. When Clotilde passed away, her heirs sold off the statues in her garden. Amanda was sold to a collector named Perceval Rabbitstorm, who was unaware of her origins. She remained in Perceval's collections for another two hundred nine years, when he gave Amanda to his young niece, Charlotte.

Charlotte, practicing her transformation spells, changed Amanda from a statue into a sword, and gave her to her brother, Tycho, who was a would-be warrior. Tycho wielded Amanda in battle for a hundred years before, tiring of bloodshed, he retired to a farm and transformed Amanda into a plowshare.

Amanda did yeoman service as a plowshare for three hundred years before being sold off along with a lot of other used farm equipment. She was purchased by a wannabe antiques dealer who intended to clean the equipment up for re-sale, but who got lazy and never got around to it.

In time, Amanda was purchased as-is by Jehanne Blackthorn, Ariel's daughter, who was unaware of Amanda's connection to her grandmother's life. Jehanne, like Charlotte, used Amanda to practice her transformations. She changed Amanda into a trumpet, which she gave to her nephew, Humphrey, a budding musician.

Humphrey became a legendary trumpeter, and played Amanda before cheering crowds all over the magical realms, for nine hundred years. When Humphrey passed away, Amanda was buried with him, as no one else was deemed worthy to play the master's trumpet. There Amanda lies to this day, hoping that maybe someday a grave-robber and/or archaeologist will come along and she might yet be returned to her true form.

The Wu sisters remained in the collections of Burgess and his sister for the rest of their lives. When their owners passed away, they were returned to human form and sent to live out their human lives in a special colony for former toys.

As for the humans who had been transformed into chimps, they lived out happy chimp lives in the various zoos and wildlife refuges where they had been sent. The females all gave birth to several offspring and, after the collapse of human civilization on Earth, became the ancestors of several chimp populations that prospered in various regions of North America.
1351223231123221211111222233111.title: The  story ended here

choices: Elmer is not compelled to drink
1351223231123221211112.content:
The only unaffected person in the station was Officer Alicia Wu, who had just arrived. Even as she watched, the empty bottle became full again, at which point she compulsively took a swig from it, and soon found herself changing.

Outside the stationhouse, an ancient-looking car pulled up. The driver was Elmer Pardiggle, a lanky, dark-haired eighteen year-old senior at the local high school. Elmer was a genius. This was not merely his own opinion, all of his teachers felt the same way. He was good in all subjects, but he had a particular gift for machinery. He could take apart and rebuild just about any machine he'd ever seen. Despite his genius, Elmer was the despair of his teachers, as, in addition to being a genius, he was also lazy and a bit antisocial. He got some of the highest grades in his class even though he made only a half-hearted effort in school. Time and again, various teachers had admonished him that if only he put in a real effort, he could easily be class valedictorian and on top of the Honor Society. As if he wanted something like that! To impress the sort of idiots that lived in this town meant nothing to him. Instead, Elmer put his energies into various pranks, large and small. He prided himself on the fact that he'd never gotten caught. He was working on a really big one at the moment. His "magnum opus", as it were.

In the meantime, he let his passenger out of the car. Said passenger, hight Tommy Jellyby, was a short, squat fellow who was a classmate of Elmer's, the only classmate whose friendship Elmer made any effort to cultivate. Tommy was a bland fellow, and dumber than all but the dumbest rocks, and easily manipulated. This made him very useful to someone like Elmer, and Elmer used him a lot. However, Elmer knew that even a moron like Tommy might eventually notice if their friendship was a one-way street, so from time to time, Elmer magnanimously did small favors for him. Today, he was performing one such favor. Tommy wanted to go to the police station to report that his bicycle had been stolen, and Elmer had agreed to drive him there. Elmer saw no reason to go into the station himself, and was planning to go over to the Food-E-Mart to get himself some snacks.

"Just meet me over there when you're done.", he'd said.

After Elmer had pulled away, Tommy had gone to enter the police station. T his surprise, when he opened the station door, several chimps came loping out. He looked around inside tentatively, and saw several more chimps, and what looked like people who were half-chimp! Unfortunately, he also caught sight of the bottle, and immediately ran over and took a swig from it.

Meanwhile, Elmer had completed his purchases and was sitting in his car, contemplating the mental and moral shortcomings of everyone that wasn't him, a common pastime of his. He looked up and saw Tommy coming towards his car, a look of great distress on his homely face.

What the Hell is that on his feet?, thought Elmer as Tommy approached the open driver's side window of Elmer's car.

"What's wrong, Tommy?", he asked.

A torrent of words came pouring out of Tommy's mouth, as he told Elmer what had happened. "And see, it's happening to me, too!" He lifted up his left foot for Elmer to inspect.

Elmer looked over the proffered appendage, and thought quickly. He instantly believed Tommy's story. Tommy was too stupid to lie, and anyway, even as Elmer was watching, black hair was beginning to sprout on Tommy's lower legs. On top of that, he'd already heard reports on the radio about people spotting chimps around town.

"Listen", he said, "We need to get you to a hospital, but we need whatever's in that bottle so they can figure out what it is. Can you do that?"

"Sure", said Tommy. But if I bring it out here and you see it, it might affect you, too."

"You're right", said Elmer. He upended the plastic bag his snacks had come in. "Put it in this, and when you come out, I'll pop the trunk, and you can put it in there."

"OK", said Tommy, and loped off back to the police station.

Tommy returned ten minutes later, now stark naked, and with his legs completely transformed. Elmer popped the trunk. Tommy put the bag in the trunk, then slammed it shut. As Tommy got into the passenger seat, Elmer asked him, "Tommy, why are you naked?"

"Couldn't help it", said Tommy. "Just had to. The others in the station were like that, too."

Elmer drove in the general direction of the hospital as the change spread up Tommy's torso. Fortunately, Tommy wasn't bright enough to notice that Elmer was taking a circuitously route. Finally, when they were at a stop sign, Tommy leaped out the car's open window, loped towards the nearest tree, then swiftly climbed it.

Just as I'd hoped, thought Elmer. Now no one knows I have this.

When he got home, he looked around to make sure no one was watching. None of his family should be home at this hour. He got out and looked at the trunk of his car. He'd thought it over while he was driving. Whatever this was, it had to be magic. He didn't like the idea of magic, but he felt he had to accept a thing that was true even if he didn't like it, and there was no scientific explanation that fit the facts. So, how did this magic work? Tommy had said that he'd felt compelled to drink from the bottle that minute that he'd seen it. Was sight the key? When Tommy'd carried the bag back to Elmer's car, several people had passed him without trying to grab the bag away from him. So, maybe you had to see whatever it was to be compelled to drink it. It was a risk, but for the sake of the prank he was contemplating, it was a chance he had to take.
1351223231123221211112.title: ...but it magically re-filled itself

13512232311232212111121.content:
Elmer popped the trunk and looked at the bag that the bottle was in. There was a feeling that he should open it, but not an irresistible one. He went into his house, and fortunately, no one was home. He went to his room and shoved the bag into the back of his closet under a carefully-arranged pile of detritus. All the drive home, he was thinking about how he could use the bottle of magical whatever-it-was in a prank he'd been planning for quite some time. The problem was the fact the whoever saw the fluid was compelled to drink it. So, if he used it in a prank, he wouldn't be able to watch it without being turned into a chimp himself, which he didn't want to do, even for an epic prank. Perhaps there was a range limitation? But how to test it? He thought about it a while, until an idea struck him. then, he went out and bought a small card table, some cardboard, some tape and some red Solo cups.

The next morning he got up before dawn and drove out to Outskirts Road. He parked his car out of sight, then quickly set up the card table, and taped a bit of cardboard to it. Then he set a cup on it, and stepped back and walked around the table. From one side, he couldn't see the cup, but from the other side, the cup was plainly visible. Elmer returned to the blind side, and set the bag on the table. He closed his eyes, took the bottle out of the bag and, without opening his eyes, filled the cup, stopping when the weight of the cup told him it was full. He put the bottle back in the bag, and backed slowly away from the table, not opening his eyes until he was well back. He then hid himself behind a tree where he could see the road.

Elmer was relying on humans being creatures of habit. While he didn't socialize with his classmates, he did sometimes listen to their gossip. thus, he had learned that two of his classmates, Susan Roper and Miriam Harper, jogged together along Outskirts Road at dawn every day. He just hoped no one else would come along and spoil the experiment.

As it turned out, Elmer was in luck. Just as the sun was coming up, he saw Susan and Miriam jogging up the road towards him, with Miriam's little dog in tow. When they were about a hundred feet way, he saw Miriam gesture towards the table. so, they'd seen it. They jogged on as normal until they were about thirty feet away. At that point, the two began running as fast as they could, making a beeline for the table, so that the poor little dog could barely keep up with them. Susan got to the cup first, and took a big swig from it. Miriam caught up with her and wrenched the cup away, draining it completely, and then tossed it on the ground, where her dog began lapping at it.

Elmer watched as the two girls stood around, talking concernedly to each other, obviously trying to work out what the point of it all was. After a few minutes of this, Susan winced and removed her running shoes and athletic socks. Even in his hiding place, Elmer could hear her horrified scream, a scream soon echoed by Miriam. He watched as the two girls gave into the compulsion to strip their clothes off. Elmer watched as they transformed, eventually taking to the trees, the little dog - who seemed to be completely unaffected - ran after them barking. Elmer emerged from his hiding place and gathered up the table,and carried it back to his car, throwing it and the bag with the bottle in it into his trunk. Fortunately, no one else had come along.

So, the compulsion takes effect when you're about thirty feet away, he thought. So I should be able to watch so long as I don't get too close. That means I can proceed.

The prank Elmer had in mind was one that he had been building towards for his entire high school career. Unlike most of his classmates, who either mocked or ignored him, Elmer had gone out of his way to befriend the school janitor, Mr. Peterson. Peterson had taken a bit of a shine to Elmer, and had shown him parts of the school that he could never have seen otherwise. By his sophomore year, Elmer knew how to get into any part of the school, and precisely how the alarm systems worked He also had enough dirt on Peterson that he could blackmail the older man into ignoring any "extracurricular activities" that Elmer committed. By his junior year, Elmer had his own set of keys to the school. By his senior year, he had conceived of his final, ultimate prank. He had rigged the sprinkler system in the school's auditorium to spray a concoction of his own devising. nothing really toxic, but a noxious fluid that would act like itching powder on any skin it touched. He'd attached a reservoir to the sprinkler system, with a special valve that he controlled. That way, if the system went off before he was ready, it would merely spray water.

There was only one other thing that concerned him. Would the contents of the bottle be enough to spray the whole auditorium? Would the fluid work if it was diluted? He went out and bought a bottle of water and an eye-dropper. He got out the magic bottle, and with his eyes closed, took a drop from the magic bottle and put it into the water bottle, then shook it up thoroughly. All while working blind, he put the magic bottle and the eye-dropper away, and the water bottle into another bag. The next day, he drove to the park, where many people liked to jog. Waiting until no one was looking, and without looking himself, he set the bottle down where it would be seen and then turned around and didn't look back until he was thirty feet away. He turned around just in time to see a young woman drinking from the bottle until her young male companion snatched it away from her and finished the bottle off. Elmer watched as the two transformed.

Good, he thought, it works if it's diluted. It really will work.
13512232311232212111121.title: Elmer is not compelled to drink

135122323112322121111211.content:
Elmer knew that the next assembly was scheduled for the next Monday morning. Despite everything that had gone on in town, he knew that Principal Donner would stick to his schedule no matter what. Over the next few days, there was quite a stir in the town, resulting from the simultaneous disappearance of several dozen people (including a large percentage of the police force) and appearance of a similar number of chimps. The mayor called in help from the state police and had as many of the chimps as possible humanely captured, while a special facility was kept to hold them while it was determined what to do about the situation. Many members of the public came to conclusions very close to what had actually happened, but the official story was that the government was still looking into the situation. A few days went by without anymore disappearances. That Saturday, Elmer snuck into the high school, leaving his car parked out of sight. He brought the bag with the bottle in it to the place where he had hidden the reservoir that he had attached to the sprinkler system. It was hard to get at, but it was someplace that even Peterson never went, especially since Peterson wasn't all that dedicated to begin with. He opened up the reservoir, closed his eyes, and began emptying the bottle into it. When the bottle was empty, he would open a valve that would let water into the reservoir . Very quickly, the weight of the bottle told him that it was empty, but, to his surprise, it suddenly felt heavy again, like it had re-filled itself. It took all of his self-control not to open his eyes and look. He let the bottle empty and re-fill until he was reasonably certain that the reservoir was just about full. He waited until the bottle was empty, and quickly re-sealed it. He did his best to make sure that everything was in place without opening his eyes, and then backed out of the crawlspace where the reservoir. Everything was set. Elmer went home, and hid the bottle in his closet as before.

That Monday morning, the announcement came to go to the auditorium for the assembly. Elmer ducked into the boy's room, and waited until it was likely that everyone had gathered for the meeting. He snuck out into the hall and making sure that he wasn't seen and went and carefully went to the hall just outside the auditorium, and peeked in through the door's window, doing his best not to be seen. He was reasonably certain that he was at a safe distance. Well, he wasn't going to back out now.

He pressed the switch on his remote, and the sprinklers opened up, raining down brown fluid on the students and faculty below. Just about everyone ingested some of the fluid that fell on them. The few that didn't found themselves to either lick it up off the floor or the bodies of the people around them. Elmer watched gleefully as Principal Donner called for order after the downpour ended. This didn't last long as the assembled throng began to notice that something was wrong with their feet. Elmer took a more than clinical interest when Mary-Sue Wanamaker, the busty blonde head of the cheerleading squad, gave into the urge to strip that seemed to inevitably accompany the transformation. Elmer paid for his distraction when he felt a strong hand clamp down on his shoulder.

"Alright, Mr. Pardiggle, what have you done now?", said a menacing female voice.

Elmer whirled to see Cecily Hardacre, the hulking math teacher popularly known as "the Amazon".

"Huh?", he said. "Why are you out here?"

"Oh, come now", said Ms. Hardacre. "Don't tel me a bright boy like you never noticed that one faculty member always stays out of assemblies just in case someone decided to get up to some mischief? Now, what have you - "

She was interrupted by Sheila McNeill, a mousy bookworm, came racing out of the auditorium., She was stark naked and a chimp from the waist down. She was also dripping wet, covered with the brown fluid.

Oh, no, no, no, NO.., thought Elmer, as he and Cecily were compelled to grab Sheila's arms and lick the fluid off of her chest. Shrieking, Sheila broke free and ran off, the first of many to flee the auditorium. Elmer took his opportunity to flee the scene

"Oh, no, you don't", said Cecily, in hot pursuit. Elmer reached an empty classroom, where he gave in to the urge to get naked. Cecily followed him in.

"Alright, Pardiggle", she said, even as she began removing her own clothing. "I want answers, now!"

"OK", shrugged Elmer. "Why not?"

While they transformed, Elmer told Cecily everything he had done. By the time, he had finished, the transformations had reached their throats.

"And that's the hoo-hoo-hoo whole story", said Elmer. "Not that you can do..hoo-hoo-hoo!" Elmer could no longer speak, and was finding it hard to think. As their transformations completed, Elmer looked at the attractive female across from him, no longer remembering that she had been a math teacher, or even what a math teacher was. Cecily looked back. Elmer approached her, and found her receptive. soon they were interacting in a way that neither of them would have imagined even a few minutes before.

Soon, someone else would find the bottle
135122323112322121111211.title: Elmer's next step

1351223231123221211112111.content:
The events at the high school caused a whole new uproar, especially after the first response teams that arrived on the scene soon vanished amid confused reports of more chimps appearing. Eventually, it occurred to someone to send in a specially-equipped robot, whose camera showed an empty auditorium with pools of an odd, brown fluid here and there on the floor. The robot took a sample of the fluid. However, this led to the member of the analysis team who recovered the sample drinking it, and being transformed. This in turn led to the first confirmation that the chimps were transformed humans. A tight lid was kept on this information, and the effort which was launched to recover all of the chimps still at large was publicly categorized as a humanitarian effort.

A second, more careful recovery effort was made, and the carefully analyzed sample revealed itself to simply be a common enough carbonated beverage. The baffled authorities conferred, and three things resulted:


1)The high school auditiorium was thoroughly cleaned by robots, and then dismantled, its components interred in a concrete vault.

2)The rest of the building was searched, resulting in the discovery of Elmer's apparatus. However, since Elmer had been careful not to leave fingerprints or other incriminating evidence, and Peterson the janitor was among the transformed, nothing further was discovered.

3)Emergency Federal funds were provided for the hasty construction of a chimp sanctuary. The town and the surrounding area had been scoured, and as far as could possibly be determined, no chimp had escaped capture. While the sanctuary was under construction, the chimps were cared for as well as possible.

The main problem, of course, was one of public relations. Many people had arrived at the conclusion that the chimps were the missing people, and were demanding custody of their transformed family members. The government stonewalled this, and reassured everyone that the chimps would be taken care of and that the government would not rest in its efforts to retrieve their missing loved ones.

Meanwhile, Elmer's thirteen year-old sister Emma was about to make a surprising discovery. After the initial shock of her brother's disappearance, Emma, now in eighth grade, had found that she wasn't all that broken up over it. She and Elmer hadn't really gotten along all that well, and she found his absence somewhat less than heartrending.

One afternoon, about two weeks after that events at the high school, Emma was at her home with her three closest friends, Diana Hayes, Ruth Jackson, and Fatima Al-Qadry.

"Thanks for helping me with this stuff, you guys", she said. Her mother had requested that Emma go through and sort out her brother's things.

"Isn't you mom afraid that we might find something 'personal' in here?", asked. (By "personal", it was understood by them all that she meant "pervy".)

"I'm sure she never thought of it", replied Emma. "Frankly, I'm not sure that Elmer had a 'personal' life, if you know what I mean."

After sorting through Elmer's desk and dresser and finding nothing of interest, Emma next decided to tackle his closet. After some more of the same, her hand felt a bottle buried under a pile of books. Could her brother have hidden booze in here?

Emma pulled out the bottle, and just had time to read the word "MOXIE" on the label when she found herself opening it and taking a swig. Before she could say anything, Diana snatched the bottle away from her, and then Ruth and Fatima did likewise.

"What the heck, you guys?", said Emma.

"Sorry, E", said Diana. "I literally couldn't stop myself." Ruth and Fatima murmured in agreement. She set the bottle aside and resumed work, but soon noticed that her feet felt...odd. Somehow, she had a horrible suspicion.

Turning her back on the others, Emma pulled off her shoes and socks. Her blood ran cold as she saw her transformed feet.

"Quick, you three", she said. "Take off your shoes and socks!"

Taken by surprise, her friends obeyed, and then squealed in greater surprise when they saw their transformed feet.

"Oh, my God!", said Ruth. "It's true! The chimps are people!"

"That bottle!", said Diana. "Does that mean your brother was behind what happened at the school?"

"I'd bet my life on it", said Emma. "This smells just like him."

"What are we going to do?", asked Fatima.

"Turn into chimps, I guess", replied Emma.

Ruth had taken out her cellphone, but was looking at it in dismay. "I - I don't remember how to use this!", she cried.

"But - but what are we going to do?", repeated Fatima.

Emma wasn't the genius Elmer had been, but she was a quick thinker.

"I'll tell you what we're gonna do" said Emma, a determined gleam in her eye. We're going next door to visit Veronica. If we're going down, she's going down with us."

Veronica Wilton was Emma's next door neighbor, and her arch-enemy since kindergarten. Emma despised Veronica, and Veronica despised her right back.

"Come on, you three", said Emma, as she stood up and left the room. The other three followed obediently.

As they entered the kitchen, they saw Emma's college age older sister, Elaine, and her three friends, Nan, Jan and Fran, all studying (i.e., "gossiping"). Elaine looked up and said:

"Where are you four losers going?"

Emma glared. She had been prepared to spare her sister, but what the heck, might as well give Mom and Dad a clean slate. She held out the bottle and smirked as Elaine and her friends all drank from it, and then grabbed it back.

"What's going on?" demanded Elaine.

"You'll find out soon enough!", shrieked Emma, who ran out the back door, followed by her three friends, and, in a minute, Elaine and her three friends.

Emma found herself fighting an urge to strip naked, which urge Diana and Ruth were already giving in to. Only super-shy Fatima was still resisting. Emma looked towards Veronica's yard - JACKPOT! Veronica was sitting outside with her three airhead buddies, Tiffany, Britney and Amethyst. Emma held the bottle over the fence, and said, Ohhh, Ver-RON-ic-aaaa!"

Veronica looked up, angrily. Before she could speak, she and her three friends were racing towards the fence that separated their yards. Veronica snatched the bottle from Emma's and drank from it, followed by her three companions.

"Alright, what's the heck is going on?", she asked, before suddenly noticing Diana and Ruth, whose legs were now completely transformed.

Emma explained the situation to them all.

"You're full off crap!", said Veronica.

"Check your feet", smiled Emma, beginning to undress.

Veronica pulled of her shoes and socks, and gasped.

"You miserable...", she glared at Emma with a mixture of venomous hatred and grudging admiration. Then, as if coming to a decision, she grabbed the bottle from the bewildered Amethyst, and went to the back door of her own home, and yelled inside:

"HEY, EVERYONE! YOU GOTTA COME OUT HERE AND SEE THIS! IT'S AMAZING!"

Within seconds, her 16 year-old sister, Virginia, her 19 year-old brother, Victor and their eight year-old sister, Vanessa came trooping out.

"What's all the noise about, brat?", said Victor.

Veronica held the bottle up to her siblings, and laughed as they drank from it.

"So, I'm the family 'disappointment', am I?", said Veronica. "Let's see how disappointed Mom and Dad are now!"

Wow, she's even more messed up than I thought, thought Emma.

Elaine collared her sister. "You little jerk", she said. "I can see wanting to get at that little twerp Veronica, but why'd you do this to me?"

"I was going to let you off", replied Emma. "But then you made the 'losers" crack. You have no idea how mad that kind of stuff makes me. I'd say maybe you'll know better next time, but I don't think there will be a next time."

The bickering continued for a time until they were all transformed, and then several of the older female chimps began competing for Victor's attention.

Next, someone else found the bottle. It was...
1351223231123221211112111.title: A family member

13512232311232212111121113.content:
The appearance of several new chimps alerted the authorities, who sent a team to investigate, this time equipped with cameras, who broadcast back to their colleagues when the two initial investigators found themselves compelled to drink from the bottle and began transforming. Their colleagues sent for a robot, which collected the bottle and stored it out of sight. The two transformees were collected and the bottle was taken to a lab where it carefully tested. Not carefully enough, as the initial research team were soon transformed as well. Subsequent, more careful research with volunteers who were warned what might happen to them gave some interesting results.

An agent who had lost the use of her legs in an accident was exposed to the bottle in the hopes that they could see what the effects were on someone who could not approach the bottle unaided. To her astonishment, she found the use of her legs restored as she was compelled to use them to walk to where the bottle was, drinking from it before anyone could stop her. A second experiment with another paraplegic agent yielded similar results. More investigation taught the researchers a lot about how the fluid affected people, but nothing about how it worked. Ultimately, the researchers had to accept that they could come up with no better answer than "magic". In the end, it was decided to lock the bottle away in a secure vault in a secret installation.

The better part of three months went by, and Wendy's report in was overdue. After a week with no word from her, another witch, Prudence Grey, was sent to investigate. She fought the chimp who had been Wendy and temporarily restored her human intellect and power of speech. Wendy explained what had happened. Prudence thanked her and apologized that she couldn't help her further right now. Even as Wendy shrugged in understanding, her intellect reverted to that of a chimp. Prudence easily found the bottle that Wendy had mentioned - mundane security was nothing to her - and took it away, replacing it with a bottle of regular soda

Prudence took the bottle and reported to her superiors. It was quickly determined to be the work of Amanda Darkwind, who was known to be the prisoner of Lady Clotilde Overstar, part of the witch nobility. Prudence was sent to seek permission from Coltilde to question Amanda. Prudence wasn't too happy about this. In theory, the nobility were subject to the same laws as the commonality. In practice, the nobility could get away pretty much whatever they wanted. If Prudence angered Clotilde, she could end up joining Amanda as a statue.

Prudence followed all the protocol in requesting an audience with Clotilde, and received an affirmative reply two weeks later. When she arrived at Clotilde's estate, a six tall penguin who had once been a young male witch who had irritated Clotilde showed her in to see Clotilde, where she obsequiously requested permission to question Amanda.

"One wonders why anyone would wish to speak to her, if it's permitted to ask", which Prudence realized was her way of saying, "Tell me why you want to talk to her and I'll decide if I'll humor you."

"I wish to question regarding one of her manifold sins."

"One could believe her capable of any infamy, what is she supposed to have done?", asked Clotilde.

"She has disrupted a protected mundane world, in a way not seen since the time of Priscilla the Cruel."

"Really?" said Clotilde. "Then you must speak to her. Follow me." Clotilde led Prudence into her garden of statuary.When the reached Amanda, Clotilde gestured, and Amanda's humanity was restored from the waist up.

Amanda avoided Clotilde's gaze, but cast a quick glance of recognition at Prudence.

"You will answer Goodwitch Grey's questions, truthfully and completely", said Clotilde, in the tone of voice in which one might address a dog which had soiled the carpet.

Amanda quickly told Prudence what had happened, possessing enough self-preservation to omit the fact that if Clotilde hadn't abducted her the situation would not have gotten so far out of control.

"I see", said Prudence. "And what type of spell did you use?"

"A temporary transformative", replied Amanda.

"I see", said Prudence. A temporary transformative was used by witches who intended to return their subjects to their original forms fairly quickly. They were easily undone, and would wear off by themselves after a few months. Permanent transformative spells were only used when the witch intended that their subject should remain in their new forms forever. Even the withc who had cast the spell would have a hard time undoing it.

"So", said Prudence. "When do you expect the spell will wear off?"

"How long has it been?", asked Amanda.

"About three months", said Prudence.

"Then if nothing is done, the spell will wear off in another five months", said Amanda.

"I see", said Prudence. She turned to Clotilde. "Thank you for your indulgence, my lady."

Clotilde acknowledged Prudence's reply, and assuming that she was done questioning Amanda, idly cast a spell turning the errant witch's upper body back to marble, this time using what Prudence recognized as a full-strength permanent spell.

Bye-bye, Amanda, she thought.

Prudence took her leave of Clotilde and reported back to her superiors. As she had feared, her report merely fueled their debate. Matters were finally brought to a head five months later, when the transformees began returning to human form. As it happened, there was good news and bad news for those who were newly returned to humanity.

The good news was that those who had been paraplegics or had suffered from other disabilities remained free from these disabilities even when they resumed their human forms.

The bad news was that the women and girls of childbearing age - between about thirteen and forty years old - were about eight months pregnant. Only the very oldest and very youngest were not. While they all retained at least some memories of their time as chimps, the fact the chinps were rather promiscuous meant that none of them could be certain who the fathers of their unborn children were. This threatened to become a huge legal tangle, untitl the government reached a decision. There would be a huge financial settlement for everyone affected, paid by Uncle Sam. In return, the affected people would be legally bound to buy into the government's cover story, that they had been kidnapped and experimented on by techno-terrorists, and there would be a moratorium on paternity suits. In effect, what happened in "chimpdom" would stay in "chimpdom". Seeing this, Prudence's superiors sent her to Earth, where she cast a spell, reinforcing the mundanes' agreement. In time, their memories of the events would fade a bit, but would never vanish entirely.

A little over a month later, the pregnant women and girls began giving birth. Some kept their babies, others gave them up for adoption. A few romances blossomed, sometimes in the unlikeliest places. Cecily Hardacre's daughter was unmistakably the child of Elmer Pardiggle. To the surprise (and perhaps, horror) of the community, the two were married several months later, and would eventually have several more children.

Many of the underage mothers gave up their babies for adoption, but Emma Pardiggle insisted on keeping her daughter, who was unmistakably the daughter of Veronica Wilton's older brother, Victor. Emma wanted Veronica to see her raising her niece, which somehow seemed like a great revenge to her.

Eventually, the town returned to something like normal, although visitors sometimes found themselves surprised when the local got angry when someone the phrase "monkeying around".

Wendy White returned to the witch world, and gave birth to her daughter, there. She never bothered finding out who the child's father was, and never returned to Earth.

135312.content:
"I ordinarily work with elephants", said Amanda.

"Really?", said Stacy. "You don't look like an elephant trainer to me".

"Oh? What did you think an elephant trainer would look like?"

This made Stacy pause. "Actually, now that you say it - I don't know. Just not like you, I guess."

"Well", said Amanda. "Looks can be deceiving. Actually, I don't train elephants, so much as I work to increase the elephant population."

"Oh, yeah? What do you do, run an elephant dating service?"

Amanda laughed at that. "That's sort of true in a way. I do help boy elephants and girl elephants get together."

"Wow", said Stacy. "That must be an interesting job."

"It has its moments", said Amanda. "Look, Stacy, I understand that you're not thrilled that I'm here, but I have no desire to make your life miserable. If you want to have a few friends over - not too many, and no boys, mind you - I'll stay out of your way."

Stacy thought it over, and said:
135312.title: Elephants

1353121.content:
"OK", said Stacy. "That'd be cool. What'll you be doing?"

"Oh, I'll stay out of your way", said Amanda, "I wouldn't want to cramp your style. But I'll be nearby if you need me."

With that, she left the room.

Stacy called her four closest friends, and invited them all over. They were:

- Janet Nomura, a petite dark-haired girl, who was the star of the school track team
- Anna Alvarez, quick-witted and funny
- Astrid Lindgren, tall, blonde, and quiet
- Belinda Jackson. smart, quick to anger, but quick to get over it

These were all girls that Stacy had known since elementary school, and she was happiest when she was hanging out with them. The five friends were soon sitting in the living room, watching the TV, and munching on snacks.

"You know, it's weird", said Anna, "But all of a sudden, I'm really...sleepy..."

"Wow, she's asleep!", said Belinda.

"Can't say as I blame her", said Janet. "I'm pretty...tired...my...self..."

"And...she's out", said Belinda.

"Astrid's asleep, too", said Stacy. "What's going on?"

"Znork", snored Belinda.

A wave of tiredness passed over Stacy. "Why...why...are...we...all...zzzzztt...."

Once all five girls were fast asleep, Amanda came back into the room. Perfect, she thought. Now or some changes.

Next...

13531212.title: Gradual changes
