142122121112111332.content:
Amanda decided to go out for a walk. She cast a protective spell on the four infants - they would be fine until she came back. She conjured up a double-sized baby carriage, and began pushing it down the street. As she was walking along, she saw two twelve year-old girls walking towards her, one redhead and one blonde. These were Bridget O'Halloran and Louise Jensen, two friends walking home from dance practice.

Amanda's eyes glowed red, and the two girls stumbled.

"What the heck?", Bridget.

Dah bah ah!", replied Louise.

When they reached the baby carriage, they fell into it. At first they looked grossly out-sized for it, but they quickly shrank as they de-aged. Soon they were both infants. Amanda began pushing the baby carriage and began walking back to Stacy's house. An older woman who was passing by looked into the carriage, and said:

"What lovely babies? Are they yours?"

"Oh, no", said Amanda. "I'm just watching them."

When she reached the house, Amanda put Bridget and Louise into cribs next to Dolores, Stacy, Miranda and Abigail. She sent them to sleep, and then went downstairs to watch TV for a while.

After about an hour, she went back upstairs.

Their memories should be gone by now., she thought, I'd best go deliver the goods now. I wonder if the people here will ever figure out what happened to these girls? Probably they'll never guess.

She spoke a spell, and she, the six babies, and the cribs disappeared.


Amanda and her cargo reappeared in a small hut that looked like something out of a "Lord of the Rings" knock-off. A small, rat-faced man greeted her.

"Hey, Amanda, you got the goods?"

"Hey, Vlad, I sure do. Six baby girls, all untraceable."

"Great, let me check 'em out."

Vlad looked at the girls closely, and made a few mystical passes over them.

"Perfect", he said. "You've delivered the goods, for sure. Here's your payment."

He handed her a quart-sized bottle of a pink liquid.

"Wow", said Amanda, her eyes widening, "I'll never call you a cheapskate, that's for sure."

"You always deliver the goods, Amanda, so I like to keep you sweet."

"Thanks", said Amanda. "Keep me in mind if you ever need anything else."

"I will", said Vlad, "Bye now."

Amanda vanished. Vlad chuckled. He had paid her more than they'd agreed, but it still wasn't as much as he'd make for these babies. There were plenty of people in his world who wanted to adopt babies, who, for one reason or another, couldn't adopt legally. For them, a black market dealer in untraceable babies from other dimensions was a source of last resort.

Twenty-One Years Later:

As she drifted off to sleep on the evening of her twenty-first birthday, Mariella Driftwood (née Amberstar) happily patted her six months pregnant belly, and thought about where her life had taken her. Her parents, Arnulf and Pierella Amberstar were bakers to the court of the Duke of Highwater, and she had grown up surrounded by the smell of fresh baked good. Bakers would never be nobility, but court-endorsed bakers were the most comfortable of the artisanal classes, and Mariella had grown up lacking for nothing. She had married at sixteen, as most girls did, and her husband, Randolph Amberstar, was the son of the court-endorsed stonemason. He was a good match class-wise, and she liked him, as well. The baby she was expecting would be her third - she had a four year-old daughter, and a two year-old son.

She knew that she was adopted, her parents had told her when they she was old enough to know. She had been found after the Great Flood of '49, and, by all accounts, her entire native village had been wiped out. She would never know who her biological parents were, but she didn't care, Arnulf and Pierella were all the parents she would ever need, and were good grandparents to her children.

That night, Mariella had a bizarre dream, a dream of herself as a young girl named "Stacy", living in a strange world where everything was different in a place called "America".

The next morning, when she woke up, she remembered the dream vividly. It seemed so real. But it couldn't be, could it? She thought about what her parents had told her about her origins. She'd heard the stories about black market babies being kidnapped from other worlds. Could she have been one of those? If she was, did it matter? Of course, it might have just been a strange dream. Should she talk to her mother about it?

She decided to...
142122121112111332.title: "I'll find two more items elsewhere."

"I'm really not sure what you can do."
1421221211121113321.content:
Mariella wasn't able to go see her mother right away. She was busy for several days. During her days, she took care of her children, and worked on the accounting side of her husband's family's masonry business. Each night, though, she dreamt of life as "Stacy", each night's dream more vivid and detailed. She didn't tell Randolph about it, and he didn't seem to pick up on it. If he did think she was out of sorts, he put it down to her pregnancy.

Finally, a day off came, and Mariella took her daughter Jehanna and her son, Xandro to see her parents. Grandpa Arnulf took the children to "help" him bake up some pastries, while Mariella sat down to have a chat with her mother.

"Mom, can I ask you something personal?", asked Mariella.

"Sure, dear", replied Pierella. "What's up?"

"Was there anything...odd..about my adoption?", asked Mariella.

"What makes you ask?", said Pierella.

Mariella told her mother about her dreams. Pierella looked away from her, as if thinking of escape, and then sighed, as if she'd made a painful decision.

"Mariella, I'm really not sure."

"'Not sure'?"

"Let me explain", said her mother. You know that when I was a little girl, I got the Garthik Plague."

Mariella nodded. Garthik Plague was a virulent disease, that tended to be fatal to people that were old or sick. People it didn't kill, it frequently left sterile. There'd been a big outbreak of it back in '32, when her mother was young.

Her mother continued.

When I married your father, it soon became obvious that your father and I couldn't have children. That wasn't odd, there were a lot of us like that. The problem was, when we tried to adopt, we found that there was a huge, lengthy waiting list. It would be literally years before we could get a baby. Then there came the Great Flood of '49, and suddenly there were a number of orphaned infants available to adopt. While we were sad about the people who'd been killed, but we couldn't help being happy about the fact that there was a baby available that we wouldn't have to wait years for. Now, years later, we heard rumors that some of the babies that became available at that time might have been smuggled black market babies, and not genuine orphans of the Flood. I guess when there's a major disaster like that, it makes things easier for them to 'process' babies that don't have proper papers, so they'll often try to take advantage of those situations. We didn't believe it - we didn't want to believe it. so we just didn't think about it. But, these dreams of yours. maybe that means it was true."

Mariella sat, stunned and speechless. Finally, she spoke.

"I...that's..I mean...it's just..."

Pierella took her daughter's hand. "Please understand, when we adopted you, we had no idea about any of this. It was only later that we had any idea about."

"Oh, Momma", said Mariella, embracing Pierella, "I don't blame you. I just would like to know who this 'Stacy was. I don't want to go back to her life, or anything like that. My life here is better than her life was, and I would never want to leave Randolph and the kids behind. But I would like to know how it all happened. Also, 'Stacy' had a mother and father, I can't help thinking how they must have felt when their daughter disappeared."

Pierella nodded sympathetically. "Well..."
1421221211121113321.title: Talk to her mother about it

choices: "No one's seen her for fifteen years."
"She was sentenced to petrefaction ten years ago"
14212212111211133211.content:
Pierella said, "I may know someone who can help you. I'm friends with the Duke's court sorceress. I'm sure she'll help us out, if I ask. If anyone put a spell on you in the past, she'll be able to detect it. I'll contact her, and let you know when we can go see her."

"Great, thanks, Mother", said Mariella. "Can we keep this between ourselves, if possible?"

"Of course", said Pierella. "I won't even tell your father unless and until we need to."

Mariella visited with her parents as though nothing had been said. For the next few days, she lived her daily life as close to normal as she could, although when she was in her "down time", she was haunted by her growing dreams of life as a different girl.

Finally, she received word from her mother, to come and see her the next afternoon. Mariella arranged to have Randolph's mother babysit her kids, and went to her mother's home. There, she found her mother sitting with an older woman that she recognized as Gloriana, the Duke's personal sorceress.

The three of them sat over tea and cakes, chatting about local gossip, until finally Gloriana brought up the reason they were all there.

"Alright, Mariella, Pierella's told me about your dreams lately, and the concerns you have about them. Now, let me say this up front, just to put your mind at ease: I've taken a discreet look into this situation in an official capacity, and I've made an official determination that your parents acted in good faith in adopting you. So, don't worry about this coming back to haunt them.."

"Great, thank you", said Mariella, relieved.

"That said", continued Gloriana, "I'd like to touch your mind, so I can get a direct look at these dreams you've been having. Don't worry, it'll be gentle, and I promise it won't have any effect on the baby you're carrying."

"Alright, then", said Mariella.

"May I stay", asked Pierella, "or do you need me to leave?"

"No, you can stay", said Gloriana. "In fact, I prefer to have a family member present."

"What do you need me to do?", asked Mariella.

"Just sit back and get comfortable."

Mariella sat back in her chair. Gloriana moved onto the chair next to her, and reached out and touched Mariella's forehead.

Mariella found her dreams of her life as Stacy replaying in her mind, only now she had Gloriana watching them with her. When the dreams had all played out, Gloriana sat back, looking thoughtful.

"Did you find anything useful?", asked Pierella.

"Yes, indeed", said Gloriana. "You were indeed kidnapped from another world, as were five others. and this Amanda, she is known to me."

"Would it be possible to find the others?", asked Mariella. "Maybe even contact my birth parents - and the others' families - so they know what happened to us?"


"To answer your second question: Probably not. It seems like there's no native magic in your birth world, and usually, it's forbidden to let people in worlds like that know that magic is real. I'll check with the Magisterium to see what the ruling is, but I wouldn't hold out much hope for that. Also, you might want to think about the effect it might have on those people. they've had twenty-one years to deal with your disappearances. It might be upsetting to them to have those old wounds re-opened."

Gloriana sat back, and then continued.

"As for finding the others, it might be possible. If you're getting your memories back, the others might be, too. Of course, it's possibly they might not all have been sent to this world. If would be good if we could talk to Amanda, she might be able to tell us a lot. that might not be so easy, however."

"Why not?", asked Mariella.

Gloriana said...

"'Petrefaction'?", asked Pierella.

"Turned to stone", explained Gloriana. "She tried to enchant the Prince of Eastgard's daughter, thinking she could hold her for ransom. She was easily caught , tried and turned to stone."

"Forever?", asked Mariella.

"Yes", said Gloriana. "Those people don't fool around, especially when it comes to people messing with their royals. "

"So, there's no way to talk to her?"

"Not literally talk to her", said Gloriana. "But it might be possible to communicate with her. I'm sorry, but you're going to have to wait again. I'll have to contact the court sorcerer at Eastgard through the Magisterium, and see if I can get permission. I'll let you know when I get a response."

"Thank you", said Mariella. "I really appreciate anything you can do with me."

Gloriana took her leave. Mariella visited with her mother for a while, and then went home. that night, she wondered to herself whether there was something else she could do while waiting to hear back from Gloriana.

Trenton was Stacy's ex-boyfriend. He'd been the best one of them, and it really hurt when they broke up. And it was all her fault. Thanks to her cronic lying, she'd broken the trust, and heart, of poor Trenton. Now, they could barely look at each other without disgust. And yet, he still picked up little Stacy, and stared into her eyes. They still bore that kind, special glint of a relationship long past.

It, of course, didn't take Trenton long to figure out the baby's owner. Amanda had practically left a huge ruckus once she figured out Stacy was gone. Trenton held Stacy close, and Amanda noticed the two. She walked over kindly, trying to maintain the charm and appeal of her young body.

"Hi there.", Amanda stated in true young charm.

Trenton looked towards Amanda in an awed manner. An awed manner which struck Stacy, his ex who'd broken up with him, nasty.

"Hello, um, here's your baby, safe and sound."

"Oh, she's not my baby, she's just a friend's... I'm not like that... yet. I'm Amanda, by the way."

"I'm Trenton."

He shook her hand as he passed off Stacy, but it didn't feel like a handshake should... There was a certain degree of lust in it!

As Amanda walked off with Stacy, scolding her, a sudden decision by Trenton shocked her.

"Amanda!"

The babysitter turned, pleased in a sickening way.

"Um, if it's not too much trouble, would you...?"

Not only that, but Stacy, even though she had no knowledge of her real family, or her previous life and personality, she always felt that she was missing something, but it wasn't too much that she dealt on it for too long. Most of the time, she just left it as a feeling and ignored it most of the time. "Mommy? Do I really have to go? I saw on T.V. that other kids can be home schooled! Maybe I can do that!" Amanda laughed a little and patted her head. "It'll be alright dear, I promise! You need to learn, and I'm not much of a teacher... Also, you need to make friends! You can't just have me around all of the time, and there will be other kids that will feel just as nervous. It is up to you to help them feel comfortable! Once you become friends, they'll comfort you as well, and you all will share great experiences!" "Mommy? what does experience mean?" Amanda finished their conversation and later on, they went on to have dinner and Amanda brought Stacy to bed. "Oh… I never knew being a mother was so rewarding! And lucky for me, I raised her pretty well, but it's not over yet…" Soon, she went to bed, not ever thinking that her 'daughter' would develop powers just like her, and that it would unlock when she turned sixteen...

1432122.content:
Stacy groaned as she rolled over. Had last night been a terrible nightmare? Her head throbbed. Maybe she had gotten really drunk and imagined having a fight with her mom.

"How's my special little girl?" Amanda said cheerfully as she entered Stacy's room.

Stacy shot up in bed. Her eyes widened as she looked around. Her room no longer looked like the room of a teenager. Instead, her room had transformed into a nursery. Her had changed into a crib that she was no sleeping in. The typical pajama pants and tank top that were her pajamas had been swapped for a footed sleeper. Underneath the footed sleeper was a bulge that Stacy guessed was a diaper.

"Did you sleep well, darling?" Amanda cooed. "I got a call from your mother last night. She misses you terribly and can't wait to come home. Are you ready for a change?"

"What did you do to me?" Stacy screamed out.

"Hush, baby," Amanda scolded. "Screaming at me will only make your punishment worse.

Stacy gulped as she recoiled in fear. Considering that her whole world had been transformed she did not want to test the limits of this witch.

"Your punishment is as follows," Amanda explained. "Since you act like a spoiled rotten brat, you will be treated as such. The whole world will see you as nothing more than a baby. Only you and I will be able to see the real you. If you behave, and act like a good girl, then this change will only be temporary. However, if you continue to act naughty, then there will be more punishments to come. Do not push me. Now, do you want me to change you or do you want to have breakfast first?"

Amanda coos, and picks her up. "Looks like the baby has a clean diaper. That will change soon." Amanda muttered the last part. As Stacy was carried downstairs, her stomach began to growl. "Oh, poor baby." Amanda said. She walked into the living room, and set Stacy down in a playpen. A sudden shimmer surrounded the playpen, and disappeared. "That's so baby can't get out without Mandy's help. I'll be right back with your baba." Amanda said, walking into the kitchen, smiling. A few moments later, she returned with a baby bottle, full of warm formula. "Ok, Stacy, let's fill that little tummy." Amanda said, as she took Stacy to the couch. She sat with her on her lap, and fed the girl. After Stacy finished the formula, she was burped. She blushed a deep red. Amanda noticed. "Oh, baby has nothing to be embarrassed about." Amanda cooed, as she set Stacy back in the playpen. Her stomach began to hurt, along with her bladder. "What's happening?" Stacy asked, voice shaking. "Oh, I just put a special ingredient in your bottle to make baby do what she should do naturally." Amanda said, with a deliciously wicked smirk. Stacy realized what she meant, and panicked. "No, I don't want to!" Stacy exclaimed. She heard the second to final rumble. "Help me, Mandy!" she cried, terrified. Amanda shook her finger, and chuckled at the poor teenage baby. the final rumble was heard, sealing Stacy's fate. She began to fill her diaper, alleviating the pressure from her body. She wept, terrified and ashamed at what she had just done. Amanda looked at the girl, and walked to the playpen. "Ok, honey, I'm going to change you." she said softly. Stacy cried through the whole change. Amanda went into the computer room, and began to listen to music. Stacy just lay in the playpen, dazed and confused, as a single tear rolled down her cheek.

1451322.content:
Amanda smirked triumphantly at her charge, who looked no different than before save perhaps for a dazed expression on her face.

Standing unsteadily of buckling legs, her hand lazily hanging from the doorknob, Stacy's unfocused eyes roamed the room until they latched onto the bright ceiling light. She was so entranced by the pretty light that her butt landing heavily on the hard floor took her completely by surprise. Stunned for a few seconds, her rapidly reddening screwed-up face let out a wail of pain as a dark patch began to make itself apparent on her jeans.

All the while, Amanda, stifling fits of laughter, was preparing Stacy's new necessary peripherals: a pack of magically-enlarged diapers and similarly-enlarged baby toys spilled forth from her own magically-enhanced bag. She was deliberately taking her time, having decided that a few minutes in the urine-soaked clothing was exactly what Stacy deserved for her attitude. She was picturing the delicious scene of the "responsible" young woman explaining why her favourite, moderately expensive, trousers were thus soaked to her parents, making a mental note to leave the offending items where her parents would notice them the next morning.

Stacy had by now settled to silence, having crammed as much of her left hand into her mouth as she could, the occasional sniffle still escaping from the red-faced young woman. Her eyes and ears were drawn to the rattling of a plastic ring of keys, dangled tantalisingly over her face by an unrecognisable big person. Successfully grabbing the keys with her right hand, she shook her upper body violently in a zealous effort to replicate the rattle, before curiously substituting her drool-covered fingers with the ring. Her eager tongue enjoyed the smooth and unfamiliar texture of the plastic.

Her attention duly drawn, Amanda had little trouble removing Stacy's shoes, jeans, and underwear, cleaning the appropriate areas properly, and placing a diaper over her exposed nether regions. After contemplating for a moment, she magicked away her bra from underneath her shirt as well. The cool breeze of the air conditioning caressing her now-bare legs caused Stacy to giggle around the keys, enthusiastically waving her feet in the air and barely avoiding clonking the retreating Amanda on the head with her heel.

Now a safe distance away from the infantile 18-year-old, Amanda considered her options...

"Something the matter, sweety?"

That voice! Stacy felt sick. There Amanda was, right behind her, a triumphant smirk on her face.

"Noticing some changes, I see."

"What the hell is happening to me?!"

"What happens to lots of bad girls who decide that partying is more important than school or family. You're having a baby, baby."

"What?! No, I haven't even had sex-"

"Oh course you haven't. You see, dear, your parents were so worried about you after your little incident that they hired me to give you a reality check. I told you I care for babies, yes?"

Stacy wanted to run, to hide, but she couldn't. She could only nod as Amanda's words sank in.

"Well, I care for babies, specifically newborns."

"I-I'm gonna have a baby...?"

"Only for a week. Once your parents return, it will all flow away like a dream, but you'll be left with the lesson."

"All this so I don't party? Oh, God, I-I don't think-"

Stacy managed to turn just in time to throw up in the sink. She didn't even notice Amanda come up to rub her back.

"It's for the best, really. Why, I'll even give you a choice: You can go through the pregnancy even quicker and have your baby for longer, or you can wait the standard time to be pregnant. It won't be easy, of course. You'll get fat, gassy, nauseous and cranky."

"I'm already-"
