"Wow', Stacy", said Jenna, "You look beat! Can I get you something?"

"Yeah, thanks, Jenna", said Stacy. "I could use a beer to steady my nerves."

Jenna tsk'ed at her. "Now, Stacy, you know better than that. No alcohol for you mommies-to-be! I'll get you a lemonade." Jenna flounced off before Stacy could answer.

"What was that all about?', said Stacy aloud. "Was she trying to be funny?"

"No, she wasn't", said a voice from behind her. Stacy whirled around in the chair. Jessica was standing right there.

"Whoa, Jess, you startled me!", said Stacy. "You gotta me, something's wrong with me! I'm all bloated up!"

At that moment, Jenna returned with a bottled lemonade. "Here you go, Stace", she said, not seeming to notice Jessica.

Stacy thanked her and watched as Jenna flounced off again.

"Wow, Jess, she completely blew you off!"

"She just didn't see me", said Jessica. "Anyway, you're not bloated, you're six months pregnant."

"'Pregnant?' Jess, what the heck are you talking about?"

"Well, let me explain", said Jessica. "Look at me".

Stacy looked at the other girl. To her shock, the other girl's blurred and changed, becoming completely different. yet somehow familiar. She - she looked like an eighteen year-old version of..

"Amanda?"

"It's me, dear."

"What is going on, here?"

"It's simple. I'm a sorceress Your parents hired me to look after you while they were away, and asked me to teach you some responsibility."

"A sorceress? Are you out of your mind?"

"You still doubt me? Watch me. Ah, the perfect subjects!"

Amanda gestured down the hall at little Jill McNab, who was 4' 8", and Hilda Swenson, captain of the girl's basketball team, who was 6'6". the two friend were chatting amiably. Amanda gestured, and before Stacy's astonished eyes, Jill began to grow and Hilda began to shrink, until they were both the same height, around 5'7"". The two kept talking, apparently oblivious to the change.

"Oh, my God", said Stacy. "How did they not notice what just happened to them?"

"Magic", said Amanda. "As far as they - and everyone but you and I - are concerned, they're the same height they've always been."

It all sank in to Stacy's mind. "But - it's ridiculous! Why would my parents hire a sorceress to teach me responsibility? Why would a sorceress take a job like that?"

"Well, they didn't know I was a sorceress", said Amanda. "I told them I was a youth counselor. And I took the job because I was bored. the problem with immortality is filling your time."

"So, you're teaching me responsibility by making me pregnant? I'm pretty sure that's not what my parents would have wanted!"

"I'm sure they wouldn't, but I believe in giving extra value. And what's a bigger responsibility than raising a child?"

"Look, a joke's a joke", said Stacy., "But you can't do this to me!"

"I can and I have", said Amanda.

"Well undo it! Please!", said Stacy, tears in her eyes.

"Sorry", said Amanda. "Not going to happen. Anyway, it won't be so bad. I looked over your friends, and it seems to me that a lot of them could use a lesson in responsibility, too, so I made several of them pregnant, too. This party is now a combined baby shower for you all"

"'Several'?", said Stacy. "How many?"

"Seven."

"Seven! Who?"

"Come on, I'll show you. Upsy-daisy", said Amanda, helping to lift Stacy out of the chair.

"Hey, how is it my clothes still fit?". asked Stacy.

"I altered them to be maternity clothes. All part of the service", said Amanda.

Amanda led Stacy to a sitting room where Stacy saw seven of her friends - Mallory Hayes, Gwen Yamaguchi, Vickie Borelli, Wanda Jones, Debbie Martineau, Iris Wang and Ana Castro - all sitting and chatting, and all just as obviously pregnant as Stacy was.

"Oh, God" said Stacy. "Wait, who are the fathers?"

"Remember that party you threw that got your parents so mad? You and the Mommy Squad here got drunk and slept with those college boys that Jimmy Andrews 'invited' along. None of you even know the names of the fathers. Not to worry, all of your babies will be born happy and healthy, I promise."

"Wait a minute, none of that ever happened! At least, I know that I never slept with anyone that night!"

"Oh, no?" said Amanda. "Think back."

Stacy thought back to that night, but found her memories strangely foggy. Instead, she remembered waking up hung over the next morning, and her horrified realization about a month later that she was pregnant, her parents' less-than-thrilled reaction, her stubborn insistence that she would keep her baby, and the minor uproar when it became general knowledge that eight girls had gotten pregnant that night.

"But that never happened!" she wailed.

"It has, now", said Amanda. "I can re-write history on a small scale like that. Also, I gave all eight of you an overwhelming compulsion to keep and raise your babies yourselves. You'll all give birth about two weeks after high school graduation. You'll learn about responsibility together!"

"Huh, you're a fine one to teach anyone about responsibility, Amanda!" Amanda and Stacy both whirled as a voice came from behind them.

Another girl stood behind them, who somehow looked to Stacy as though she were eighteen and eight hundred at the same time!

"M-Mariam!", said Amanda.

"You know her?", said Stacy.

"I guess you could call her my boss", said Amanda.

"That's right", said Mariam, "and as your boss, I'm wondering why you're here interfering with mortals instead of carrying out your responsibility to guard the Gate of Elthaar! Did you know that a Meta-Kobold escaped on your watch? I know it, because I just spent five hours tracking and capturing it!"

"I..um--uh..", said Amanda.

"Shut it", said Mariam, "while I work out your punishment."

"Excuse me, ma'am", said Stacy, "but can you undo what Amanda did to me and my friends.?"

"No", replied Mariam, "there are both practical and ethical issues with undoing a pregnancy spell, so I'm afraid you'll all just have to lump it. Anyway, Amanda was right about one thing. You and your friends do need lessons about responsibility, even if she had no business trying to teach you about it."

Mariam turned to Amanda. "I've decided on your punishment. First, I'm stripping you of your powers..." Mariam raised her hand and...something... flowed out of Amanda into her. "Second, I'm turning you into...
145231121.title: Stacy returns to the party to find more pregnan...

1452311211.content:
Mariam led Amanda and Stacy out into the hall. The Other girls didn't seem to notice.

"I'm going to make you into a pregnant eighteen year-old Mortal girl with a compulsion to keep and raise your baby yourself, just like you did to Stacy and her friends. You'll learn responsibility alongside her."

"You're going to make me into a Mortal?", said Amanda, outraged. "You can't do that! Punish me, sure, but making me a Mortal is way outside your authority! Livia won't like it!" Amanda turned to Stacy. "Livia is her boss, and she's even stricter."

"Oh, be quiet", said Mariam. "Livia will back me up on this. It's not like this is your first screw-up."

"Hang on", said Stacy, "I thought she already made you a Mortal?"

"No", said Amanda, "She took away my magic, that's a bit like putting someone under house arrest. I can't go anywhere without her knowing it. Making someone Mortal is like a death sentence. But she's bluffing, there's no way she'll have the nerve to do it, and she'll regret it if she does."

"Are you threatening me, Amanda?", said Mariam, glaring at her.

"Oh, no, no, no", said Amanda. "I'm just saying you'll regret it if you do it."

"We'll see about that", said Amanda. "Now, where to place you..Oh, of course, that's perfect! Sorry, Stacy, but I'm making her your twin sister."

"My what?", said Stacy.

"If I'm going to make her a Mortal, she has to have a place, a...a 'backstory', I think you would call it, and placing her with an existing family makes it all easier. And there's a certain poetic justice to it. Alright,Amanda, brace yourself."


"You'll be sor-ryyyyy!"

"Shut it", said Mariam.

Then she gestured, and...
1452311211.title: "...a pregnant 18 year-old. You'll lear...

14523112112.content:
A wave of mystical blue energy sprang from Mariam's hand and enveloped Amanda. Amanda's features twisted and flowed like water, as she became an exact physical duplicate of Stacy. pregnant belly and all. Even her clothes changed to match Stacy's.

"By the Goddess, you did it!", said Amanda. "I thought you might, so I had a little surprise ready. The look on your face is going to be priceless."

Amanda reached under her collar and pulled out an amulet that was glowing blue.

"Oh, no!", said Mariam. "That isn't - !"

Before she could complete the thought, a beam of blue light shot out from the amulet, enveloping Mariam. This time, it was her features that changed, until she became a physical duplicate of Stacy and Amanda, just as pregnant as they were.

"What have you done?", she said.

"I told you you'd be sorry," said Amanda. "And the look on your face was priceless."

"What have you done?", asked Stacy.

"This was a MirrorSpell Amulet", said Amanda. "When you wear it and someone casts a spell on you, it causes them to suffer whatever the spell's effects were."

"'Was'?", asked Stacy.

"Yeah, it was only good for one use."

"Why didn't it work when she took your magic away?", asked Stacy.

"They only work on active spells", said Amanda. "Magic Removal is a passive spell, so the amulet couldn't stop that."

"So, what did the spell do?", asked Stacy.

"Well, she was making me into your twin sister. so I guess now we're triplets. She wanted to make me into a pregnant eighteen year-old Mortal with a compulsion to keep and raise her baby, and now she's one, too."

"Won't my parents think it's weird that they have three daughters when they come home?"

"No, the spell will have re-written your family history. No one but us will remember any different, and if you focus hard, you'll remember a life with two sisters, too."

Stacy focused, and sure enough, she could remember growing up with two sisters. It was like having two dueling sets of memories.

"Hang on", she said. "Isn't this 'Livia' going to miss Mariam and come looking for her?"

"Oh, Goddess", said Mariam, coming out of her shock. "I don't know whether I want her to, or not!"

"Wouldn't she be able to undo all this?", asked Stacy.

"Maybe", said Amanda. "Might she might just leave us all to stew in our own juices. Mariam's not exactly going to come out of smelling like a rose, either "

"Oh, shut up", said Mariam, starting cry. "This is all your stupid fault!"

At that moment, Jenna came by and said, "Oh, my, are you girls fighting? Guess you're getting a bit hormonal. Why don't you come in and sit with the others, and I'll bring you a snack?"

For a moment, the 'triplets' were united in a dislike of Jenna, but they let her lead them in to sit down. The three of them did their best to enjoy the rest of the baby shower. Mrs. Willis, Jessica's mom, who had been chaperoning the party, drove them home. As they entered the house, Stacy noticed that things looked different. The family portraits showed three daughters, instead of just one. As they walked in the door, followed by Mrs. Willis, a women's voice called out to them.

"Hello, girls, how was the baby shower?"

It was...
14523112112.title: Mariam got a surprise!

choices: "We don't think we should do it."
145231121121.content:
"Livia!", said Amanda and Mariam.

Livia was manifesting as a pleasant-faced middle-aged woman dressed in mundane clothing. She smiled at Mrs. Willis and the girls.

"Hello", she said to the older woman, "I'm Livia Romano, I'm staying with the girls while their parents are away."

"Oh, hi, I'm Anna Willis, Jessica's mom".

""Pleased to meet you, Anna", said Livia. "Will you come in for some coffee?"

"Sure", said Anna.

"Why don't you girls go up to your rooms?", said Livia. "I'll be up to talk in a while."

The trio went upstairs. Stacy's room was largely the same. What had been the guest bedroom and their parents' home office were now Amanda and Mariam's bedrooms. After changing for bed, the three met in Stacy's room


"I take it that's your boss downstairs", said Stacy to Mariam. "What's she doing here?"

"Probably here to read us the Riot Act", said Mariam. "And then to decide what to do with us."

As if on cue, Livia came into the room.

"Good evening, ladies", she said.

Mariam said, "Livia, I..."

"Save it", said Livia. "I already know what happened, and I don't want to hear any excuses. You two have made a lot of trouble for me. I've spent the last five hours getting chewed out by my boss. It took me a lot of butt-kissing and groveling just to avoid ending up here with you.You're both in deep trouble - you. Amanda, for slacking off on the job, and you, Mariam, for falling for a trick that a first-year magic student would have seen coming. So, here's what's going to happen to you: You're staying right where you've put yourselves. You will be left here to live out a mortal lifespan, at the end of which, you'll will judged on how responsibly you lived as Mortals, and especially on how well you raised your children, and on how well you helped set an example of responsibility for Mariam, here. If you're judged to have behaved well, then your immortality and powers will be restored, after which, you'll be on probation for a century or so. Any questions?"

"Yes", said Mariam, "Will we have any kind of protection while we're mortals?"

"Only until you give birth", said Livia. "After that, it will be up to the Fates. You'll be as vulnerable to illness or mishap as any other Mortal."

Amanda looked stricken. "But then, we might not live to even see judgement!"

"That's right", said Livia. "that risk is part of your punishment. So, be careful, and pray that the Fates don't hate you. Oh, and don't bother trying contact any of your pals to try and get you out of this, I've already sent out a general warning: I'll be keeping a close eye on you two - as if I didn't have enough to do - and anyone who tries to help you two will end up wishing that they had not. Anyway, I'll be staying here until your parents come back, so we'll have plenty of time to talk."

"May I ask a question?" said Stacy.

"Very well", said Livia.

"Why do immortal sorceresses have 'jobs' and 'bosses', anyway? Can't you just magic up whatever you want?"

"Short answer, no" said Livia. "There are some things we need that we can't just 'magic up'. The long answer involves things Mortals aren't allowed to know - and are better off not knowing, really. Anyway, it's a school day tomorrow, so you three had better get to bed."

Stacy, Amanda and Mariam went to school the next morning. They found themselves mostly socializing with the other seven girls of the "Mommy Squad". To her dismay, Stacy found that even in the Twenty-First Century, there were still plenty of people - and not just other kids - who derided them as "careless sluts", and worse. Still, in some ways, it wasn't as bad as Jenna's solicitous condescension.

That night, Stacy said to Amanda: "You made all those girls pregnant, why couldn't you have done her? It might have taken her down a peg or two."

"Who's Jenna?", asked Livia.

Stacy explained about their "friend".

"Ah", said Livia. He eyes lost their focus, and for a moment, she almost seemed to be in a trance. Then she shook her head. "I've just taken a look at her. You'll be amused to know that she is pregnant, one day. She and her boyfriend - 'Steak", you call him - had a little 'afterparty' once the baby shower was done, and his 'sheath' failed catastrophically. She doesn't know herself yet, so don't spoil the surprise."

Their parents came home at the end of the week, and Livia took her leave of them. "Remember", she whispered to Amanda and Mariam, "I'll be watching you."

So, the triplets continued their new life. After about a month, they noticed Jenna's increasing agitation. It was only when the school year was about to close that Jenna started to 'show'. By that time, the triplets were so big themselves that they didn't have the energy to enjoy her distress when the news became widely-known. In fact, Stacy found herself sympathizing a bit with Jenna, much to her surprise. Shortly after graduation over the course of two weeks, the "Mommy Squad" gave birth. Oddly, all of them had daughters - Stacy named hers "Louise" after her aunt, Mariam named hers "Adriana"" after her sorcerous mentor and Amanda called hers "Bridget", just because she liked the name.

The moment Stacy saw baby Louise, she feel in love with her. She couldn't imagine life without her. Was it the spell, or was it just maternal instinct? Who knew?

A few months after they gave birth, Mariam huddled with her sisters.

"Guys, we've got to get out of this house. Mom's constantly on our backs to give up the babies for adoption, so we can go to school, says we can still put this 'mistake' behind us. Well, I don't care if it's the spell or not, I'm not giving up my baby."

"Yeah", said Stacy. "She seems to have no 'grandma' instinct at all."

"What do you think we should do?", asked Amanda.

"Well, we've got some money saved up, we can rent a place and live off that until we can get jobs. We can work different shifts and trade off baby-watching duties, at least until the girls start school. We'll take classes when we can. It'll be hard at first, but we can make it on our own. I actually have a place in mind. It's a little big, but I was thinking we could ask Gwen and Debbie to come in with us on it." Gwen and Debbie were the two members of the "Mommy Squad" that they were closest to.

"Do you think we can do it?", asked Stacy.

"We'll have to bust our butts", said Mariam, "But we'll be on our own, and we'll be learning responsibility, which is what this is all about."

Amanda and Stacy thought about it, and said...
145231121121.title: Livia, Mariam's boss!

1452311211211.content:
Once they were in agreement, they approached Gwen and Debbie, who bought in quickly - they were in similar situations to the triplets. They contacted the owner of the house they were interested in - fortunately, it was still available -and the landlady took a liking to them, and soon they were ready to move in. Their parents were less than perfectly happy, and moving day was not a lot of fun.

The girls all manged to get jobs - low-paying and exhausting, but they were working. They were tired all the time, but they were getting by. One evening, the triplets were at home watching the babies - Gwen and Debbie were both working late shifts.

"Oh, man", said Stacy, diapering Gwen's daughter, Jennifer. "I've worked more in the last few months than I have in my entire life."

"Well, we have to stay motivated", said Mariam. "It won't be like this forever."

"It might end sooner than you think", said a voice from behind them.

They whirled to see a tall blonde woman and a short, dark-haired woman standing behind them.

"Karla! Emiko! What are you doing here?", asked Amanda.

"Old co-workers of ours", said Mariam to Stacy. "What are you two doing here? Livia will skin you alive - if you're lucky."

"Eh", said Karla. "She's not so 'all-seeing' as she likes to think she is. Anyway, we've got a plan to get you out of this mess that you've made for yourselves."

"How?", said Amanda.

"Listen up, and we'll tell you", said Karla.
1452311211211.title: "OK, we'll do it."

14523112112112.content:
Karla and Emiko sat down opposite Mariam and Amanda.

"Listen up", said Karla, "Here's wha...wuh....wuh... wuff! Wuff! Wuff!" A look of distress crossed her face as she began barking like a dog. Her clothing vanished, and she began to shrink. Her mouth and nose pushed forward into a canine muzzle. Her teeth sharpened and her ears grew pointed. Her hair turned into brown fur, which spread over her body as her limbs took on a quadrupedal orientation and her hands and feet became paws. A tail sprouted from her rear end, completing her transformation into an adorable German Shepherd puppy. A collar with license tags materialized around her neck.

"Livia, please!", said Emiko, "It wasn't my ide-owww! Mrrrooow!"

Her clothes vanished as well, as she began to shrink. Feline whiskers sprouted on her face, as her hair became gray and black fur. Soon, she was a cute little tortoiseshell tabby kitten. A flea collar with a bell attached to it appeared around her neck.

Well, they were warned. Livia's disembodied voice seemed to spring from the air. I suppose the responsible thing to do would be to have them fixed, but if you decide to breed them, I'll make sure it's not counted against you, so long as you find good homes for the puppies or kittens.

"Great", said Mariam, "Two more mouths to feed."
14523112112112.title: Something Else

145231121121122.content:
Fortunately, Gwen and Debbie both liked animals, and their landlady was OK with pets.

A few days later, the triplets were once again at home alone on baby-minding duty. This time, Tracy was the one watching when two more women materialized in the room – one with fiery red hair, the other with long black hair.

“Mariam, Amanda”, she said. “More friends of yours, I think.”

The other two came into the room. Mariam regarded the two visitors with horror.

“Akkk! What are you two doing here? Get out of here, now! Shoo!”

“Really, now, Mariam”. said Alexandra, the redhead. “Is that any way to welcome your old friends Alexandra and Felicia, here with a foolproof plan to save you from this tawdry exile?”

“Oh, good Goddess”, said Mariam. “Look over there” – she pointed at the fireplace, where Karla the dog and Emiko the cat were sitting, licking themselves. “There are the last two geniuses who came here with a foolproof plan! Do you want to end up like them?”

“Oh, those two”, sneered Alexandra. “Let’s face it, neither one of them was exactly the second coming of Glinda the Good.”

“Sorry, Mariam”, said Felicia, “I really tried to talk her out of it.”

Mariam sighed and rolled her eyes. Felicia was basically a good person, but she was easily led.

“Fine, fine”, said Mariam, “Just get out of here, now, before Livia sees you.”

“Aw, you sweat Livia too much”, said Alexandra. “She – huh?”

An aquarium and a large birdcage had materialized at one end of the room. Alexandra’s clothes vanished and she began gasping for breath. Slits that Stacy recognized as gills appeared on her neck. Instinctively, Alexandra ran and dunked her head into the fish tank. As she began to shrink, her hair disappeared and her skin was replaced by orange scales. Her arms turned into fins and her legs merged to form a tail, completing her transformation into a fair-sized goldfish.

Felicia’s clothes vanished next. As she shrank , she was pulled through the air and through the open door of the birdcage, which slammed shut after her.. Her feet turned into talons, and her arms into wings. Brightly-colored feathers sprouted all over her body. Finally, her mouth and nose twisted outwards to become a parrot’s beak.

“But I tried to stop her”, she wailed. “It’s not fai – fai – fah- faah- Faahhhh – Felicia wanna cracker!”

“Just great”, said Mariam. “I hope no more of these idiots show up. We can’t afford to feed a whole zoo!”
145231121121122.title: Another 'rescue' attempt

1452311211211221.content:
Another week or so went by, and an evening came when Amanda was home alone, with only her baby daughter Bridget for company. Even as she sat down to watch TV, she heard a voice behind her.

"Hi, Mama Amanda!"

Amanda looked around, and said, "Sarah! What are you doing her? Get out! Mariam will go nuts if we have to feed more pets!"

"Hey, calm down", said her friend. "I'm not here to rescue you, just here for a visit. Even Livia couldn't object to that!"

"I hope you're right", said Amanda.

The two chatted for a while, and then Sarah said, "OK, girls, it seems safe!"

Three more women materialized.Amanda recognized them as her old friends Anjali, Elizabeth and Baozhai.

"Hello, girls", sighed Amanda.

"You see, I drew the short straw", said Sarah. "I came alone first as a test subject to see how Livia would react. Now we know that Livia doesn't mind you guys having visitors, so long as we don't interfere with your punishment."

"Or", said Amanda, "she was just waiting to see how many of you there were coming."

"What?", said Sarah. "Oh, no!"

Anjali and Baozhai found themselves forced into a standing position. Their clothing morphed, becoming Nineteenth Century women's wear, even as their hair twisted into styles of the same period. Anjali's right hand reached out and grabbed Baozhai's left.

"Ow, Anji, let go!"

"I-I can't!"

The two women shrank down until they were only a few inches tall. Then they floated over towards a painting on the wall, a landscape meant to depict a forest scene in Nineteenth Century France that Stacy had picked up at a flea market. They flattened against the surface of the picture, becoming a part of it.

"Aw come on, Livia!", said Sarah. She and Elizabeth began to shrink, their skin becoming rough brown cloth. As they shrank, their features changed, becoming ursine. When their transformations were complete, two smiling teddy bears in dresses were sitting where the two women had been.

A few hours later, Stacy and Mariam came home with their daughters. As Stacy passed the picture, she shook her head.

"I don't remember there being two women in this picture!"

Mariam looked at the picture. "Hey, is that Anji and Bao-Bao?"

"Yes", sighed Amanda. "It's them."

"Hey, where'd these teddy bears come from?", said Stacy.

"Meet Sarah and Elizabeth", said Amanda.

"Really?", said Mariam. "Oh, well, at least it's not more pets."
1452311211211221.title: Another visitor

14523112112112211.content:
A few days later, when Amanda, Mariam and Stacy were once again home alone on babysitting duties, the doorbell rang. Stacy opened the door to see a bedraggled-looking young woman who looked to be about six months pregnant. Somehow she seemed vaguely familiar-looking. After a second, a look of recognition crossed her face.

"Livia? Is that you? what's going on?"

"Yes, it's me. May I come in?"

Stacy waved her into the house. Amanda and Mariam looked at her in astonishment.

"What in Hades happened to you?", said Mariam.

"Short answer: I got cashiered for criminal incompetence, thanks to my inability to control you and all of your idiot friends. I don't know, maybe they were right. Anyway, I've been given the same punishment. mortal and pregnant."

"Woooow", said Amanda. "Where are you staying?"


"Well, here", said Livia.

"What?", said Mariam. "We don't have any room! Plus, we both hate you."

"I'm taking the basement apartment. And I don't like you, either, but it's part of the punishment."

"What 'basement apartment'? We don't have a basement apartment!"

"You do, now", said Livia. As far as Gwen and Debbie are concerned, I'm a friend of yours who's moving in to defray the rent and other expenses."

"Great. Fine", said Mariam. "I'm adding you to the chore rotation. Look on the bright side, by the time your baby is born, you'll have had plenty of infant care experience."

A little while later, Stacy stopped in to chat with Livia while she was setting up her room.

"Hey, can I ask you a question?"

"Knock yourself out", said Livia.

"I understand - or at least, I think I do - what your and Mariam and Amanda's sentences are, but what happens to the pets, and the girls that became inanimate objects?"

"Well, the 'pets' will live out normal animal lifespans for their species, assuming they don't meet with illness or accidents. At that point, if they survive, a decision will be taken as to whether to issue further punishment or assign them to some duty or other. The others will be left as they are until the higher-ups decide what to do with them. Assuming of course, that they aren't destroyed one way or another."

"Isn't that kind of, well...brutal?"

"Sorceresses are very powerful beings, even low-level, crappy ones like them... and, to be honest, me. Consequently, the punishments for getting out of line have to be that much stricter. Anyway, it's not as though Mortals haven't come up with some brutal punishments over the years."

Stacy had no response to that, and left a short while later.

Next...
14523112112112211.title: Yet Another Visitor

145231121121122111.content:
About three-and-a-half months after her arrival, Livia gave birth to a daughter, who she named Portia. One day, shortly after Livia came home from the hospital with her baby, the six housemates and their babies were enjoying a summer afternoon in their backyard. Without prelude, a woman materialized in front of them. To Stacy's astonishment, Gwen and Debbie seemed not to notice.

"Hello, losers", the new arrival said.

"What so you want, Giselle?", said Livia, returning the other's contempt.

"Who's that?", said Stacy, leaning over to Amanda.

"Giselle has Livia's old job. She and Livia have hated each other's guts for about six hundred years."

"That's right", said Giselle, "With her finally shown up for the bungler I always knew she was, I've finally gotten the respect and authority that I deserve!"

"Oh, please", said Livia, "The fact that you've been put in charge just shows that they're scraping the bottom of the barrel!"

"Careful, now, dear mortal Livia, watch your tongue, or I might just decide to turn you into something unpleasant!"

"Just you try it", said Livia. "I'd like to see what they'd do to you if you interfered with my sentence!"

"Don't get your hopes up, Livia, I'm not dumb enough to screw up the way you did! I won't so much as lay a finger on you. I'll just be stopping by from time to time to check in and make sure you how much I'm enjoying your - huh?"

Giselle's clothing had vanished, leaving her standing naked in the middle of the yard.

"Wha-?", she added, as she sank into the ground up to her ankles. She tried in vain to pull herself free. "Ugh! My feet are stuck! It's like they're...rooted..in..the..ground..."

A look of realization crossed her face as the skin of her lower legs became dark and rough, like tree bark. As the change spread up her legs, they merged, becoming a tree trunk. The change spread up her torso, and her arms were forced outward, becoming branches. Leaves sprouted from her fingertips. She did not speak as the change reached her face, her eyes merely glaring hatred and frustration at Livia. New branches sprouted from her head as her hair was replaced by more leaves. Then her body expanded and grew, so that to look at her, no one would have guessed that she'd ever been anything than an oak tree. All this time, Gwen and Debbie had noticed nothing, and didn't question the presence of a new tree in the yard.

"She should have known better than that", said Livia, finally. "The big bosses really don't approve of gloating."
145231121121122111.title: A short time after that...

1452311211211221112.content:
Now that it was proven there was no way to rescue them and even visitors weren't allowed nor was gloating it was hoped that the girls would be left alone. Unfortunately this was not the case. Of the magical variety their guests could be broken down into three categories.
First were those who thought they knew better. Those who thought that people got caught because they got sloppy or weren't as bright as they were. This was the case with Laura a portly little witch who spent months casing the joint, laying down charms and spells. Even going as far as to etch it into the very brick work. Everyone tried to warn her but it was no use. It wasn't that she was exactly best friends with any of them just that she had something to prove. The girls decided to just let her get on with it. After weeks of careful planning and laying down counter spells and protective charms she strolled into the apartment and told them they were free to leave and return to their old lives. They weren't sure if they didn't go because they didn't believe her or because they were used to it all by now and couldn't picture life without their kids or even each other but they just offered her a drink and a bite to eat.
"No I've done it, all this will fade soon so you don't exactly have to rush out the door but I've cracked it. I am after all the smartest witch of this or any other generation."
This was when the girls saw that she was wrong. Ever boast and brag out of her mouth caused her head to swell. Literally. And as her head grew ballooning outward her body began to wither. Soon she didn't have the muscle to wave her hands any more but still she didn't notice. Her features began to dwindle as her head continued to grow leaving only black dots for her eyes, nose and mouth that was so inflated it was now little more than a smile plastered on her red face. Her boasts kept coming but were now little more than the whine you get when air escapes from a balloon. A high pitched gasp of air and when she couldn't boast any more her clothes dropped to the ground revealing the string that was dangling from her head. The colour faded from red to yellow and nothing but a balloon and some clothes remained.
The clothes were divided amongst who they would fit and the balloon was given to Louise.
The second kind of guest they got were people on a dare. In the same way that college kids dared each other to visit haunted houses and the like they had a fairly constant stream of people who should know better, sometimes hanging around outside, sometimes knocking on the door and sometimes breaking in to grab a prize to show they had done it. This was how Gwen ended up with a full body mirror in her room, as far as anyone else could tell, or how they woke up one morning to find they had seven babies now instead of six.
Then there was the last group. They were the smallest and less frequent than the others. There was talk of what they wanted. They didn't rush in and try to get out as soon as possible, they clearly didn't have a plan but just sauntered in and let the curse envelope them. There was Meric who broke in and hid in their wardrobe for three hours while they were out. When they found him he smiled, shouted I'm here to break you out of here and then grabbed onto a hanger before his body faded into a pink nightie. Worse was Karen who came in and stood in the bathroom for two days offering brush peoples hair with her fingers and getting annoyed that the curse wouldn't take hold until someone pointed out to her that it was only to stop people rescuing them. When she unconvincingly shouted that she was here to rescue them she smiled as her body started to twist and morph. Her last words were a shout of anger "I wanted to be a hairbrush!" before they got a new toilet brush next to the loo.
There were others. Like Debbies boyfriend who promised to take her away from all this, meaning work and house sharing but fell victim to the curse anyway. Still the girls found a use for the dress dummy he became all the same though Debbie was glum for weeks afterwards and wasn't sure why.
1452311211211221112.title: Some time passes

choices: Keep using their powers for good
Star to use their powers for evil
14523112112112211121.content:
It wasn't long before they started to use this. You didn't have to worry about repo men after all when if they tried to force their way in and take something would end up just joining the household. Also the way reality warped around them left a gap in who should be coming to repossess their stuff. That added with the stories that were starting to spread by people half remembering what had happened when they had driven people there meant that companies started to give them a wide birth. Even stuff that didn't have anything to do with them ended up with people changing. A car had been parked outside their house right in front of a fire hydrant. A local beat cop by the name of Joey had figured it was theirs and went to either get them to move it or get a ticket. He left in a pink dinosaur dress skipping home to what had once been his wife but was now his single Mummy hoping to get home in time before dinner so she didn't get in trouble.
The girls couldn't do magic directly but they still remembered bits and pieces and could work around it to limited effect. Tarot readings and the like were still easy enough to do plus while they couldn't do major magic themselves they knew what was needed to perform it. Thus they soon had their own small store selling the appropriate crystals and herbs for use. However their side business was where they made their real money. Didn't like your age or gender or even species and you could step through into the backroom and it was all taken care of. It didn't even have to yours. People would come to see them about abusive partners that they couldn't go to the police about and left with oil paintings, dolls and brand new pets. Even some of the higher ups stopped by for supplies every now and again though they claimed they were just there to keep and eye on them. It might have been hard for a small niche business like this to get under way and stay afloat but the curse helped there too. This was the case for Mike, a down on his luck guy on the short road to prison who decided to bust in one night and grab whatever looked like it was worth the most to flog on later. When the store opened tomorrow they found they had a cute Japanese maid who lived to serve.
The local mob who came round to offer them protection for the right price left to sell their girl scout cookies along the street before taking their money back to pay for their scout hut before heading home with the satisfaction of job well done and no memory of who they had been.
With all hands on deck the women were fine for money and their kids grew up happy not wanting for too much and always with a meal in their bellies and a smile on their lips.
14523112112112211121.title: Star using the curse

choices: A visitor arrives, and an "epic" punishment ensues...
One of the three (ex)sorceresses falls in love with a Mortal!
14523112112112211122.content:
One afternoon, the six housemates were sitting in the backyard with their babies Stacy with her daughter, Louise, Gwen with her daughter, Jennifer, Debbie with her daughter, Roseanne, Amanda with her daughter, Bridget, Mariam with her daughter, Adriana, and Livia with her twin daughters, Portia and Cornelia (Cornelia was a "visitor" who had been punished by being reverted to infancy and "assigned" to Livia, since Livia was the senior (ex-)sorceress in the house).

Stacy pulled Livia to one side.. "Livia, can I ask you something?"

"OK", said Livia. She turned to the others. "Guys, would you watch our girls for us? Stacy and I are going to wash Sheila."

"Sheila" was the housemates' used '05 Ford Freestar minivan, which had originally been a sorceress who violated the "No Visitors" on an evening when they'd been bemoaning their lack of reliable transportation. Gwen and Debbie thought it was cute that they'd named their vehicle, little knowing that they hadn't given her the name.

"It's about Debbie's boyfriend, why was he transformed? I mean, Debbie and Gwen and I, we're not under judgement, are we?"

"I'm glad you asked. I was curious about that, myself, so I contacted Delilah - she's the sorceress who has my old job, now. As the senior 'inmate' here, I'm allowed to contact her. Anyway, it turns out that Debbie's 'boyfriend' was a sorcerer, who was playing a long game. He set up a Mortal life for himself and suppressed his magical powers, all in hopes of beating the prohibition against 'visitors'. Or course, he got caught. Remember, you can't tell Debbie any of this. Of course, the spell would keep her from believing you, but why risk it?"

Stacy nodded in acknowledgement, and Livia continued.


"Anyway, don't worry. You, Gwen, Debbie and the other girls that Amanda cast her pregnancy spell on can do what you like and go where you like. It's just me, Mariam and Amanda that have to worry."

"What would happen if you feel in love with a Mortal? Is that against Witch Law, or something?"

"It's not strictly forbidden", said Livia. "But we'd have to give up all hope of getting our immortality back if we did, and between us, a guy would have pretty damn amazing for me to give that up. Oh, one other thing - you're a special case in one way. Your parents hired Amanda to teach you responsibility. and that Powers That Are have decided that that constitutes a valid contract, even though your parents didn't know who or what they were hiring, so Amanda is bound by that. Mariam and I am, too, because as her bosses, we should have stopped her from doing dumb stuff like that."

"What does that mean?", asked Stacy.

"It means that we three have to spend our Mortal lifetimes setting you the best example of Responsibility that we can, which means that wherever you go, we have to go, too. So, one, that means that you're kind of stuck with us, and, two, if you take it into your head to take off for Central Africa or Mongolia or Decatur, Illinois, we have to go, too. We can point it out if we think it's a bad idea, but if you decide to go, we can't stop you. Anyway, as a personal favor to us, please think about that before you decide to move. We won't have to be under the same roof, always, but we'll always be nearby."

"Say, on an unrelated note, are your daughters, you know, part Sorceress, or something?"

"No", said Livia. "They were born to us when we were Mortals, so they're Mortals, too."

"Then, even if you get your immortality back, you'll have to leave them someday."

"Yup, same as every parent. At least, we'll still be able to watch over them, and occasionally even help them in small ways - the Big Bosses aren't heartless, after all."

Livia sighed, sadly, and continued.

"On a different note, we should be getting fewer 'visitors' from her on. A directive came down from Circe Herself, the next visitor here will have something 'epic' done to them. I don't even like to think about what that would mean."

"'Circe'?", said Stacy. "TheCirce?"

"The one and only. The most powerful Sorceress there is. Above Her, you get into the Celestials, and I'll very, very happy if I live out my life without ever meeting one of Them."

Seven years went by, and sure enough, there were no more visitors. Stacy was now 25, and Amanda, Mariam and Livia looked 25 as well. Gwen and Debbie had moved out, having taken jobs in another state. There had been a tearful parting, but it did mean more room in the house, and it was easier with no one in the house who didn't know about sorcery and witches. Amanda had become a beautician, and a surprisingly good one. Stacy was now a nutritionist, Mariam a stockbroker and Livia an assistant office manager on the fast track to promotion. Louise, Bridget, Adriana, Portia and Cornelia were seven years old, and in elementary school.

Their landlady passed away and the four housemates found to their astonishment that the old lady had left the house jointly to Stacy, Amanda, Mariam and Livia. Stacy was on better terms with her parents, and the other three had become like additional daughters to them, as well.

The foursome had been through some hard times. but now things were going nice and smoothly for them.

Then...
14523112112112211122.title: Carry on as they are

choices: One of the three ex-sorceresses falls in love with a mortal
145231121121122111221.content:
It was one of the rare mornings when the four had a day off while the girls were at school.They were in the back yard, enjoying a coffee and talking about all the chores they ought to do but probably wouldn't. A rush of wind, and three women appeared in front of them.

Livia and Mariam both knew them from the old days, Amanda only knew of them. They were a notorious trio called "The Three V's". Vatsana, the leader, was tall and East Asian-looking. Vatsana totally dominated the other two - Viktoria, a short blonde, and Vibha, a medium-sized woman who looked Indian. Livia knew that if Vatsana had said "Today, we are jumping off a cliff", then Viktoria and Vibha would have jumped without question.

"Seriously?", said Livia. "Are you three nuts? You know what Circe will do to you!"

"Eh", said Vatsana. "She's off at some Celestial Conference or other.. We'll be long gone before she gets back."

"Oh, will you now?", came a voice that came from behind them. They whirled to see who it was. To Stacy's surprise, she seemed to recognize her!

Hey, it's that chick that used to be on Doctor Who! She was the girl who lied all the time, and then her boyfriend was killed off. What was the actress' name - Jenna Something?

The woman smiled at her, handed her a large wad of money and said, "Hi, Stacy, I'm Circe, pleased to meet you. To answer your unspoken question, this isn't my real face. Believe it or not, I do my best to keep up with Mortal popular culture. I saw this face on TV, and decided to try it as a "look". It's not as though she and I are going to turn up at a party wearing the same body, after all. Look, some things are going to happen that you're better off not seeing. Go have yourself a spa day and get Sheila washed and detailed, and spend any change on whatever you like. Don't worry, we'll be done here before the girls get home from school."

Stacy saw ice and fire in Circe's eyes, and made herself scarce. She got the rest of the story form Livia, later.

Circe had turned on the three malefactors, and said:

"I warned you, and warned you, and WARNED YOU! But obviously, it wasn't enough. Well, you three are going to spend the rest of time as a living example of what happens to people who push me too far! Listen up! What happens to you three here is forever - there will be no parole, no reprieve."

The Three V's stood stock-still, as though frozen in place. Circe turned to Amanda, Mariam and Livia, and said:

"Not to worry, ladies, your neighbors won't see anything, I'm casting a camouflage spell."

She turned to the three visitors, and gestured. Their clothing vanished.

"Say, ladies", she said, "Have any of you ever seen a film called The Human Centipede?"

"Ohhhhh, crrr-app!", said Amanda, who had.

Vatsana changed first. Her limbs vanished, and her body became round and serpentine. Her hair disappeared and her skin was replaced by golden scales. Her mouth and nose became elongated like an anteater's and twin horns grew from her head. she hovered in the air, her long, thin tongue hissing.

Viktoria changed next. Her skin, too, became golden and scaly. Her breasts vanished as her torso became larger and reptilian. Her limbs took on a quadrupedal alignment, and her hand and feet grew enormous talons. Enormous wings sprouted form her back. Now, only her head remained human.

Finally, Vibha changed. Her limbs vanished, and her skin was replaced with golden scales. She became a human head with a long reptilian tail that had four spikes growing out of it.

Viktoria moaned in anticipatory horror as Vatsana floated over to her, but her moans were soon muffled as Vatsana's bottom fitted itself snugly over Viktoria's head. At the same time, Vibha's head implanted itself in Vatsana's backside. The joins vanished and the three were now one creature, one that was about the size of a grizzly bear, and looked like a cross between an anteater, a dragon and a stegosaurus.

The three ex-sorceresses recognized the creature as a filth-eater, a type of vermin that fed on dragon droppings and the occasional dragon louse (for extra protein). It was known that Circe bred and trained dragons as a hobby (It was also said that some of the dragons were transformed former lovers of Circe's who had talked too much.) Circe opened a portal to her private estate, and the newly-made filth-eater flew through and began eagerly consuming dragon guano. Circe closed the portal and addressed Amanda, Mariam and Livia.

"All three of them will retain their own minds and personalities, but Vatsana will have control of the body. Viktoria and Vibha followed her thoughtlessly, now they will follow her helplessly, with no control over what they do. Viktoria and Vibha will not be able to see, of course, but they will be able to converse telepathically with each other and with Vatsana, although I'm sure how much fun those conversations will be. In ten thousand years, I'll check up on them. If they seem sufficiently repentant, I'll wipe their memories and merge their minds, so that they'll be a single, contented filth-eater. If they're still recalcitrant, then they can go on being miserable forever. Anyway, I gotta go. Ciao, ladies!"

When Livia had told her the story later, Stacy ahd asked: "So, there's really no hope for them to ever be returned to normal?"

"Nope. 'Circe' may rhyme with 'mercy' in your language, but that's the only similarity between them."

That evening, they tried to put on a good face for the sake of the children, but none of them ate that much.

Next...
145231121121122111221.title: Visitors arrive, and an "epic" punishment ensues..

1452311211211221112211.content:
Amanda was the first to fall. She had mentioned a guy in passing to the others. Someone she had got talking to at work once or twice. The problem was that nobody knew when the switch happened but Mariam was sat with her in the garden one day and brought up the three V's. She only got a blank look in return. It took some careful digging and questioning to find that she didn't remember any of it. As far as she was concerned this had all really happened just as they claimed and magic was something only for story books. The rest worked for a few days on trying to figure out if she had been hit by a curse or spell. However it was Stacy who got what turned out to be the answer first when they got talking one night and she found out that Mariam was going on her first date this weekend with the mystery man.
The others concluded that this wasn't some fling or mess around and she was indeed in love and thus had lost everything. Her real memories, her immortality and even the chance of parole at the end of all this.
Nobody quite knew how to feel about this. She acted the same and looked the same and she seemed happy because she was in love.
Do the girls let her be happy or try to save her from herself
1452311211211221112211.title: One of the three ex-sorceresses falls in love w...

14523112112112211122111.content:
Amanda's boyfriend was named Philip Waterhouse, and she was deeply in love with him. It didn't hurt that her daughter Bridget really liked him, too, and had even suggested that Phil would make a good "Daddy".

Danitra, a Sorceress who now had Livia's old job, had run a magical background check, and had ascertained that he wasn't a Sorcerer pulling a deception.

When they'd realized what had happened, Stacy had talked to Mariam and Livia about it.

"What exactly are the rules for something like this?", Stacy asked.

"Well, we're allowed to have Mortal friends, obviously, so long as we don't tell them anything Mortals shouldn't know. We even would be allowed the occasional 'dalliance', as long as we handled it responsibly. Until Phil came along, we've all avoided it, because we all know how easy it is to be 'irresponsible' once your hormones and emotions start overruling your brain. It doesn't hurt that even nowadays, a lot of guys don't want to take up with a woman who already has a kid."

"What would be the line that she must have crossed for this to happen?"

"Once she fell in love with him - truly in love - then she would be considered to have 'given herself to a Mortal'."

"What happened then?"

"She was considered to have accepted a sentence of 'Death by Mortality' - the same sentence all Mortals are under, really - and her memories of her life as a Sorceress were taken away. She now only remembers a life with you and Mariam as her sisters, and me as her friend. Our 'cover story' is now real, as far as she's concerned."

"Why do 'The Powers' do that?"

"Well, a person isn't expected to keep secrets from their lover, so they take away the secrets, so there's no temptation. Anyway, a relationship between a Mortal and an Immortal is considered 'uneven'. This levels the playing field."

"One advantage for her", added Mariam, "Is that she'll no longer be under judgement, so she won't have that worry anymore."

"On the other hand", said Livia, "The decision is irrevocable. Goddess forbid, but if Phil gets hit by a bus tomorrow, there's no taking it back."

None of them were surprised when, a few weeks later, Amanda came to them and said, "Guys, I think Philip is gonna propose to me Saturday night!"

"What? How do you know?", said Mariam.

"Well, he was asking me a few weeks ago about how did people know what size rings they took, and he made a real awkward segue into what size ring I took, and what kind of rings I like, and so on, I thought it was pretty obvious what he was up to. Anyway, he invited me over for dinner Saturday night, said he had 'something special' he wanted to talk to me about."

"So", said Stacy, "What are you going to tell him?"

"I've thought about it along, long time, and if he does ask, I'm going to say 'yes'."

Mariam and Livia looked stunned.

"I...um...wow", said Mariam.

"Are...are you sure? I mean, Phil's a great guy, I like him a lot, but do you really wanna give up immort- uh, I mean, your freedom - for any man?"


"Yes!", said Amanda, "For a chance of a life with him? Yes, a double yes! I love him, and Bridget loves him! I want more babies! I want his babies! Bridget wants to be a big sister, and I want her to be a big sister!"

"But think of what you're giving up!", said Livia.

"What am I giving up?", said Amanda. "I feel more alive now than I ever have in my life! But don't you see? Because are lives are so short, we have to get the most out of them! Love is worth the risk of losing everything! I'd rather have a short time with him than to live forever without him!"

Livia turned away, tears in her eyes. "But...but...I...I"ll miss you when you're gone!"

Amanda hugged Livia from behind, laughing and crying at the same time.

"To think that the Great and Terrible Livia would ever say something like that to the likes of me! Oh, Livia, I love you, too! And maybe you don't understand this right now, but that love is all the sweeter to me because I know that we won't always be together."

"Oh, do whatever your heart tells you!", said Livia, sobbing, and then she astonished them all by kissing Amanda on the cheek.

Saturday night came and Amanda got ready to leave on her date.

"You be good for your Aunties", she said to Bridget. Livia, Mariam and Stacy wished her luck.

The evening came and went with no further sign of Amanda. The next morning at breakfast, Bridget said:

"Didn't Mommy come home last night?"

"Uhh...welll..."said Stacy, "Probably it got late, and she didn't want to drive home while she was sleepy, you know?"

"Oh", said Bridget. "So you don't think that she and Phil were getting a head start on getting me a little brother or sister?"

When she'd finished coughing, Stacy said, "Let's not repeat that one for Mommy, OK?"

Amanda came home just before lunch.

"So," said Stacy. "It went well?"

"It was everything I'd hoped for! Bridget, honey, Phil is going to be your Daddy!"

"Yay!", said Bridget.

Stacy, Livia and Mariam congratulated Amanda, and there was tears and joy.

A few months later, Amanda and Phil were married in a simple ceremony. Bridget stayed with her Aunts Livia, Mariam and Stacy while the happy couple went on a honeymoon to Tokyo. After that, she and Amanda moved in with Phil, which departure precipitated another tearful scene.

Next...
14523112112112211122111.title: let her be happy

145231121121122111221111.content:
More time passed. The housemates turned 30, and their daughters were 12. Amanda and Phil now had an infant son named John.

Stacy began dating a co-worker, Bill Watson, a physical therapist at the medical complex where she worked as a nutritionist. They began to get serious. Louise liked him, and Amanda, Livia and Mariam all gave him their seal of approval. Eventually, Bill proposed, and Stacy accepted. When Amanda had moved out, she had sold her share of the house to the others. Now, Stacy was preparing to do the same. One night she met with Livia and Mariam to discuss the situation.

"Just so you know", said Stacy, "Bill and I both like this area a lot, so there's no danger of us moving, and forcing you two to move as well."

"That's good to hear", said Livia.

"Wow, this place used to be so crowded", said Mariam. "It'll seem almost empty with just the two of us, and Adriana, Portia and Cornelia."

"Yeah", said Livia. "And in a few years, the girls will go out on their own, and it will just be the two of us!"

"Maybe people will think we're an old couple", said Mariam.

"I think some of the neighbors think that already", said Stacy.

"Really?", said Mariam. "We were a couple - sort of -once - a long time ago."

"Oh, no, don't tell her about that!", said Livia, blushing.

"Do tell", said Stacy. "I didn't think you two swung that way."

"It wasn't exactly like that", said Mariam. "Although it is true, that when you're Immortal, you end up trying all sorts of things, eventually. No, we were just kids in magic school, experimenting, the way Mortal college kids do. We would each take turns transforming the other one into their 'dream man', and you know, 'experimenting'. You know, Livia made a surprisingly cute guy!"

"You made a pretty studly guy, too, you know", said Livia. "Certainly, Mother Charlotte seemed to think so."

"Oh, here we go", said Mariam.

"She was our senior magic instructor", said Livia, "and she met Mariam when she was wearing a male form and calling herself 'Mario'. Charlotte got the hots for 'Mario', and it was all Mariam could do to get away from her before Charlotte had her way with 'Mario'."

"Oh, Goddess", said Mariam. "Charlotte was all hands! Still, at least I didn't spend five years as a squirrel."

"What?", said Stacy.

"You never forget anything, do you?", said Livia. "What happened was, me and this guy, Julius, were horsing around trying to zap each other with transformation spells, and we somehow managed to hit each other with simultaneous spells and turned each other into squirrels! We only knew spoken spells in those days, and as squirrels, we couldn't speak, so we couldn't turn each other back! Mother Miranda, our teacher, was furious. She locked us in squirrel form and turned us loose in the Forest of J'Raan, which had a large squirrel population. By the time she came back for us five years later, we'd both done our part to make the squirrel population there even larger. This was centuries ago, so by now, most of the squirrels in the Forest are likely descended from Julius and me. I'm still under a curse that if I ever use a squirrel transformation spell on myself or anyone else, I'll be turned into a squirrel permanently."

"Ah, those were the days", Mariam said.

"Too funny", said Stacy. "Say, I wanted to ask you. You know how as long as you're under punishment, you two have to be somewhere near me, even if not necessarily in the same house? That doesn't mean that you two have to go on my honeymoon, do you?"

"No, an allowance is made for privacy", said Livia. "So we won't have to tag along and cramp your style."

Soon, Stacy and Bill were married,and she and Louise want to live in a new home with him, although of course there were frequent visits with Aunties Livia, Mariam and Amanda.

Next...
145231121121122111221111.title: Cupid strikes again

choices: At long last love for Livia
14523112112112211122111111.content:
Several more years passed Stacy turned 36, and the one-time housemates' daughters were now 18. Stacy and Amanda still visited Mariam and Livia often, Stacy now had a second daughter, whom she'd named Sharlene.

Karla the Dog, Emiko the Cat and Alexandra the Goldfish had lived out normal animal lifespans and had returned to their normal forms to face judgement. Livia had later heard that they'd been given their immortality back and sentenced to a thousand years of community service. Felicia the Parrot was still living with Mariam and Livia - parrots lived a long time. Giselle the Oak Tree was still growing in the back yard - she might be there for centuries, Danitra had cast a protection spell, so that whoever lived in that house would not cut her down prematurely. The various bits of furniture and toys that were really transformed sorcerers and sorceresses were mostly in storage in the attic.

She thought about what life would be like now for Livia and Mariam.

The girls will be leaving to go to college, soon, and then it will be just the two of them rattling around that big old house. Maybe they could move someplace smaller?

But then the Fates intervened. Mariam had a new co-workers in the brokerage where she worked, George Martinez. The two became fast friends, but because it wasn't a typical "romance" - no hearts and flowers stuff, just two people enjoying getting to know one another - Mariam didn't even notice how much George was beginning to mean to her. Livia had noticed, of course, but she was torn over what to do about it. As with Amanda, she was appalled at the thought of her friend giving up immortality for what could only be a short-term relationship - fifty or sixty years, at most. On the other hand, it was true that Amanda seemed very happy with Phil, and it would be selfish for her to try to make Mariam do what she thought she should do.

It had finally happened one afternoon, when Mariam and Livia were home alone.

"I'm sorry, Liv", Mariam said, "I never meant for this to happen, I never thought it could happen, but I was having lunch with George today, and we suddenly realized how much he meant to me, and I kissed him, and he kissed me back, and I knew it was all over. I could feel my memories beginning to fade. I fought it as long as I could, I wanted to talk you as the woman I was one last time, before I...I..."

Livia could almost see it as the change happened. She surprised Mariam with a bearhug, so her friend couldn't see the tears in her eyes.

"Congratulations, Mariam", she said. "Please be happy for as long as you can."

Later, Livia talked to Stacy about it.

"I feel so alone, Stace. They've both come to mean so much to me! I mean, they're both still there, but I'm the only one who still remembers the old days. And, someday, assuming that judgement goes in my favor, I'll have to face Immortality without them. Goddess, Mortal life is one parting after another! How do you stand it?"

Stacy consoled her friend as best she could.

Some time later, Mariam and George were engaged, and later married. Livia sold them her share in the house, and moved into a smaller place nearby. George and Mariam moved in after they married. A year later, Mariam gave birth to a daughter that they named Petra.

Next...
14523112112112211122111111.title: Mariam

145231121121122111221111112.content:
Three more years passed, Stacy and her pals were now 39, and their eldest daughters were 21. One afternoon, Livia was sitting in her new home, chatting with Cornelia, who was home visiting from college. Cornelia was telling Livia a carefully-edited version of her life at college, but Livia was aware that while Cornelia had had several "dalliances" with both male and female schoolmates, she had avoided any permanent attachments.

Livia worried about what would happen to Cornelia. Originally, she had been a sorceress who had violated the "no visitors" rule, and had been reverted to infancy with her memories of her previous life wiped. She'd also been changed physically so that she was Portia's identical twin. Annoyed at first with the burden of an extra, Livia had soon come to care for her as much as she did for Portia.

What Livia hadn't been sure about was the nature of Cornelia's sentence. Since she no longer remembered her life as a sorceress, she wouldn't know what behavior to avoid. Danitra had explained it to her, once.

"She violated a rule after several warnings had been given, so her sentence is extra harsh. She has to live a responsible life and avoid Mortal romantic entanglements, and if she does that, she'll be given her immortality back."


"But she doesn't know any of that! You're saying she has to play a game well where she not only doesn't know the rules, she doesn't even know she's playing the game!"

"That's right, and you can't tell her. Basically, what happens to her is up the Fates."

Livia had done her best to instill a sense of responsibility in both of her girls, but in Cornelia, especially. IT was true that Cornelia played around more than Livia - as her mom - might like, but she seemed to be doing so carefully.

Her reverie was interrupted by a knock at the door. Livia answered it, and was surprised to see that it was Danitra.

"Hi", she said. "Come on in!"

"Hi, Aunt Dani", said Cornelia, who knew Danitra as a friend of her mother's.

"Hey, kiddo", said Danitra. "Can I have a word in private with your mom? Don't go far, 'cause afterwards, I'm going to want to talk with you."

"OK", said Cornelia, puzzled. "I'll be out back when you need me."

After Cornelia had left the room, Livia turned to Danitra, and said:

"Alright, what's going on?"

"Well, I've got good news for you, Liv. There's been a general review of your sentence, and it's being reduced."

"How do you mean, 'reduced'?"

"Well, you still have to survive through a normal Mortal lifespan - which for our purposes means survive until you're at least eighty - and avoid avoid falling in love with a Mortal. Oh, and live a generally responsible life. But you're off the hook as far as keeping Stacy on the straight-and-narrow. She seems to have turned out OK, anyway. So, to sum up: Just behave yourself and make it to the end, and you'll get your immortality back."

"Wooow", said Livia. "And what about Cornelia?"

"She'll be given her memories back. Otherwise, the same rules as you: Live to eighty, be responsible, no falling in love with a mortal. At least now, she'll know the rules she's supposed to be playing by."

"Huh", said Livia, who went and called Cornelia into the room.

"Hey, guys, what's going on?", asked Cornelia.

"Remember", said Danitra, touching Cornelia's forehead. Cornelia looked stunned, like she'd been lunched in the face. Livia guided her onto the couch, and gasped as Cornelia grabbed her in a fierce embrace, clinging to her frantically.

"Hanh..Hannnnhhh...Haaaaannnnhhhh", said Cornelia, as memories poured into her mind. "Ooooohhh, now I understand so much!"

She relaxed her grip on Livia, but did not let go. She closed her eyes, and rested her head on the other woman's shoulder. Finally, she raised her head and looked at Livia.

"Thank you for everything you've done for me...can..can...can you still be my...my Mom?"

"Kiddo, I won't ever stop being your Mom", said Livia, returning her daughter's embrace.

Next..
145231121121122111221111112.title: A visitor

1452311211211221112211111123.content:
In the end, Livia lived well past eighty. Eventually the morning of her one hundredth birthday came. She was resident in an assisted living facility, sharing a unit with Cornelia, who was now eighty-two years old. Both had avoided any romantic entanglements, and believed that they had lived reasonably well-behaved lives.

Livia was the last of the old roommates left. Even her other daughter, Portia, had passed away a few years ago. Still, Grammy Livia and Auntie Cornelia were frequently visited by Livia's grandchildren, great-grandchildren and even some great-great-grandchildren. When she'd reached eighty, she could have petitioned for an end to her sentence, but she hadn't wanted to leave Cornelia to serve out her sentence alone, so she'd stayed. Even when Cornelia had passed eighty, they had waited a little while. Finally, they'd agreed to go together when Livia reached a hundred.

After they'd had breakfast, they sat down together on the couch, and Livia said, "Now, please."

Danitra materialized in front of them. "Any last things you want to do?"

"No, we're ready."

Danitra gestured, and the years fell off of the two old women, leaving them both looking twenty-one again.

"Ah, it's good to be young again", said Cornelia.

Danitra cast a spell, and two dummies resembling Livia and Cornelia appeared on the couch. They would fool the Mortals, who would believe that the two women had passed away in their sleep.

Danitra led them before a tribunal, but it was a formality, and they swiftly had their immortality and magic returned to them. They went back to their individual homes, but they were so used to living together that they magically merges their two residences.

They got new jobs, and from time to time - with permission - they discreetly looked in on their Mortal relations. Eventually, all of the Sorcerers and Sorceresses who had been transformed served out their sentences and were returned to other duties. The last one on Earth was Giselle the Oak Tree, who finally returned several hundred years later. Giselle had found her centuries had left her with a serenity like she'd never known, and so, when her immortality was returned to her, she received permission to take up residence in the Forest of Jirraan, transforming herself permanently into an oak tree. When they had time, Livia and Cornelia would take a picnic lunch, sitting in Giselle's shade, discussing the latest news and gossip where they knew that Giselle could hear, even if she could no longer speak.

They both agreed that it was the most peaceful place they had ever known.

15.title: I work with Grandparents

151.content:
"Stacy, why don't you just relax while I get dinner. It will be ready in a little while."

"Sure, I'll be in the living room watching TV." How would you get through this week with

this lady who didn't seem to have the faintest understanding of your life or lifestyle.

As you sat contemplating this while checking out something on the Sci-Fi channel and

texting a friend. Before long, the smell of pot roast, mashed potatoes, and veggies

cooking hit your nose. Though usually not a big eater, for some reason you find yourself

famished.

"Dinner is served," you hear shortly after, and then head to the table to tuck in.

Soon, you have polished off what she put on your plate and gotten through seconds,

look up to see her smiling at you.

"What?" you mumble over your last mouthful.

"It's just makes me happy to see you enjoy my cooking so much."

"It was just really great, reminded me of when I went to Grams place this last

summer."

"It was nothing...really. I just hope you saved room for dessert. I made something very

special, and I have a wonderful drink to wash it down with."

"Bring it on Amanda, you rock!" you say, puzzling over what you had been upset

about before. Sure, things might be a little different this week, but she could

adjust. Such cooking would be great if this is what it would be like until dad and

mom got home.

As if to rouse you from your thoughts, Amanda returned with pastries and some sort of

dark, fizzing drink.

The smells were like an utterly enchanting aroma, and some part of her kept

wondering if she ought to be nervous. Yet, this taste extravaganza was just

so good she had to have more.

"You know, I'm not allowed to drink alcohol," she told Amanda, with the last shred of

resistance she had.

"Sweetie, I would never do that to you. Everything here is perfectly okay for you,

I promise."

As she crossed her heart and grinned at you, you find any nervousness you might

have had has departed as you take one of the pastries and a swig of the juice, and it

is as if your taste buds light up.

A warm glow seems to engulf you, and the next thing you know you find you're open

somehow. You feel like you might agree to anything, just to keep enjoying this

kind of treatment.

Seeming to sense this, Amanda comes over and takes you by the hand and looks you

you in the eye.

"Now Stacy, we are going to have a wonderful week. But, we are going to need to

make some adjustments."

Without really thinking about it, you answer ,"Sure, I'm okay with that."

"That is just great Stacy. Remember how I told you that I take care of old people.

Well, I suppose I could learn in time to care for young people. But as it is, we don't

have that luxury. So, I need for you to get much older for me. Really, it's for the best

and just for the week. I'll even give you some say in the process, and of course meals

like the one I just cooked all week long. You can either do this gradually or fairly

quickly. I'll leave that choice up to you."
151.title: Dinner and Just Desserts

15113.content:
"There are some things we have to do first," Amanda stated.

"Like what, can't you just make me an old lady?"

"Sure, I will do that but not before we have an understanding on how things will go this week."

"Okay, I'm ready, what do I need to know?"

"First things first, I want you to take this suitcase and garment bag and take them to your room. Pick out an outfit

suitable for an elderly old lady of between age 80 and 100. Then come on back and we'll continue."

"Sounds fun," replied Stacy, and raced to her room. She soon returned dressed in lavender polyester slacks,

with a long sleeved dark purple top, a silver shawl draped over her shoulders, with black low heels, and pearl

ear rings and a double strand pearl necklace.

"Alright, I'm dressed, what's next?"

"Sweetie, you can't wear your own bra, it won't fit right in a little while," Amanda replied, handing her a small bag

with bras, panties, a girdle or two, and support hose."Go and put these on underneath, and then come back."

"Oh, all right...this is becoming kind of a chore--but I'll do it."

She returned again, this time complaining that nothing fit quite right, it all seemed a little big.

"It won't be soon, trust me," Amanda said matter-of-factly. "Now, here are the rules for the week. When you get

up in the morning, you'll revert to an 18 year old. You will stay that way throughout the day, and you can even go

to cheer leading practice. Once all your school stuff is done, I suggest you get home quickly. Within a half hour

after school and cheer leading gets out, within 10 minutes you'll be an old woman again. If you try to tell anyone

what is happening, either during or after school, the same fate awaits them. Anyone of your friends who stops by

for a visit will be transformed until they leave. Only, they will think and act as if they'd always been that old. On

the weekend, we can go and do things but only as a couple of old ladies, and if any friends come along they will

be old too. Any questions?"

"No, not really, seems pretty clear."

"One more thing, you need to choose an age between 80 and 105, or if you don't really care I'll just set things in

motion and the age will be chosen at random. Ready?"

" Go for it!"

"Oh, and this box here is for you as well. It has little items you may need when you hit your golden years."

"Oh would hurry...up?"Amanda replied, as she started racing through time. Soon she had passed into her late

twenties, her hair getting longer, her body filling out a bit.

"Mmmmhmmm, this is one hot bod," she murmurred.

"Don't get too used to it, it won't last."

Sure enough, she soon found herself clearing her early forties, as fine lines and crow's feet etched her face, as

bags under her eyes and a light droop of the breasts. She looked a bit more matronly now, and her eyes didn't

focus as well.

"Not seeing all that well, and is it getting hot in here or what?"

"Here are some glasses, and trust me, they will work," she remarked, handing her some sequined cat's eye

silver glasses on a beaded chain."As for the hot flashes, they will pass in a moment."

Which they did, as Stacy passed 58, soon hitting 59, 60,61,62, and 63, her hair getting more and more gray by

the moment, and now it only reached the edge of her shoulders. Her clothes did seem to fit better, and she was

glad she had the girdle and support hose."

"Well, I've got a sudden hankerin fer a game a bingo...is that my voice? I sound so...so..."

"Old? Well, you aren't a spring chicken anymore."

"No guess not. Hey, leasht I qualify fer dem shenior discountsh. Hey wash wiff ma teef?

"Here, put these in," she said as she handed the seventy-eight year old some dentures.

"There, that's better. An kin ya hep me ta a seat there dearie? The joints are a bit achey, I don't seem ta be able

ta stand real well. The body ain't as spry as it once were ya know girlie. Could use on a them...one a them...ta

an git round...oh, what ya call it, a..."

"A cane?"

"Rain...no don't spose it's sposed ta rain,"

Amanda put a cane in her hand.

"Well thankee dearie, that is jes the thing sure nuff."

As the process came to an end, Stacy found herself at age 89, leaning on a cane. Her hair was completely white

and in a tight pin curl perm, and her skin was a mass of bags, sags, and wrinkles. She shuffled over to the

kitchen table and sat down opposite Amanda.

"Oh, and one more thing," Amanda added. "If you do try and tell anyone, you'll and they will find that their reality

alters so that everything is like they have always been the old lady or man they have become. They won't know

you as the younger you, they'll just think they have always been this older person who knows you in some way."

"Eh, I guess so. So no tellin and everythin is fine, right?

"You learn quickly for someone so old."

"You betcha there dearie," Stacy cackled.

"I hope so. Now, would you like some tea?

"Sure would, fer some reason that sounds jes fine."

"Then let's make sure we have you wearing Depends."

"Them big didies? Yeah, I did put one on, though didn't want to. Only gets leaky now and again Did I ever tell ya

bout my wild party days?"
