1511321.title: Jessica, Stacy's Best Friend

15113211.content:
As soon as Jessica stepped through the doorway, her body didn't feel quite right.

She felt a head rush sort of sensation, and placed a hand on the back of the couch in the living room to brace herself.

"It's like my energy just up and left me," she replied, and then wondered what was up with her voice, "and you mentioned that you were Stacy's caretaker for the week? Why would she need one? I mean, the girl is 18 after all--did I just call her the girl?"

"Yes you did, though she is anything but at this point," Amanda laughed.

"I don't get the joke young lady," Jessica muttered a moment later, at this point realizing her body felt different, even her mannerisms and her mode of expression, yet...

they weren't what they were before she came through the door. It felt as if...

"Feeling like yeeer bod's been hi-jacked by father time?" came the quavery, voice of a little, white haired old lady that just entered the room.

"MMhhmmm," replied Jessica, struggling to get her bearings. Something seemed familiar about this lady, yet she couldn't say what. For that matter, her brains weren't working at quite the same pace, and now her vision had gone fuzzy.

"Try usin yeer glasses Jess," the old lady told her, though she couldn't for the life of her recall wearing any.

"They are resting on your chest, on the cute beaded chain I made ya fer them," Stacy replied, as she wandered over to her friend and took the cool metal frames in her fingers

and gently placed them on her nose.

"That better Jess, or would ya prefer not ta see what I dun, eh?"

"Stacy?"

"I wondered how long it would take you to recognize your old, and I do mean OLD, friend," Amanda replied with a chuckle.

"Whas, whas happening to me?" Jessica wondered perplexed, as her friend took her by the hand and escorted her to the bathroom. Her body felt foreign to her, it didn't seem to function the same. Her fingers looked...like moms? She pondered this as her friend, yet how could that be her friend as Jess was only 18, wasn't she? 1511322211.content:
Wendy looked around. "Where's Stacy?" She asked. She continued on into the living room and spotted the old woman sitting there. She looked familiar, but Wendy was certain she'd never seen her before.

"Who are you?" Wendy might have been a grandmother, but she wasn't quite as old as the lady sitting in her daughter's living room. The woman seemed ancient. "Where's Stacy?"

The woman looked at her. "What's that, dearie?"

"I'm looking for Stacy...who are you?" She said, speaking up.

"Stacy...that's my name," the old woman said.

"But Stacy is eighteen, and you're..."

Stacy seemed to search her memory. "I was eighteen once..." she said, trying to remember. Her memories were all jumbled and confused. Was it 70 minutes ago she'd been eighteen, or seventy years? "It seems like a long long time ago."

Wendy turned around to leave and spotted Amanda standing in her path. "What in heavens name is going on here?"

"We're having tea," Amanda said. "Would you like some?"

Wendy stared at her. "That woman in the chair...she says her name is Stacy. That's my granddaughter's name. And my granddaughter is eighteen." She felt suddenly flushed as she said it.

"Well, if you don't mind my saying, you don't look old enough to have a granddaughter. What year were you born?"

"1947..." Wendy said, without thinking. There was something definitely odd about this woman.

"That would mean you were eighteen in 1965...What was that like?"

Wendy's eyes glazed over a bit. "The Beatles were going to appear on the Ed Sullivan show..." she trailed off. "Ed who?"

Reality began to shift, as Amanda had promised. But, for anyone who realized what was going on who already was old...it would go in reverse.

The years began to melt off of Wendy. Her dyed hair became a natural brunette. Her figure rebloomed... Before long, there was an eighteen year old girl standing there.

more angular, and even her clothing changing. She now wore red capri pants, with a gold pol shirt with the collar turned up and a large bobble necklace of blue.

She passed forty, and thought about her son just starting high school, as fine lines started to appear on her face and a long lock of white gracing the one side of her face. Her

in high school , now they were both in their early fifties and entering menopause. She fanned herself as a hot flash hit, rapped her sweater tighter around her and adjusted the

"I...spose so, yeah, guess it might be," Stacey replied, still wondering what was happening to her as she passed 69, and allowed herself to be lead into a nearby salon.

"Tanya, this is my client Miss Stacey. She needs the usual, if you get my drift."

"I'm kind of busy," Tanya responded, before she realized who had spoken.

"My dear, as I've stated before, you do and always will have time for me. Otherwise, I will certainly have time for you. Remember?"

Just then the tanned young stylist found swatches of white in her red locks along either side of her face, as well as laugh lines, crow's feet, and her vision blurring.

Fortunately, she knew where she had left her glasses and proceeded to put them on. At which point she was greeted with the vision of a middle aged woman in clothes

more appropriate for someone in her mid twenties.She had an outfit in the backroom that would look better she could change into shortly. Her skin had started to look more

like worn leather, and her voice came out deeper than when she last spoke.

The fifty year old Tanya looked at Amanda and replied cautiously,"Yes, of course sweetie pie, I can most certainly find a spot for Miss Stacy, always happy to oblige."

Not too long after, the 78 year old left with Amanda, now sporting a short, pin curl perm. They picked up a few more things, and then Amanda lead the 88 year old who leaned

on a stylin, colorful, cane back to the car.

"Now that wasn't so bad, was it?"

"Hmm, eh dearie, spose not, no spose not. Now, you did remember to pick up my pills, the Depends, and my denture cleaner?"

"Of course I did...remember, I did tell you I take care of grandparents...like yourself, didn't I?

"Yes dearie, I do recall ya mentioned that," she rattled, as they drove away.

Not long after, they pulled back up to her home, and Amanda helped the 94 year old out of the car, and lead her slowly toward the house. Stacy shuffled along beside her,

bracing the other hand along her mid back. She wondered what had happened, where her family had gone to, where the years had gone.

As Amanda helped her through the door and into her rocking chair, she looked at her quizzically and rasped, "Where'd it go?"

"Where'd what go my dear?" Amanda asked innocently, as she placed a blanket on her charge

"My youth...I know sumpin happened...jus not what...things kinda a blur...did you...make me this...old?"

"Well, I did tell you I cared for grandparents."

"But...why? And, how'd ya get all a my stuff...I know I didn't see, see ya pay fer it there young un?" she puzzled aloud, trying to make sense of what had happened to her.

"Top answers on the board," came the hosts voice from the show as Stacy watched.

"So grams, how goes it? Seeing in cute guys at the senior center lately?"

Samantha laughed. "That can happen at any age. My voice...does it sound different to you?"

"Well," Stacy started and then replied,"oh dear."

"What is that supposed to mean? And, why do I seem to be thinking of my biological clock suddenly?"

"Hon-ney, ah theenk yeer lookin more like yeer ma...by thee second."

Actually, she had just passed into her forties and seemed to be accellerating.

Samantha dashed to the bathroom in time to see fine lines and crow's feet start showing.

"Hey, my hair is going gray too...and my clothes....and my hairstyle," she moaned.

"Ah was fraid a this," Stacy replied.

"And what is with these glasses, and why do I feel so hot--I feel like I am burning up!"

"You are aging dear," Stacy informed her as she hit 57 and got even older. Her hair had gone to a gray and brunette mix, and she now had pink reading glasses on a beaded

chain on her red, long sleeved silk blouse. It was open for a couple of buttons to reveal the top of her neck and a touch of her now more relaxed breasts, which she picked this

moment to notice.

"My bouncy babies, you are losing the battle," she cried.

"Yeah, the sag has started to set in," Stacy told her, as Samantha headed back, albeit more slowly, into the living room.

a seat.

"That's be dentures...yeah, dearie."

"Weell, ah guess bein an old lady mus come with em---as well as granny panties and...am I wearin didies?"

"It will finish up shortly sweetheart, and the mature look suits you, just like the purple jogging suit with gold sequins and the gold sequin tennis shoes, and the elegant silver cat's eye bifocals with that beaded chain," she told the now 66 year old.

and it was time with her friend Amanda. They could sit and reminisce, talking about he boys they used to date. Who'd have thought they'd be

middle aged women now. Something nagged at her though...something told her this could not possibly be...even screamed it at her from

somewhere back in the nether regions of her mind.

"Here you go," Amanda said as she handed her the wine glass, and sat down with one of her own. Amanda was a few years her junior,

Stacy being the older of the two at 52 as compared to Amanda's 46, yet they had met on the job and become good friends.

As that voice came back into her mind, she voiced her concerns out loud.

"Amanda dear, I know this is going to sound bizarre...but..."

"Go ahead Stacy old gal, spit it out. We're not getting any younger...well, at least you aren't," she replied with a grin.

"Yes, and I'm getting younger. Congrats, you did figure it out. I wondered how long it would take before I had to tell you the story."

"Story, what story there girlie?" she inquired, as she passed 65. Her hair had gone mostly gray now, and her skin had taken a more weathered look.

"It all began..."

1553311.content:
"Well, you see, you are slowly going to get even older tonight. Older than Grandma Jenna. And as you get older, you are going to slowly think that you are Jenna's older sister. Right now you are 65, and she is 85. So, sorry to say... you'll be older than 85 by the end of the night." Amanda couldn't help but to chuckle.

"And... you expect me to not freak out because of that?" Stacy said, as she tried to process what was happening.

"Well, see, that won't be an issue. Because the more you talk to Jenna, the more you will not worry about growing older. In fact you'll think it's normal that you are Jenna's sister, and that I'm your granddaughter...

"Wait, what?" Stacy asked.

"Oh, yeah, that's right. I'm going to be your 18 year old granddaughter too. Won't that be fun!" Amanda said.

"Why? Why are you doing this?" Stacy asked.

"Well, Stacy, you needed to slow down, and see that life is something you need to enjoy! You need to see that growing up is not a bad thing. Now, Jenna's waiting for you." Amanda smirked.

info.brief_description: Stacy is about to have a babysitter that will transform her life forever!
info.description:
"MOM! I'm 18! I don't need a babysitter!" Stacy complained to her mother.

"Stacy, you do after what happened last time! How can I trust you after that whole situation. Now I'm leaving right when she gets here. Now remember...."

Stacy stopped paying attention after that. She can't believe this. The last time her parents went out of town for a week, she threw a party, not even thinking that her parents would ever catch her. However, A neighbor snitched on her and now she has to be babysat by a complete Stanger? She thinks it is insane how one of the most popular kids in school, a cheerleader nonetheless, must be watched by someone she's never even met. He's not a baby, she's a grown woman! Stacy twirls her blonde hair as the doorbell rings.

"That must be her," says Stacy's Mom as she opens the door. "You must be Amanda!"

Stacy looks at Amanda as her Mom gabs about emergencys. Amanda has black, flowing hair, with a nice smile. She has three bags with her, and she looks to be anywhere between 45-50. Before Stacy knows it, Mom has left, and there she is alone with Amanda.
